pyu: a tilin a patalro kana sēho sibalo kana yēncominco i Ceaiy ing on soto
english: President Tsai Ing-wen's Apology to the Indigenous Peoples on Behalf of the Government.

pyu: pakangowayan kana makabetraan misama dra drowaya ami garem kana wari. nanta inasalr temelro kana siyēnhoa i sabak na "sanpaw" i, pinatedrelran lra pongalad dra "yēncomin" kema. idri na penatedrelr na ngalad i, amelri a maomao emitrol drato ipowangalad na melralrimos na temariyaama. mangaleb korenaowan lra to kinaretigiran. "amao na miyadare" kadri Taiwan kema kana yēncominco. maretigir kandri na danapan i isatr. garem kana wari i, piyangowayan ta penasa dra sadepa. aro patatalro ko kana sēho. sasongal mi kanemo. panaowa mi driya kanemo dra naniyam kinaasabakan dra naniyam sibalowa igelayan kanemo kana yēncominco driya mapiyapiya. kananemo kinakawangan a adriyo driya kana pata leman amiyan i, nanemo kinodrekodran mo kinaolepan. aw na adri pinarisan na adri penaowa to iyanao kanemo i, patalroa ko driya kana sēho semongal kanmo.
english: On this day 22 years ago, the term "shanbao" (mountain people) in the Additional Articles of our Constitution was replaced with the proper name: "indigenous people." This correction not only did away with a discriminatory term, but also highlighted the status of indigenous peoples as Taiwan's "original owners." From this basis, today, we are taking another step forward. To all indigenous peoples of Taiwan: On behalf of the government, I express to you our deepest apology. For the four centuries of pain and mistreatment you have endured, I apologize to you on behalf of the government.

pyu: pakopanaan ko. palro garem kananta kinakadrowan i paliyoliyos i, olraya driya a miyasama a trao na aemana pakalrang kandri na sibalowan kema to wanger. idrini i, amao to rami drananko iyadrowa kadrini kana wari garem. drowa ko patalroa kana sēho semongala kanemo. na kinadriwan driya na trao to nirangeran i, an semamisi ta dra trao i, kakoda amaw, an alodron lra, an maolep lra drato kinabaawan i, nanto kakakawang idrono i! aro kakoda mi amaw kema to nirangeran dra trao i sidromayan. drowa mi garem maretigira kadrini. amao naniyam kiniyangeran na palralribakan meliyos aw benelis.
english: I know that even now, there are some around us who see no need to apologize. But that is the most important reason why I am representing the government to issue this apology today. To see what was unfair in the past as a matter of course, or to treat the pain of other ethnic peoples as an unavoidable part of human development, this is the first mindset that we, standing here today, resolve to change and overturn.

pyu: ti pakalranganay dra apatraran dra ngai pakalradram. moka dra manay daw semongal ko kana yēncominco. pakangowayan kana pata leman amiyan i, kandri kana dare i Tiwan. olraya lra a trao a kikaadro. nadri na trao i, olraya to piningaiyan, olraya to kakowayanan to lregiyan, olraya to nirabakan to baboyolr kanto dare. salaw inaba to iwabaaw. likodran lra i, pabekobeko lra drowa kikadrowa a kemay i sidromayan a trao a saleponan.
english: Let me put in simple terms why we are apologizing to the indigenous peoples. Four hundred years ago, there were already people living in Taiwan. These first inhabitants lived their lives and had their own languages, cultures, customs, and domains. But then, without their consent, another group of people arrived on these shores, and in the course of history, took everything from the first inhabitants who, on the land they have known most intimately, became displaced, foreign, non-mainstream, and marginalized.

pyu: nadro na saleponan na trao na pakalikodran drowa i, to araway to pinimanayan peniya kana korengaway kikadrokadro na trao. to borekay lra nanto kinaladaman na dare. aw meresis lra motosidromayan lra. adri to seeran lra aw makasanininin lra. to iwadaway to kinakeseran dra samaowan i, alra moka drato tinariyamayan to kinaolepan kana droma maowan. an adri ta maranger patrirebeng pakalradram drata kanatal dra, amao mi na saigo parisarisan an kakowa ta i, aro pasaseket ta menao kandri kana nilrangan. aro babati ta kana penanaan. na sēho i, kapananaan parebeliyas kemiyanger drato pinakalrangan kinadrowan. idrini i, amao ko iyadrowa garem maretigira kadrini to paowayan.
english: The success of one ethnic people can be built on the suffering of another. Unless we deny that we are a country of justice, we must face up to this history. We must tell the truth. And then, most importantly, the government must genuinely reflect on this past. This is why I stand here today.

pyu: olraya a saya a tilin. "Taiwan tong se" kema. to tinililran i, "i Taiwan i, oniyan dra tilin dra nilrangan. to parebowaaw kana Helan; to tililray kan Cencenkong; to palenakanay kana Cingtay." idri to iyanao i, panaan dra makapairang. na yēncominco kana pakangowayan dra monoma lra kodrolr amiyan i, kikadro lra kandri kana dare. aw olraya to kakowayanan to kinalradraman a salaw bolay. to trongotrongolraw to tralitraliyaw. amawna, ta iyanao i, pakalranganay drata ikakeser temililr dra nilrangan. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana yēncominco.
english: There is a book called "The General History of Taiwan" published in 1920. In its foreword are these words: "Taiwan had no history. The Dutch pioneered it, the Koxinga Kingdom built it, and the Qing Empire managed it." This is a typical Han view of history. The truth is that indigenous peoples have been here for thousands of years, with rich culture and wisdom that have been passed down through generations. But we only know to write history from the perspective of the dominant. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pyu: a koredikes driya kana Helan aw kan Cencenkong i, to ranakaw pinatray aw to raperapay to pinimanayan na Pinpoco. kana Cingcawsetay i, masaseredr palro dra marepinatray aw to depedepanay. kana Dripong lra i, to pakasayay temariyama patarisesek. palro kana drowa lra na Minkok i, parekasenengaw na makadrenadrenan aw na marayarayas na sanpaw. pata leman amiyan lra. na drowa driya koredikesa kadri Taiwan i, to pakalranganay drato kedrang demepedep emaraw dra dare. to araway drato kinoredikesan kana yēncomin. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana yēncominco.
english: The Dutch and the Koxinga Kingdom massacred and exploited the Pingpu ethnic group. The Qing Empire presided over bloody confrontations and suppression. Colonial Japan put in place comprehensive savage policies. And the post- war ROC government undertook assimilation policies. For 400 years, every regime that has come to Taiwan has brutally violated the rights of indigenous peoples through armed invasion and land seizure. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pyu: na yēncominco i, to pakalranganay kanto kakowayanan to lregiyan. morekes kemirongetr pakabolay drato drekalr. aw kemay kanto kinalradraman parepaowaowa drato wabaawan. amawna, kana gareman na kanatal, kana demadaway kanto kinoretan na kowarenangan i, na yēncomin i, molremes lra to kowaredikesan dra kiyakaronan. moparesis lra to niyamonan dra drekalr. adri lra to seeran to inokasayan kana maonan. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana yēncomin.
english: Indigenous peoples maintain tribal order according to traditional customs, and ecological balance according to traditional wisdom. But in the process of modern state-building, indigenous peoples lost the right to steer their own course and govern their own affairs. The fabric of traditional societies was torn apart, and the collective rights of peoples were not recognized. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pyu: na yēncominco kemay awatr kadro lra to piningaiyan. pakalranganay kana Dripong driya to potodripodripongaw. kana 1945 amiyan i, rengay temaraminkok kema na sēho. to pakasayay benoot marengay drato piningaiyan. amao na molralremes lra to piningaiyan kana yēncominco. to ngaiyan kana Pinpoco i, marasadro lra na molremes. kana koredikes driya na sēho i, adri pakirongetr palenak melrama drato kakowayanan kana yēncominco. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana yēncominco.
english: Indigenous peoples had their own languages. However, with Japanese rule aiming to assimilate and turn all into imperial subjects, and with the ROC government banning tribal languages after 1945, indigenous peoples' languages suffered great losses. Most Pingpu languages have disappeared. Successive governments have been negligent in the protection of indigenous cultures. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pyu: adrono kana ami. adri malradralradram dra mamanamanay na Yami kadri Botrolr. na sēho to okayaw apetraw na hehoyliyaw i Botrolr. na maowan kadri Botrolr. to alodronan to binolian drato anger i, a kemay kana hehoyliyaw. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana maowan i Botrolr.
english: Without the knowledge of the Yami tribe, the government stored nuclear waste on Orchid Island. Tribe members on the island had to suffer the negative consequences. For this, I apologize to the Yami people on behalf of the government.

pyu: kemirami to drinowayan i Taiwan kana kemay i sidromayan na trao. na kikaadro i makadrayadraya kana marayarayas na Pinpoco i, amao na pinalribakan korepatrepa. na drowa driya koredikesa kadri na trao i, to itrolaw aw to ribasaw to ngalad kana karamisasayan lra, nanto maonan lra, to ikapinpoco. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana Pinpoco.
english: Ever since outsiders began arriving in Taiwan, the Pingpu ethnic group on the western plains have born the brunt of the impact. One ruling power after another eroded the individual and collective identities of the Pingpu ethnic group. For this, I apologize to the Pingpu ethnic group on behalf of the government.

pyu: kana mobalis lra na lremak i, na kanatal kadro to iyatobang kana mincoyontong drato kiniamiyan kana yēncominco. na sēho i, "aiwa!" aw niyam kiyangeraw aw pakirongetra mi kema. garem i, olraya a salaw inaba a kinoret a tilin "yēncominco cipenhoa." amawna, idri na tilin na kinoret. adri to seeran kana sēho kana kiyakaron kandrini. naniyam kinikaronan i, powari lra, adri to rabaki peniya lra, adri driya penaowa. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana yēncominco.
english: After the democratic transition, the country began to respond to the appeals of indigenous movements. The government made certain promises and efforts. Today, we have an Indigenous Peoples Basic Law that is quite advanced. However, government agencies have not given sufficient weight to this law. Our actions have not been fast enough, comprehensive enough or sound enough. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pyu: salaw mingalad na Taiwan dra, "marekamenimeni dalaman to kakowayanan." kema. amawna, palro garem, na yēncominco kemay kananto kaarekedran to dradrek lra, to takakesian lra, to wabaawan lra, to kowarenangan motogiing lra. kandri to kowarenangan na marekodakoda i, adri pakadalrep kana Paireng. aw to iyanao kana yēncominco dra kemadro kemadro kema. aw drato iyalrimos itariyama kana yēncominco i, adri moasalr. idrini i, amao na sēho na adri penaowa to kinikaronan. to pakakowatisaw lra aw mialodronan lra to anger kana yēncominco. moka kandrini i, patatalro ko kana sēho semongal kana yēncominco.
english: Taiwan is known as a culturally diverse society. But even today, indicators on health, education, economic livelihood, political participation and more still show gaps between indigenous and non- indigenous peoples. Meanwhile, stereotypes and even discrimination against indigenous peoples have not gone away. The government has not done enough, so indigenous peoples have suffered pain and frustration unknown to other ethnic peoples. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pyu: adri penaowa naniyam nirokedrangan. aw motrongotrongolr a amiyan i, adri mi palamo marolradram. amao na kemay kaniyam kinaadriyan pakirongetr. aw niyam pakaolepaw mo palro garem. iowa dra igelayan kemaya ko driya. ko iyasongal garem kana wari i, alra powari lra dradro. amawna, amao a kiyaramiyan lra. adri ko kemiyanger dra, pakalranganay dra saya tilin, dra saya ngaiyan dra igelayan kema. aw mopoalak moparayas to kinodrekodran na alodronan to kinabolian to anger kana yēncominco. amawna, panaan ko dra kiyalriman. idri ko iyasongal garem kana wari i, amanaya aw, na morabak driya kandri na kanatal na tratraotrao. amao to kiyaramiyan marekainabanaba kema ko.
english: Our efforts have fallen short, and succeeding generations have been blind to this inadequacy. Because of this, your hardship has continued to this day. For this we are truly sorry. Today's apology is long overdue, but it is a beginning. I do not expect any one speech or phrase of apology to wipe away four centuries of pain and suffering by the indigenous peoples. But I do hope with all my heart that today's apology will set this country and all its people on the path towards reconciliation.

pyu: ti pakalranganay drato kinalradraman kana yēncominco. pakalradram to paowayan dra iowaadrok garem. kananto piningaiyan kana Taiyal na maowan i, na "penanaan"i "balay" kema. na "parekainabanabayan" i "sbalay" kema. na penanaan aw na parekainabanabayan i, marisan to paowayan. na panaan na marekainaba i, aoka drata nirangeran moka trempaya kandro kana penanaan i, karowa ta melaesi.
english: Please allow me to shed light on this occasion with a piece of indigenous wisdom. In the Atayal language, truth is called "Balay," and reconciliation is called "Sbalay," so you simply add an "S" sound to "Balay." Truth and reconciliation are in fact two related concepts. In other words, only by facing the truth sincerely can reconciliation be attained.

pyu: kananto kakowayanan kana yēncominco. an kadro a trao a benoli dra droma dra trao i drekalr. an maranger marekainaba. na yawan i drekalr. to daolraw na benoli aw na binolian miyadrowa. aw to pararotongaw. adri payas semibalo. to parengayaw driya drato pinakalrangan nadro na miyadrowa. an mokalradram driya na penanaan i, karatakitakilr karatreketrekel lra nadro na maaidrangan. na bolretreng lra i to paelipasaw peniya. idrini i, amao idro na parekainabanabayan to paowayan.
english: In indigenous cultures, when a tribe member has offended another and intends to reconcile, an elder brings together the offender and the offended - not to produce a direct apology, but to allow each side to frankly share their inner journeys. When this truth-telling concludes, the elder calls for everyone to drink together, so that what is past is truly past. This is "Sbalay."

pyu: kiyalriman ko kanta inowadrokan garam. amao na sēho aw na yēncominco to parekainabanabayan lra. na pinamelriyan a kinadriwan driya, na penanaan a kinadriwan driya i, adriya ko semama aw ti polrataw benabati. an garemay i, aro rarengay drato kiniyangeran na yēncominco. adri ko malemo kiami kanemo dra payas kilraman garem. amawna, kadrowa ta kiyaangeran kemaya ko. aw na pinamelriyan a kinadriwan i, adri lra aasalr. likodran lra idri na kanatal i, adrikaadri moka trempaya kana parekainabanabayan.
english: I hope today's occasion can be a "Sbalay" between the government and the indigenous peoples. I have spoken of past mistakes and truths the best I can, with nothing held back. In a moment, our indigenous friends will speak. I do not dare ask you to forgive, here and now. But I sincerely ask you to sustain the hope that past wrongs will not be repeated, and that one day, this country can see true reconciliation.

pyu: garem i, amao na kemiyarami driya. alra parekainabanaba dra adrii, amelri to tratrepa benasak kana yēncominco aw kana Pinpoco. olraya kana sēho. malradram ko. an to pakalranganay dra indan marengay dra igelayan kema i, adri driya penaowa. alra owadaway nay idri na parekainabanabayan. aro nanao ta kana sēho drananto kinikaronan to ipakababolay kana yēncominco kakowa ta.
english: Today is only a beginning. The duty for reconciliation lies not with the indigenous peoples and the Pingpu ethnic group, but with the government. I know that words of apology alone are not enough. What we actually do for the indigenous peoples will decide whether reconciliation succeeds or stumbles.

pyu: kaadro ko kadrini patrirebeng marengay. na Congtongho i, aro pararagan dra "yēncominco drise cengi aw na cowansing cengi oēiyēnhoy." pakakalrang ko kananko itaodrong kana kanatal. aw kowaredikes ko kana demaolr paradrok dra trao. wakasakasa kana kasamaomaowan to pinotrepayan moka trempaya kana nilrangan na penatedrelr. aw pararisan ta kinaretigiran madrayadrayar dra kowadakodayan paragan pakamakeser kananta kanatal.
english: Therefore, I am here to announce that we are setting up an Indigenous Historical Justice and Transitional Justice Commission under the Presidential Office. As the head of state, I will serve as convener and work hand in hand with tribal representatives to pursue historical justice. We will also discuss, on the basis of equality, the future policy direction of this country.

pyu: pasaseket ko marengay. na oēiyēnhoy kadri Congtongho. to pinakapadrangalan menao i, amao na kanatal aw na yēncominco i mararisan to kinaretigiran. na modaway na cice i, kemay kana kasamaomaowan pinotrepa. aw morabak na Pinpoco. na maonan lra aw na drekalr lra i, to pakakalrangan kemay kananto pinarekalradraman. idri na kinoretan i, amao to wakasayan kemoret kana yēncominco. karowa popatraran drato kiniyangeran kana yēncominco.
english: I want to stress that this commission places the greatest importance on equality between the country and the indigenous peoples. The election of tribal representatives, including for the Pingpu ethnic group, will take as basis the consensus of peoples and tribes. This commission will serve as a mechanism for collective decision-making by indigenous peoples, and will ensure that the voices of tribe members find true expression.

pyu: olraya driya a droma, aro paaisel ko kana sincengyēn kemoreta dra wari paradrok kana "yēncominco cipenhoa toytonghoēiy" drato padrayadrayaran. kemay kanto pinadrayadrayaran aw marepadonodonon drato kinoretan kanadro na oēiyēn. na sēfo lra i to pakowarenangan i sabak kana sincengyēn drato parepaowaowayan semeket kanto kinoretan. nadrini driya na kiyakaronan i, owarabak na aaya drato kinalradraman na nilrangan, na sasolrod kana Inanowayan na taytaya na kemirongetr, na parisarisan palenak dra piyamanayan, na trowalrtrolr dra palaladamanan malradram dra kakowayanan, na pakainabayan dra dradrek. na pakababolayan kanto kowaredikesan kana kaadro i sinkinki na mawan to powarabakan peniya.
english: In addition, I will request that our Executive Yuan convene regularly the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law Promotion Committee, and use the Yuan's authority to coordinate and handle matters related to any consensus reached by the above-mentioned commission. These matters include the following: to retrieve historical memories, to promote indigenous self-government, to seek fair economic development, to ensure continuation of culture and education, to safeguard indigenous health, and to protect the rights of urban indigenous peoples, etc.

pyu: na gareman na koret aw to kakowayanan to lregiyan kana yēncominco i, olraya to kinasaseredran dar. aw aro pararagan mi drato kiyarepaowayan dra "yēncominco howali hoo congsin." pakalranganay kandri to dinaway na kowarenangan. marowaya adri masaseredr drato kakowayanan kana yēncominco aw na gareman na koret kana kanatal.
english: Where modern laws and indigenous traditional cultures are at odds, we will set up an Indigenous Legal Service Center with a high degree of cultural sensitivity, to reduce through institutional design the growing clashes between indigenous customs and modern laws.

pyu: aro pakakaron mi kana morabak driya kandri na lremak. payasa koredikes melieli parepaowaowa. na yēncominco kemay kanto kakowayanan. kadro morabak kanto niyaboyolran. amelri a matrimatrima; amelri a sasamaan benaaw. to alropaw na garamgaman aw moka lra kandro modrimotr moimeng. madrayadrayara ta dra kowadakodayan pakabolay.
english: I will ask the relevant agencies to immediately pull together cases in which indigenous community members have been indicted or sentenced for hunting, where the hunting was done in accordance with traditional customs, on traditional lands, and for non-transactional needs, and where the animals hunted were not protected by conservation laws. For such cases we will deliberate solutions.

pyu: aro pakakaron ko kana morabak driya kandri na lremak. kemay drato inapetran na hehoyliyaw kadri Botrolr. kemodakoda to pinakalrangan kikaron i, popatrarana mo dra tilin dra penanaan. an adri driya mokalradram dra aapetran isowa i, marowaya ta semabong kana trao i Botrolr.
english: I will also direct relevant agencies to present an investigative report on the decision-making process of nuclear waste storage on Orchid Island. Before finding a permanent solution for the nuclear waste, we will provide the Yami tribe appropriate compensation.

pyu: aw, kemay kanta iyaseer kana Pinpoco drato ipakomaowan drato ikapinpoco. pakangowayan kana 9 bolan 30 wari i, aro padrayadrayar mi kandro na kinoretan. aw marowaya pasekat mokalradram to kowaredikesan to kinaretigiran kana Pinpoco.
english: At the same time, under the principle of respecting the Pingpu ethnic group's self- identity, and recognizing their identity, we will examine relevant laws before September 30 of this year, so that Pingpu ethnic group identity will receive the rights and status it deserves.

pyu: garem kana ami kana 11 bolan 1 wari i, aro patriyarebang mi pakalradram drato baboyoboyolr na dare kana yēncominco. na kinoretan na konghowalen i, semasolrod mi pakakawang garem. likodran i, to kiniyaangeran kana yēncominco na Yencominco cece na koret i, patatawar modalan. padowakedok mi garem. nanto kinapadrangalan menao kana yēncominco na "yēncominco cecehoa," "yēncominco toti aw hayiv hoa", "yēncominco yiēn hoacanhoa" nadrini i, aro tatolodran kana lihoayiēn parepaowaowa.
english: On November 1 of this year, we will begin to delineate and announce indigenous traditional territories and lands. The system of tribal public corporation is already in place. In the future, the ideals of indigenous self-government will be realized step by step. We will step up the pace and submit for legislative deliberation three laws of great importance to indigenous peoples: the Indigenous Peoples Self-Government Law, the Indigenous Peoples Land and Sea Areas Law, and the Indigenous Languages Development Law.

pyu: garem kana paelipas kana karealri na wari i, aro pararadrok mi kana yēncominco kandri kana padrayadrayaran. kaolralraya to pakalralradraman kana sēho. likodran kana aamiami kana 8 bolan 1 wari. na sincengyēn i, aoka pakalradrama kana trao driya kana kanatal dra kemodakoda lra to kinikaronan. na pasasekadran na penatedrelr to nilrangan kana yēncominco. pararagan drato danapan kana cece kana yēncominco. amao idro na tolowa to tratrepayan kana sēho.
english: Later this afternoon, we will convene a national indigenous peoples administrative meeting. In that meeting, the government will elaborate on the policies. On every August 1 to come, the Executive Yuan will report to the indigenous peoples our progress on restoring historical justice and transitional justice. To implement the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law, to serve indigenous historical justice, and to lay the foundation for indigenous self- government - these are the three major goals for the government's policy towards indigenous peoples.

pyu: dadaolr ko kana kadro driya kadrini garem. na kadro i ngowayan kana tilibi aw kana wanglo na yēncominco peniya. mokasaya ta motowasay. demaolr ko kanemo i dra, drowaya mo mokasaya temaranao kana sēho. torowi mi. paladamo mi. molaesia to itatobang kanemo kana sēho. panaana emasalr drato pinatrepelran a kinadriwan driya kana sēho.
english: To all of our indigenous friends here and watching on TV and online: I invite you to stand witness. I invite you not to endorse, but to oversee. Please keep pressure on the government and right its course where necessary, so that it will realize its commitments and right historical wrongs.

pyu: sasongl ko kanemo kana yēncominco peniya. amao moymo na parobalrok kana trao driya na kadro kadri kana kanatal, na dineelran na dare aw na belretrenganan na trongotrongolran i, salaw mitrima. adri ta karowa padrolon drato padrangalan. idri to padrangalan i, a powaloangan.
english: I want to thank all of our indigenous friends. You remind everyone in this country that there is irreplaceable value in the land we tread on and the traditions we inherit. This value deserves dignity.

pyu: likodran i, pakakalrang mi kana kinoretan semolrod. na marakiyalodosan na mawan, na motrongotrongolr na mawan, aw na kaadro driya kandri kana dare i Taiwan na mawan i, adri lra owalremes to piningaiyan; adri lra kaabalo drato kinabaawan; adri lra baboraw drato kakowayanan; adri lra drelalengan kanto kinadrowan driya kanto dare.
english: In the future, we will push for policies to ensure that succeeding generations of indigenous tribes and all ethnic peoples in Taiwan never lose their languages and memories, that they are never separated from their cultural traditions, and that never again are they lost in a land of their own.

pyu: kiyaami ko kana kadrowadrowanan na inokasayan. mokasaya ta merokedrang. malradrama ta drata nilrangan; malradrama ta drata dare. aw malradrama ta kanto kakowayanan kana adri marisarisan na maowan. mokaya ta kanta parekainabanabayan. trempaya ta kanta wakasayan mobaaw aw ta wakasayan pakabolay semangal aw trempaya ta kana pinakabekalan i Taiwan.
english: I call upon our entire society to come together and get to know our history, get to know our land, and get to know the cultures of our many ethnic peoples. Let us work towards reconciliation, a shared existence and shared prosperity, and a new future for Taiwan.

sinsi, adi ko miinada da valray.
english: Teacher, I didn't bring my textbook.

pyu: okasa mena'o kanano lralrang i capingiran.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

pyu: katalaolep ta lra, kilrivak no yavorok o i dadalan.
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

pyu: katalaolep ta lra, marepana'owa ta diya.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.
Hello everyone, my name is Apang.
Hello everyone, my name is Tulas.

pyu: i taina ko ni Amsing, i Tonon ko.
i wadi ko ni Ising, i Aping ko ngadan.
english: I am Ising's sister. My name is Aping.

pyu: mao nangko sinsi intaw, i Hako nanto ngadan
mao i valri intaw, i Maysang nanto ngadan.
i eman to ngadan ni vao na vavayan?
english: What is your elder sister's name?

pyu: i Saya nanto ngadan ni valri.
english: My elder sister's name is Saya.

pyu: i eman to ngadan ni wadiyo na vavayan?
english: What is your younger sister's name?

pyu: i Moymoy nanto ngadan ni wadilri.
english: My younger sister's name is Muymuy.

pyu: pidaya to 'ami ni vao na ma'inay harem?
english: How old is your elder brother?

pyu: mokecep misama' da lrowaca lra, nanto 'ami harem.
pidaya lra nanto 'ami ni wadiyo na ma'inay?
english: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

pyu: temakakesi o kani i dekalr na kongkowan?
english: Do you study in your tribe's school?

pyu: ai temakakesi mi i kongkowan mo, kemawan mi da saroma'enan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

pyu: mao i valri na vavayan intaw.
mao i wadilri na ma'inay intaw.
melri, nanto 'aliyan ni wadilri na ma'inay intaw.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

pyu: mao i vao na vavayan intaw?
melri. mao i wadilri na vavayan intaw.
english: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

pyu: oniyan ko da wadi a ma'inay, olra tatelo na vavayan ko wadi.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

pyu: ai, mao i valri na ma'inay intaw.
aretid pakiwalay na wari, tare'ao kana vi'as na danom.
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

pyu: vi'as pakiwalay na wari, tare'ao kana danom.
english: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

pyu: panana na kadaw, kilrivak da movaci'a mo da kadaw.
english: The sun is bright and be careful of getting sunburned.

pyu: kedemer na lonev, oniyan da kadaw i lokop.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

pyu: kaoniyan da kadaw no 'emanan, kasado na lonev di paacev na vali kema.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

pyu: kowadakoda na wari no ado awa?
english: How was the weather that time?

pyu: kararetid pakiwalay no ado, pikavang da pakaicas no mopacalan ta.
english: It was a bit cold and we needed to wear a jacket when we went outside.

pyu: kowadakoda na wari no kasede'an awa?
english: How's the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

pyu: dadali' lra na wari no ado, adi lra 'a'odalr.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

pyu: madiyadi lra na 'odalr, mopacalan lra na kadaw.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

pyu: ma'odalr lra, adi ko miinada da soko.
english: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

pyu: adi ma'odalr harem, 'a'odalr no piya ta kare'alri, pisoko no moiyan ta.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so we need to bring an umbrella when we go out.

pyu: kararetid no mare'ami na voceliyan awlra?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

pyu: ai, no mare'ami na voceliyan mo, kararetid dado, pikavang da sado.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

pyu: kanini na 'ami no deron mo, kavi'as awlra?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

pyu: ai, kavi'as no deron, tare'ao kana danom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

pyu: sahar ko kana kaseveran, sadeko na wari.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

pyu: adi ko sahar kana vencaceli, sado variw no vencaceli.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

pyu: ai, paverasay ko diya kanano impic ay?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

pyu: mekan ko da cinapayan na voyo.
owaowa lra ino, no maremay lra kayko lra maya'a kanno.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

pyu: inao, kayta diya makoca da valray mo!
english: No, we have to carry books first.

pyu: adi diya, lremalrisaw ko diya da kaysising.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

pyu: piya o lra lrimisaw da kaysing?
piya ko lra lrimisaw kanangko kaysing.
man adi o moras da lima?
english: Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

pyu: kakoda o no moroma' o kemay kongkowan?
english: What are you going to do after school?

pyu: kakoda no moroma' kemay kongkowan intaw?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

pyu: momo, i Saya di i Sahar mi, cowalray mi diya!
english: Grandma, we are Saya and Sahar, please open the door for us.

pyu: i Lahay ko, dowa ko maya'a kani Asang.
english: I am Lahay, I am here for Asang.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

pyu: sawariyan o lra adi dowa, salaw ko sare'ed kanno.
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

pyu: Moymoy, dowa ko maya'a kano kivangavanga.
english: Muymuy, I am here to play with you.

pyu: konamon osavak, mangarangara ko kanno mo!
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

pyu: mao nangko sinaleman ini na vorasi, talrami mekan a!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

pyu: kadika! mao nangko sinaleman na inaakan na vowa' ini, talrami mekan.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

pyu: tavo' ini na inaakan na vowa'.
kayan diya! mao nangko sinaleman na adi pinocemelan na kodomo nahni. talrami mekan a!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

pyu: wayi! salaw tavo' ini na kodomo.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

pyu: adi ko karowa mekan da vartenok, mekana ko kana linggo marowa lra.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, then I'll have one. Thank you!

pyu: komorica ko diya da inaakan na vowa' paakan kanno.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you first.

pyu: lrayowan! sado to danom ini na inaakan na vowa'.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

pyu: melaka ko da danom pa'ao kanno.
english: I will bring you some water.

pyu: kasadoyo mekan, sado ko dinero di tinosiyaw.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

pyu: wayi! pokasa kana ngolringolr di imaran a!
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pyu: kasadoyo mekan, olra diya sado kani.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I'll make myself at home then.

pyu: kasadoyo mekan, olra diya sado kani a!
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

pyu: sado lra ko inkan, adi ko lra marowa mekan.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

pyu: harem kana wari koy adayaw mo i henan.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

pyu: sado a pedped i henan kema i nani.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

pyu: harem kana wari koy adayaw mo i 'oma.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

pyu: toy adayaw ta i dinanoman na sinsin.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

pyu: yawa ta i iyan harem kana wari?
toy adayaw ta i henan na sinsi.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

pyu: yawa ta i dinanoman harem kana wari?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

pyu: melri, toy adayaw ta i henan na sinsi.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

pyu: yawa ta i henan harem kana wari?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

pyu: melri, yawa ta i 'oma harem kana wari.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

pyu: sinsi, yawa ta mena'owa da eman i dinanoman?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

pyu: sinsi, yawa ta mena'owa da eman i henan?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

pyu: yawa ta mena'owa data sinaleman na kodomo, kilrivak kana 'ivavoreng di na valri'acengan!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

pyu: sinsi, yawa ta pakolimaya i dinanomam?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pyu: melri, yawa ta mena'owa da tengteng.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

pyu: sinsi, yawa ta semalema da kolang i 'oma?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pyu: yawa ta kemangkanga harem kana wari.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

pyu: ngawngaway ko mena'o kana vaavaaw diya na tengteng.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

pyu: wayi! kana volay! sahar ko kanani na sirosiropan a!
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

pyu: olra na sirosiropan moviivii kadiyo a!
melri na sirosiropan ido, mao na valri'acengan ido.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

pyu: na'ona'o kani a! amana mokowa i dawilr mo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

pyu: ai, adi mi yawa i dawilr.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

pyu: amana pavekas, patawatawar kemakawang, mono koretapelra' o.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?

pyu: moicas ko da hikoki mokowa i Bokoto.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Green Island?

pyu: moicas ko kana sodang mokowa i Sanasan.
english: I go to Green Island by boat.

pyu: moicas da eman i Momoy mokowa i kongkowan?
english: How does Mumuy go to school?

pyu: moicas da kissiya i Momoy mokowa i kongkowan.
english: Mumuy goes to school by train.

pyu: moicas da eman i kadaw mokowa i Kalēngko?
english: How does kadaw go to church?

pyu: midinsiya i Kadaw mokowa i Kalēngko.
english: Kadaw goes to church by bicycle.

pyu: moicas o da ciēyon mokowa i kongkowan?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pyu: melri, moicas ko da bas mokowa i kongkowan.
english: No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?

pyu: ai, midinsiya ko mokowa i kongkowan.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pyu: moicas o da kawtiyē mokowa i takaw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pyu: ai, moicas ko da kawtiyē mokowa i Takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pyu: no mokowa o i valangaw mo, moicas o da kissiya? melri mo, mao na hikoki?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

pyu: moicas ko da hikoki, maradika na hikoki kana kissiya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pyu: no mokowa o i Valangaw mo, moicas o da bas? midosiya o?
english: Are you going to drive to Taitung or take the bus?

pyu: midosiya ko mokowa i Valangaw, marakalra'ayan kana bas no midosiya ko.
english: I will drive to Taitung because it is more convenient than the bus.

pyu: adi adalrep, miotobay ko mokowa i Sopermarket.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?

pyu: adalrep, kemakawang ta meredek ta lra.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

pyu: no mopacalan ta i ēki mo, makawang ta diya lrowaca vongkang mo, meredek ta lra.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

pyu: olra ko vangavangan harem kana wari, no 'emanan lra miwari ko lra!
english: I am out today. I won't be free until tomorrow.

pyu: no kemado mo, kayko lra mena'owa kanno no 'emanan piya ta lra kare'alri maw!
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pyu: kiyomalra ko diya, karowa ko pasirep kanano ngai? koy valrayaw kema ko.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

pyu: karowa ko pasirep kani di kanano dadek?
english: Would you mind if I do the video recording of here and you?

pyu: yi! adi ko piyamao di, adi inapecan ini na soko, manan.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.

pyu: no kemado mo, ko siyasingaw marowa lra.
english: Then I will just take photos.

pyu: ai! lrayowan kano mowai o diya kipakiomalr kaningko.
english: Alright! Thank you for accepting the interview.

pyu: ikaira! kiyaomalr o da eman diyamaw?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pyu: kiyaomalr ko diya kanno da lralrak o diya mo, aeman nano kiyakaronan?
english: What do you do when you are young?

pyu: kanggoho ko adiyo diya, harem lra mo, toysiw ko lra.
english: I was a nurse but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

pyu: nano alrak mo, olra kikado i dekalr?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pyu: adi, kaado i Tokay ko alrak.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

pyu: olra diya ko sowan a sasaya, di sasaya a 'ayam, mao lra nangko rinoma'enan nado mo!
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pyu: olra ko vinaaw a ngiyaw saya, mi'avalr ko da haramhaman mo, adi kasalrengseng.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pyu: maranger ko kiomalr da kapalisilisi na pararawayan.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pyu: adi ko kamadalraman, aymo, karowa ko tomovang dako kinadalraman.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pyu: miinada mo da eman na pa'a'alropan? olra eman na kapalisilisi?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pyu: naniyam pa'a'alropan mo, melri no sasihiwan na vavayan
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pyu: na vavayan mo, karowa marelrang mokowa pa'alropa?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

pyu: iya! salaw palisi kemado, adi karowa pa'alrop na vavayan.
english: No, that's a violation. Women cannot go hunting.

pyu: olra diya i sawka sadalilran, amana diya cemima'!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pyu: saya dalilran adi paowa, owa diya cima' dowa dalilran.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pyu: cacima' ko da koca, menaniwan mo da koca?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pyu: cacima' ko da dowaya dalilran, di cacima' ko diya da sayacavo na veras.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

pyu: olra kani na veras, olra diya nano cacima'an?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pyu: cacima' ko diya da vocinon, olra mo?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.

pyu: maranger o cemima' kana kemoda diyamaw?
english: What kind of clothes do you like?

pyu: cacima' ko kana lrikeci to 'aselr na kavang.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pyu: olra diya na doma na dolram?
olra diya na volreci' di na cangiya.
english: We have white and blue ones too.
Please give me the clothes in blue.

pyu: mokowa o i iyan haremay? mokowa o ondowa?
english: kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pyu: melri, mokowa ko polralranga kani molri meniwan da kolang.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pyu: ya! kemado! miwari o no karaov? mokasaya ta mekan kema ko.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

pyu: adi, yawa ko cemima'a da kavang.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

pyu: no kemado mo, marelranga ko kanno.
english: Then, I will go with you.
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

pyu: na kolang mo, saya voto' makavoca'an paiso.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

pyu: na vorasi mo, saya tingting makatelon paiso.
'aylra dowaya voto' kolang di saya tingting na vorasi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pyu: Vitoen, malalop ko miinada da impic, karowa o pavelas kaningko?
english: Vituen, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pyu: karowa o pavelas kaningko dika? dika ko pareveriyas kanno.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pyu: lrayowan! di lrayowan Kowayo lra i Vali maw!
english: Thank you and thank Vali for me.

pyu: pavaveriyas ko kanani na dowaya valray.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

pyu: kiyavelas ko diya kanani na telowa valray.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pyu: ai, ikalaalop no pokaapat wariyan mo, kadika preveliyas maw!
english: Sure and remember to return them on the fourth day.

pyu: adi o diya pareveliyas kaningko da aicor.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

pyu: piya ko lra pareveliyas a adaman.

english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

pyu: lramo no pavelasanay lra kani Udalr.
english: Maybe you lend it to Udalr.

pyu: taa, kayko diya kiomalra kantaw no kemado.
english: I don't know. If so, let me go and ask her first.
I will lend you my eraser first.

pyu: Vali, ini na kavang na pakaicas mo, ninto ipavelas kanno ni Vitoen?
english: Vali, did Vituen lend you this coat?

pyu: melri, ini mo, ninto iveray kaningko ni nani.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

pyu: maresan kanano kavang na pakaicas ni Vitoen.
english: Vituen's coat is the same as yours.

pyu: 'ode'odem nanto kavang na pakaicas, adi maresan naniyan dolraman/pinivalrayan.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pyu: Vali, kivelas o da paiso kani Vitoen?
english: Vali, did you borrow money from Vituen?

pyu: olra, pavaveliyas ko kantaw kanini na wari kema ko mo, malalop ko miinada da paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

pyu: no kemado mo, pavaveliyas o no aidan lra?
english: Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Vituen for you.

pyu: no papecir kana totos mo, pinangse'an da varasa', na tikolas mo, tinero'an kananto ni'en na pencir. penaowa no kinowado.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pyu: mao na kemado awlra di, ingko na pacepelr! semalra adi ko karaasa.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pyu: alra kono panadamay diya kana marekadowa na papeciran.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pyu: ai kasa lra 'inava! no kemani mo, kasayho ko lra penecir no kadaidan lra.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pyu: calowalon lra i 'oma, owa i soro alako diya nangko lingaw, kayta i 'oma.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pyu: olra i ngidiran kana 'ara, mosavak o i soro mo, nana'o o lra.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pyu: kilrivak, amana mopanana, idangan na lingaw.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pyu: kado i makaloso kana kawi nangko pecir.
english: My trap is under that tree.
Don't you forget where it was placed?

pyu: olra ko pinodongan kado, semalra madalram ko olra kani ko pecir.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pyu: solong ini. ta ca'anay i dinanoman kivolraw.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pyu: oniyan mi da solong, niyam pangasipay kana pangangasipan.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pyu: adi ko diya patalram da pangasipan, panadamay ko lra no kadaidan lra!
english: I have never tried a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pyu: ai! marelranga ta lra mokowa pangasipa no masalr lra.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pyu: no masalr lra mo, ko panadamay o lra demaway kana solong.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pyu: mahowaho lra nano pangangasipan, lramo olra mopangasip na volraw! pakonamoni kemedeng.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pyu: no maremay lra, mahinganghing dado na sodang, kemedenga ko kani, ino mo owa alakay ko kana ami kadiyo.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pyu: kedengo powa kaningko kani na volraw, kono polralrangay kemedeng.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pyu: 'inava dado a! miakan ta pakirev harem, matemoy lra na 'ara.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pyu: anlra! pakonamona ta moroma' po'acara data dinkalranan.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.
It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

pyu: telo liyosan no 'emanan, kayta kivangavanga ay!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pyu: kasede'an no 'emanan, rarelrang ko kani nani yawa mi i kiyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pyu: maranger ko mota', yawa ko i caca'iyan.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko tiyalr, yawa ko i caca'iyan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: karowa ko mokowa moras da lima?
english: May I go wash my hands?

pyu: maremay lra! owa lra no temalaolep ta lra!
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko cangoro', avorok ko no piya ta kare'alri.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pyu: ai, taranapaw lra, no owaroma' o.
english: Okay, take care and go home.

pyu: sinsi, no masalr diya kana liyosan sa sasede' ko, yawa ko kina'owa kana ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pyu: nana to tiyalr, olra i caca'iyan.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pyu: nana to tokeraw, semede' harem kana wari.
english: Teacher, Amsing has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pyu: rengay diya kano ieman di nanmo rinoma'enan i savak?
i Amsing ko ngadan, mokecep ko 'ami.
english: My name is Amsing, and I'm 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?

pyu: melri, i malri mo Pinoyomayan, i nani mo, pairang.
english: No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pyu: mao i temama idiyo? pidaya lra to 'ami?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pyu: melri, mao na dawdawan kaniyam i dekalr, makawalon lra to 'ami.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pyu: pidaya lra to 'ami ni vao na ma'inay?
marama'idang da sado kanno ni vao na ma'inay?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

pyu: sawaliyan ta lra adi marepana'o, tihasar o lra ay!
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pyu: ai, saleman makatelon ko lra vakesiw harem.
yawa ko i pankongse maya'a kana sinsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

pyu: olra i pakolalimayan, yawa kirepakowa kana pakolima no maremay intaw.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pyu: olra i iyan i Moymoy? yawa intaw kirepakowa kana pavekas no maremay.
english: Where is Muymuy? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pyu: olra i kiyokay, kayko marengaya kantaw.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

pyu: kayko cimima'a da kare'a'alriyan, no maremay kayko lra maya'a kanno.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.
Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pyu: owa aya'o na cao, yawa ko maya'a kana sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pyu: yawa i Amsing kirepakowa kana cacepokan da mali harem kana wari?
english: Is Amsing competing in croquet today?
No, he's competing in high jump.

pyu: no ondokay kana wari mo yawa o kirepakowa?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pyu: yawa ko mo! yawa ko kirepakowa kana pavekas.
yawa o kirepakowa no ondokay ado kana wari?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pyu: yawa ko kirepakowa kana cacepokan da mali.
ikakoda ta no ondokay ado kana wari?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

pyu: yawa ta kirepakowa kana makedekedeng da cali.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

pyu: naniwan ta kana akanen no ondokay?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

pyu: wa! moelak o kana pokaisa, tatena' o kana sayho!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!
Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pyu: oniyan, mopacalan lra haremay, owaroma' no 'aremeng lra.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pyu: olra i icas kana ki'edengan owa aya'o intaw.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pyu: mao i Amsing kowayo! sawaliyan ta lra adi marepana'o, 'inava o diya?
english: It's Amsing. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

pyu: 'inava ko, dowa ko maya'a kanno kimadayar.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pyu: olra i sawka semareser da kolang.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pyu: oniyan i temo, olra i 'oma, ngarayo intaw kani a!
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

pyu: sawariyan ta lra adi mena'o kanno, tihasar o lra.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.
It's so good to see you.

pyu: vaveray kanno ini na re'a, ca'ani i lralritekan.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pyu: sawaliyan o lra adi dowa, kowa so'oraw na rinoma'enan, mokasaya ta mekan.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pyu: amana mavangavang, 'emao ko diya da 'a'awan marowa lra, kayta i kalisowasowan madayara.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

pyu: semangalan lrayowan kanano sinadaro, avorok ko lra.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pyu: cinowakan haremay ini na voyo, adayo demero.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pyu: marekoret ta no 'emanan piya ta kare'alri ay?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pyu: 'inava no marekoret ta i kongkowan ai? pasasirep ta data ikakoda.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pyu: kayta i palakowan no kemado, piyakacing ko mokowa.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pyu: no movakal to 'apoc na sakola kaniyam i dekalr mo, pokasa kana volay, no ado kadika lra kaniyam ay?
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pyu: di ngangala ta palro kana kaseveran, sawariyan dado kema ko!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

pyu: no kemado mo, no katikelrowanan mi mo, kadika lra aya'aw ko ay!

english: Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pyu: kiwmalra ko diya, man kemado di moroma' o lra kikado?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

pyu: man kemado di adi o lra mowai kikado i tokay patakesi?
english: Why not teach in the city?

pyu: alra sare'ed ko kanangko dekalr, di maranger ko paveriyas dako kinasayho kanta dekalr.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pyu: sayho o temenon, i eman na panadam kanno?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

pyu: mao i molri na vavayan, kanta i dekalr mao intaw na marasayho temenon.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

pyu: man mianger o mokowa kipanadama kana temenon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pyu: na temenon mao nanta temowamowan to kakowayanan a adiyo diya, maranger ko polrepos kanini na kakowayanan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pyu: pokasa o kana sayho, karowa pida wariyan temovowavo'?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pyu: adi sawariyan, arowa saliyosan marowa lra. ta derowaw diya i lidingan na lrikecan, poloso ta lra mo, ta pare'oliyaw kana pikak, karowa lra powa i savak kana ngelrolr.
english: No, it only takes about a week. The glutinous rice is first steamed in a steamer, then mixed with the sake koji and put into an urn.

pyu: olra kaningko kamangolr di lakiw, mao nangko sinaleman peniya.
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

pyu: sahar ko kanini na kavang, pidaya paiso?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pyu: adi karowa, kasipon ko no polosoloso.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pyu: ai no kemado! 'aylra saya a 'ode'odem na kavang.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.
I want this knife and this pot.

pyu: dowaya kodolr paiso peniya, mao nangko dinaway ini a! tatena' karowa sawariyan pieman.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pyu: no ko adayaw nangko 'aliyan dowa cimima'a, karowa o poloso dato cima'?
english: If I bring friends over to buy, can the price be reduced?

pyu: ai! kono rehecay da dowaya leman paiso no kemado!
english: Alright! Let me deduct two hundred for you!

pyu: kadika na'owi! menaniwan mi da kavang di na talopong.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pyu: kiwmalra ko diya pidaya paiso na kavang?
na kavang saya mo, telo leman di makalrowac paiso, tolowa mo, sakodolr paiso.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pyu: cacima' ko saya marowa lra, 'aylra kanido na vekaran.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pyu: 'inavayan! cacima' ko da kinavelas di lramomo di na tinenger na tiwngan.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice,mountain Litsea and braised pork.

pyu: yi! mocima' lra na kinavelas peniya, olra diya na congyopin cacima' o?
english: The rice is sold out. I have scallion pancake, would you like to buy some?

pyu: ai! 'aylra diya saya no kemado, cimima'a ko lra no masalr lra.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

pyu: ai, kono cavowaw kana 'aliyoc, kemani mo, makalrowac paiso.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pyu: 'inavayan mapiya! i sinsi harem mo ori panaanadam kanta na akanen nanta piningaiyan na pinoyomayan mo kemoda ta marengay.
english: Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Pinuyumayan language for food.

pyu: sayho o kinger za to ngai ni sinsi?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

pyu: sinsi, ma'olid ko. karowa o ziya marengay parasan?
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?
I can't hear you, can you speak louder?

pyu: alra na'o kani! itorosi ko miyop parasan.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

pyu: sinsi, malalop ko mada za tratroli.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

pyu: sinsi, malalop ko mada za aivas.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.
Let's take a break after class.

pyu: ta palrowanay kani, zi no masalr na liyosan marepana'owa ta lra.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

pyu: to alrak ko ni Arimek. i Malikaw ko.
english: I am the son of Alimek, and my name is Malikaw.

pyu: to temakakesi ko ni Umang. i Adraw ko.
english: I am a student in Umang, my name is Adraw.

pyu: i eman to ngadan ni temama?
i Pilang to ngadan ni malri.
i intaw mo maw i valri, i Tanovak to ngadan.
english: He is my brother, and his name is Tanuvak.

pyu: i intaw mo i eman to ngadan?
to ngadan mo maw i Ciming.
aina ko kanintaw, na maralrak kani nani. i Panay to ngadan.
intaw mo maw i ngidalri, i Imay to ngadan.
english: She is my friend, her name is Imay.

pyu: moketrep misama' za zowaya to 'ami harem.
makalrowatr lra to 'ami ni malri harem.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

pyu: olra ko vao a zazowa zi sasa i wadilri.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

pyu: oniyan ko za vao za ma'inay.

english: There are four of us in our family.

pyu: aama ko kanintaw maw na maralrak kani malri.
i temama nanto petris ni taina na ma'inay kiyakaron za eman?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

pyu: intaw mo maw i valri na vavayan.
olra to kiyakaronan i vao na vavayan?
english: Does your sister have a job?
Yes, I'm from the Puyuma tribe.

pyu: i toroma'ano mo maw na yēncomin?
ai, maw mo a Bonon i intaw.
english: Yes, but he is a Bunun.
Yes, we are all very tall.

pyu: temakakesi lra i wadio na vavayan?
english: Does your sister go to school?

pyu: sayho marengay za ta piningaiyan na wadiyo?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

pyu: ai, sayho marengay za ta piningaiyan.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

pyu: salrangan o kazo kana temama za i taina?
english: Do you live with your parents?

pyu: ai, salrangan ko kazo kana malri za i nani.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
Do you live with your grandparents?
No, I didn't live with them.

pyu: salrangan o za i eman kazo?
salrangan ko kani malri za i nani zi i valri na ma'inay kazo.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

pyu: kazo i iyan namo zekalr aziyo ziya?
no aidan mo moroma' o i zekalr?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

pyu: no katalaolepan no deron mo ka'azi ko moroma'.
english: I will go back in the summer.

pyu: inko mo maw ko na Pinoyomayan na alrak.
kemakadaw lra zi, vi'as na wari.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

pyu: no karaov na wari mo kodaakoda awa?
iniyan za ronev i rokop zi mopapanayan lra na vito'en.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

pyu: maw ziya i dadali', kemakadaw zi mopatraran na patrala'.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

pyu: kemoda na wari i kaziyo kaninmo?

english: We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

pyu: aretid na wari zi powapowa mikavang.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

pyu: no haremay mo ori paatrev na 'odalr zi amanan na malalop mada za soko.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

pyu: zemerong a haremay zi, no haremay mo alra mo ori 'a'odalr.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

pyu: kamawan za 'emodalr lra, sapene' na dadalan.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

pyu: 'ema'odalr i patraran zi, 'azi ko mada za soko.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

pyu: patrev na vali, no korpavali ko mo nana ko trangoro'.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

pyu: vi'as na kadaw, korkadaw ko zi mapongaw ko.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

pyu: ai, tratrima' ko ziya za aivas.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

pyu: malalop ko veni'as za ko trinavo.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

pyu: no kara'alriyan aekan o za eman?
english: What do you want to eat for lunch?

pyu: aekan ko i kongkowan kana miēyo na kara'a'alrien.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

pyu: mada ko za trinavo zi ta karkanaw no kara'alriyan!
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.

pyu: ai, anzo ini na idap kowa varanay kanino.
english: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

pyu: alakanay ko ziya za topo a?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

pyu: maidap ko zi paalako i Tanovak.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Tanuvak to carry it for you.

pyu: milritra' na tairo zi owa itroli ziya.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

pyu: izo na lataw milritra' zi owa itroli ziya.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

pyu: no haremay lra, 'azi ko ziya piya midap kani.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

pyu: no moroma' o kemay kongkowan mo kakoda o?
english: What do you do after school?

pyu: salralrangan ko kanako ali' mokowa semenaya.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

pyu: no moroma' kemay kongkowan i intaw mo ori kakoda?
oniyan i intaw wa, kiomalra ko ziya eman nano ngangangai?
english: She's not here, what can I do for you?

pyu: imo, maw ko i Piing, alra trowalray ko ziya.
english: Grandpa, I'm Piing, please open the door.

pyu: kiomalra ko ziya maw i eman o?
Ameng, i Uyang ko, zowa ko maya'a kanino kivangavanga.
english: ameng, I'm Uyang, I've come to play with you.

pyu: ai yi! sare'ez ko kanino. alra alamo kararengarengaya ta za ta kinodakodayan!
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!

pyu: alra kayan, anzo a ociya alra 'aw.
english: Please sit down and have some tea.

pyu: wa kasa 'inava no 'emao ta kanamo ociya.
alra mekana ta kana inaekan na vowa'!
'inava yi! nanni na inaekan na vowa' kaimaramaran no mena'o ta.
piya lra demoro kana keraravien i nani zi alamo ekan!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

pyu: ai, morasa ko ziya za ko lima.
english: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

pyu: tarekan zi tar'awo, maw ta saroma'enan zi melri no trao o.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

pyu: vetrekel ko lra sazo lra ko inekan.
english: I ate a lot, I'm full.

pyu: averok ko lra, no dadaman zazowa ko ziya mena'owa kanino.
english: I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

pyu: ai, no miwari o mo alamo lra kivangavang kaniniyam.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

pyu: 'inavayan mapiya, harem kana wari inko na sinsi koy adayaw mo mokowa i zekalr kiomaomalra kana dawadawanan.
english: Hello everyone, today I'm taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

pyu: 'inava wa! iniyam mo karowa mi temarkatratripolr marengay kana dawdawanan.
english: Okay! We're going to say Katratripulr to the seniors.

pyu: imo, zowa mi lra mena'owa kanino.
english: Grandpa, we've come to see you.

pyu: wa sayho mo lra marengay temarkatratripolr yi! salaw kana 'inava!
english: You speak Katratripulr! That's great! *Please change the language to your native language.

pyu: 'inavayan mapiya, harem kana wari inko na sinsi koy adayaw mo mokowa kikarona kana 'oma na tinohosan za dawa.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

pyu: alamo otorik kania, amanan na malalop mada kana mo kiyakaron.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

pyu: ai, sinsi, mada mi lra kana niyam kiyakaron.
english: Yes, sir, we've got our tools.
Not yet, it's still far away.

pyu: owa alak za traptrapan na 'a'alrop kana 'ayam.
english: You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I'll go and catch the birds.

pyu: 'inavayan mapiya, harem kana wari awa ta kaziyo kana tongoyoan.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

pyu: wa kana 'inava! kakoda ta mokowa nay?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

pyu: motorika ta, padadolo ta tremima'a za kippo.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

pyu: i ngangowayan mo maw na 'ayam ziya, i likakozan mo maw na onan ziya, inmowaya lra na mena'ona'o.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

pyu: moziya za eman, owa na'o kana 'ayam.
english: It doesn't matter, then you go and watch the birds.

pyu: no lemavat za saya toki mo oveliyas mowazoka ta.
english: We'll be back in an hour.

pyu: mena'o ko lra sazo na onan zi sazo na 'ayam.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

pyu: ngarayo ko ziya, rapi' ko kowi.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

pyu: kazowan na trao i kania pakolalima.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

pyu: asavak i kaziyoa, kazowa ta kania pakolimalima marowa.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

pyu: moitras o za eman palizingan zowa?
english: What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

pyu: to poitrasaw ko i malri kana to palizing salrangan mi mokowa.
kana wari ziya kemoda mokowa i kongkowan i intaw?
english: How does he usually go to school?

pyu: moitras za ciyēyon mokowa i kongkowan intaw.
english: He took the subway to school.

pyu: i temo na vavayan kemoda mokowa tremima'a za sasiyawan?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

pyu: miotobay i molri mokowa tremima'a za sasiyawan.
english: My grandmother went to the grocery store by motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

pyu: waitras ko za sodang mokowa i Votrolr.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

pyu: kemoda mokowa i Votrolr i intaw?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

pyu: moitras za hikoki mokowa i Votrolr i intaw.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

pyu: moitras za eman palizing mokowa i Takaw intaw?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

pyu: moitras kana pa'a'evot na kissiya mokowa i Takaw i intaw.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

pyu: moitras za kissiya mokowa i Valangaw intaw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

pyu: ai, moitras za kissiya mokowa i Valangaw intaw.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

pyu: i intaw mo moitras za kissiya mokowa i Valangaw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

pyu: melri, moitras za hikoki mokowa i Valangaw intaw.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

pyu: i kani dalrep mo olra a waitrasan za bas?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

pyu: olra, mongawayan ta mo nana'o ta kana waitrasan za bas.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

pyu: na adalrep kani na ciyēyon olra i iyan?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

pyu: oniyan za ciyēyon i kania, maw maw a hayya karowa o moitras.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

pyu: moitras ta za bas no aidan raredek ta i kongkowan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

pyu: no moketrep misama' za lrowatra pongkang mo meredek i kongkowan.
no moitras ta kana pa'a'evot na kisiya no aidan raredek ta i Taicong?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

pyu: no saya toki mo raredek ta i Taicong.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

pyu: no pakakawang ta za palizing mokowa i Ulay mo kasawarariyan?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

pyu: moitras o za ciyēyon zowa kaniyam kasawarariyan?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

pyu: 'azi sazo ko kinazalram zi amanan kiomalray ko.
english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

pyu: miwari o no aloso a kadaw? maranger ko mokowa kiomaomalra kanino kararowa o nay?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

pyu: miwari o no 'emanan? maranger ko zowa kiomaomalra kanino kana vativatiyan na Pinoyomayan.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary story of the Pinuyumayan.

pyu: mikiningeran ko za salaw o mazalram kana to kakowayanan na kinawatranan na Pinoyomayan zi, maranger ko mokowa kipanadama kanino.
english: I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Pinuyumayan, so I would like to ask you something.

pyu: 'azi sazo ko kinazalram, maw mo nanko kinazalram ziya mo koy tatovangaw o.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

pyu: kiomalra ko ziya kararowa ko pasirep semasing awa? no ta kowaniyaw mo no dadaman lra mara madolo lra no venavalray ta.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

pyu: kiomalra ko ziya pidaya lra no 'ami harem?
makaiwa mikasaleman za walowalowa lra ko 'ami.
kiomalra ko ziya kemay i iyan o?
kiomalra ko ziya kanino i toroma'ano mo mawo a Pinoyomayan?
english: Is your wife also a Pinuyumayan?

pyu: melri, intaw mo maw na Amis.
sayho o marengay kana emaeman na piningaiyan?
sayho ko marengay kana ngai za Pinoyomayan zi ngai za Amis.
english: I can speak Amis and Pinuyumayan.

pyu: kana wari harem kasa ko semangal karowa ko kiomaomalr kanino, alra rengay ziya, kana pinakapalisi na watralonan mo?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

pyu: ai. a lralrak ko ziya mo marayas ko mozenan paalropa.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

pyu: lrayowan, salaw 'inava nano ipanadam kaninko harem kana wari.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

pyu: nako irarengay mo maw na tatena' peniya, to iyavilin marengay nanta temowamowan.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

pyu: harem kana wari na ko kiyaomaomalr ta palrowanay kania. salaw lrayowan kilrawa' kanano kinazalraman.
english: This is the end of my interview today. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

pyu: amanan na maira, masalra ta lra mazayazayar.
averok ko lra, mengaraya ta ziya no masalr mo marowaya ko ziya kinger za marasazo za vativatiyan.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.

No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy three packs.
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

pyu: niniyam lrawlraw mosama' lra za sadalilran.
english: We only have one bottle of oil left.

pyu: tratrima' ko za zowa veto' za kenaw.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

pyu: mosama' za telo veto' zi, trima'i peniya!

pyu: na satravo mo zowa leman paiso.
ta pokasayaw mo makavetra'an misama' za saya paiso, makavetra'an paiso marowa.
kani mo makaiwa misama' za lrowatra paiso.
tremima'a ko ziya trmolrtrolr palro saleman paiso.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

pyu: peniya mo lrowatra leman misama' za moketrep paiso.
arowa o lalehet kanizo na moketrep paiso zi lrowatr leman lra nako vaveray kanino mo?
english: Can you take $10 off and I'll give you $500?

pyu: pazangal zazo inia, karowa o kemadolo pakiwalay?
english: This is too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

pyu: 'azi, inia mo maw na dinolo lra.
english: No, this is already very cheap.

pyu: tratrima' ko kanini na satravo na walro.
english: I want to buy this packet of candy.

pyu: ini na walro mo makatelon paiso, maranger o ziya tremima' za zoma za eman?
english: $30 for this candy, anything else you need?

pyu: karowa ko kivelas za paiso kanino?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

pyu: malalop ko mada za paiso, kararowa ko kivelas za paiso kanino?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

pyu: yi, 'azi ko mada za paiso wa!
english: I don't have any money either!

pyu: inao, nano kinivelas na paiso 'azi o ziya palaoli' kaninko.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed.

pyu: kararowa ko kivelas kanano kavang awa?
kararowa ko kivelas kanano valray awa?
alra pavelasay ko kana no cidinsiya mo?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

pyu: ai, maw mo no 'emanan paveliyaso kaninko.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

pyu: 'ema'odalr lra zi, 'azi ko mada za soko, pavelasay ko za soko mo?
english: It's raining. I don't have an umbrella. Can I borrow one?

pyu: maw maw saya a ko soko zi, salrangana ta misoko!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

pyu: ini na valray mo maw nano ipavelas kaninko a daman zi ko palaoli'aw kanino.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I'll give it back to you.

pyu: no marangher o ziya mena'o za eman valrayan kararowa o marengay kaninko.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

pyu: maw no aidan pavelaliyas ko za paiso kanino?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

pyu: moziya za eman, no olra lra no paiso mo rengay lra.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

pyu: no aidan pavelaliyas o za paiso kaninko?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

pyu: no aidan palaaoli' o kananko valray?
english: When are you going to return my book?

pyu: ko palaoli'aw lra adaman kanino kemako?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

pyu: ini na tratroli mo to ipavelas ni Risem kanino?
english: Did Risem lend you this pen?

pyu: ai, ninko kinivelas kanintaw harem kana wari.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

pyu: ini na tratroli mo no kinivelas kani Risem?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Risem?

pyu: melri, ini mo to trinima'an ni nani.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

pyu: iniyan lra za 'ateri owa kivelas kani Imay za saeman za 'ateri.
english: We're out of salt, let's go borrow some from Imay.

pyu: owa rengayo i Panay za palaoli'an za ko paiso.
english: Go tell Panay to give me back my money.
How much does she owe you?

pyu: aowa ko i padorina'an semalema za kolang.
english: I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

pyu: tralowalon lra zi remarevay ko, no haremay mo powazanom ko.
english: There's too much grass, I'm mowing, I'll have to water it later.

pyu: alakanay ko za ringaw zi pitaw mo?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

pyu: no tra'anay i iyan ziya maw?
olra ipowa kana kangkang zi dipdip i ngidiran.
english: Put it next to the plow rake.

pyu: maw ko ziya volaliyas kana dare', no haremay 'apiyar ko lra.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

pyu: nano isalem na kolang arowa ta lra kikolang?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

pyu: na i kania na tamana mo arowa lra, na i kaziyo na tangongo mo 'azi ziya kararowa kikolang.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

pyu: wa! no kivorasiyaw a sakoniyani sazo a vorasi.
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

pyu: polralrangay ko powa i soro mo?
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

pyu: sazo lra nanta kinivolraw olra i savak kana kari'is.
english: The fish traps are already full of fish that we caught.

pyu: no mokowa o kivolrawa mo kemoda o kivolraw?
english: How do you catch fish when you go to catch them?
I shoot fish with a spear.

pyu: sayho o penana' kana makazenan na haramehaman?
english: Do you shoot at the animals on the mountain with a bow and arrow?

pyu: inko mo penapetrir kirawa, noeman mo mikowang ko zi mada ko za sowan mokowa pa'alropa.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I will fence with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

pyu: ninto dinapalran za vavoy inia, maw izo na inia mo to wakalr za vavoy.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

pyu: pakonamon owa na'owi nanta petrir, kamawan za karasa lra za rawa.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

pyu: na sowan kamawan za tremaolr. pakonamona ta korelrang mokowa.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

pyu: inia mo maw na varasa' na demadepel na petrir, papetrir za totos.

pyu: a eman nano ipowa i kazo?

pyu: izoa mo maw na venetatevet kana kowi na petrir, niniyam papetrir za 'ora.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

pyu: lrayowan kemaya ta semongal kana ta temowamowan za to ipovavate kaninta, sazo ta kinarasa na rawa harem kana wari.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

pyu: ai! ta adayaw moroma' i zekalr ta kara'aro'arosaw.

pyu: harem kana wari i sinsi mo ori panaanadam kanta na haramehaman nanta piningaiyan na pinoyomayan mo kemoda ta marengay.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pinuyumayan language today.

pyu: harem kana wari i sinsi mo ori panaanadam kanta na inaekan na vowa' nanta piningaiyan na pinoyomayan mo kemoda ta marengay.

pyu: amanan na mekan za eman ziya.
melri, ini mo to pakatras ni Imay.

Share the book with your classmate next to you.

pyu: ko pavelasay o kana ko aivas.

pyu: katalaolepan lra, waroma' mo kilrivak no kazo mo i dadalan.

pyu: katalaolepan ta lra, marepana'owa ta ziyan.
