Hello everyone, my name is Acin.

pyu: 'inavayan mapiya, nanko ngadan mo maw i Atēk.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Atēk.

pyu: tainataw ni Risem ko, i Tivoan ko.

intaw mo maw i valri, i Takasi intaw.

i Silong mo maw i ali'lri.
to ngadan ni valri na vavayan mo maw i Araytay.
english: My elder sister's name is Araytay.

pyu: to ngadan ni wadilri mo maw i 'Avasan.
pidaya lra to 'ami ni vao na ma'inay?

Do you have schools in your community?

pyu: intaw mo maw i valri na vavayan.
melri, to ali' ni wadilri na ma'inay.

pyu: maw i vao na vavayan i intaw?
melri, maw i wadilri na vavayan intaw.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

There are five people in their family.
There are four children in our family.

pyu: iniyan ko za wadi za ma'inay, olra tatelo ako wadi a vavayan.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

pyu: ai, maw i valri na ma'inay intaw.
ai, intaw mo mawo a pinoyomayan.
poroaretid na wari harem, tar 'awo kana zanom na vi'as.

pyu: porovi'as na wari, powapowa 'emawo za zanom.

pyu: vi'as na kadaw, ikalaalop zamo sasolev 'aziya mo korkadaw.

There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

pyu: no 'emanan 'azi kakadaw, kezemel na ronev, patrev na vali.

pyu: no azo na wari poro'aretiz, zi no mopatraran mo mo, pikavang za pakatras.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

pyu: no katalaolepan mo kemoda na wari awa?

pyu: katalaolepan no azo na wari mo makadaw zi sadeko.
english: It will be sunny on the weekend.

It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

pyu: dali' lra, mopana lra na kadaw.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

What would you like for dinner?

pyu: piya ko lra lremisaw kana kisikisi.

pyu: no haremay lra aoras ko lra.

pyu: imo, i Avas ko za i Abi, trowalray mi ziya.

pyu: i Boya ko, zowa ko maya'a kani Umang.

pyu: pakonamon mosavak, sawriyan ko za mengangara kanino.

pyu: ninko sinalem inia na vorasi, zi talrami mekan!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

pyu: kasa tavo' ini na inaekan na vowa'.
alra kayan! inia na kodomo mo maw ninko isalem na 'azi pinotremelan talrami mekan!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

pyu: wa! salaw tavo' ini na kodomo.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

pyu: ako karowa mekan za vartenok, mekana ko za lingo marowa.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

pyu: ko kolitranay o za inaekan na vowa' pakan kanino.

pyu: lrayoan, salaw mizanom ini na inaekan na vowa'.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

pyu: kowa alakanay o za zanom pa'aw mo.
english: I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pyu: kasazoyo mekan, sazo ziya i kania.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I'll make myself at home then.

pyu: kasazoyo mekan, sazo ziya i kani.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

pyu: sazo lra ko inekan, 'azi ko lra kararowa mekan.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

pyu: harem kana wari inko i sinsi koy adayaw mo mokowa i zenan.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

pyu: i nani marengay i zenan sazo a pedped.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

pyu: harem kana wari inko i sinsi koy adayaw mo mokowa i 'oma.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

pyu: awa ta i iyan harem kana wari?
i sinsi toy adayaw ta mokowa i zinanoman.

pyu: na sinsi toy adayaw ta mokowa i zenan.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

pyu: harem kana wari awa ta i zinanoman?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

pyu: 'azi, i sinsi toy adayaw ta mokowa i zenan.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

pyu: harem kana wari awa ta i zenan?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

pyu: sinsi, awa ta i zenan mena'owa za eman?

pyu: sinsi awa ta i zinanoman pakolimaya?

pyu: sinsi awa ta i 'oma semalema za kolang?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pyu: harem kana wari awa ta veneliyasa kana dare'.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

pyu: i kazo olra a tengteng moviivii.
harem kana wari mena'o ko kana tatena' na vaavaaw na tengteng.

pyu: i kaziyo olra a sirosiropan movaviivii.
wa! sahar ko kana sirosiropan, salaw volay.

pyu: i kaziyo olra a sirosiropan a movaviivii.

pyu: kazo i kani mena'ona'o, amanan na mokowa i dawilr mo!

pyu: moitras ko za sodang mokowa i Bokoto.

english: Varikay goes to school by train.

pyu: moitras ko za hikoki, moitras ta kana hikoki mo maradika kana kissiya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pyu: no mokowa o i kiyokay mo, moitras o za bas alra mo midosiya o?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

pyu: midosiya ko mokowa i kiyokay, no midosiya ta mo marakalra'ayan ta kana bas.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

pyu: 'azi adalrep, miotobay ko mokowa i cawse.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?

pyu: adalrep, no kemakawang ta mo medek ta.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

pyu: na aekanan mo adalrep i siyataw?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

pyu: mopatraran ta kemay i siyataw kemakawang ta mo lrowatra pongkang medek ta.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

pyu: no kemazo mo, no 'emanan miwari o? no aloso kadaw kayko maya'a kanino.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pyu: kiomalra ko ziya karowa ko pasirep nay? maranger ko venavalray semama'.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

pyu: 'azi ko volay zi amanan sasingaw ko, pawnong'azi tinolre'ay parapet na soro!
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.

pyu: no kemazo mo, kowa sasingngaw marowa.
english: Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.

pyu: kowatreng za eman, maranger o kiomalr za eman?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pyu: kiomalra ko kanino a lralrak o ziya kiyakaron o za eman?
english: What do you do when you are young?

pyu: aziyo ziya kinsas ko, maw mo remetra' ko lra harem.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

pyu: kiomalra ko nanno lralrak mo olra kaazo i zekalr?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pyu: 'azi, nanko lralrak olra kaazo i tokay papiya.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

pyu: no kemazo mo, sasa o na kaazo i zekalr?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

pyu: olra ko vinaaw a saya sowan zi saya 'ayam, nazo mo ninko rinoma'enan.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pyu: mivinaaw ko za saya ngiyaw, olra ini na ngiyaw ko lraalrang 'azi ko kasalrengangeseng.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pyu: maranger ko kiomalr kanino kanini na watralonan na palisiyan.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pyu: 'azi ko kamazalraman, maw mo nako kinazalram koy tovangaw o.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pyu: nanmo adain motralon izo na petrir, na vakenan na ilros mo olra to palisiyan?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pyu: nazo na adain motralon na eman ziya mo 'azi madikes na vavayan.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pyu: no kemazo mo, na vavayan mo karowa salrangan mokowa motralona?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?
No, women cannot go hunting either.

pyu: kana wari harem salaw ko semangal karowa ko kiomaomalr kanino, alra rengay ziya, kana pinakapalisi na watralonan mo?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today. Would you please talk about the taboos of hunting?

pyu: ai. a lralrak ko ziya mo marayas ko mozenan paalropa.
english: Sure, I used to go hunting very often when I was young.

pyu: amanan tremima'! olra ziya sadalilran i sawka.
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pyu: 'azi paowa na sadalilran, owa trima' ziya za zowadalilran.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pyu: tratrima' ko za biciw, menaniwan mo?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pyu: tratrima' ko za zowa dalilran, zi tratrima'ko ziya za salovokan za veras.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

pyu: anzini na veras i kani, tratrima' o ziya za eman?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pyu: tratrima' ko ziya za vetrinon, olra mo vetrinon?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.

pyu: maranger o kana kemodakoda na kavang?
english: What kind of clothes do you like?

pyu: tratrima' ko kana lriketri to 'aselr na kavang.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pyu: ini na zangzarang kemodakoda ziya maw?
olra ziya na volretri maw na temangiya.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

pyu: alakanay ko za saya izo na temangiya na kavang.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

pyu: Arong mokowa o i iyan haremay? mokowa o leminalinaya?
english: Arung, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pyu: 'azi, mokowa ko polralranga meniwana za kolang ni imo.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pyu: kemazo kowayo, miwari o no karaov? wawai o salrangan kaninko mokowa mekana.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.

pyu: no kemazo mo salrangana ko kanino.
english: Then, I will go with you.

pyu: 'inavayan, kiomalra ko ziya ini na saveto'na kolang manoeman paiso?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

pyu: na vorasi saya tingting mo makatelon paiso.
alra 'ay ko za zowa voto' za kolang zi saya tingting za vorasi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pyu: Acin, malalop ko mada za tratroli, karowa o pavelas kaninko?
english: Acin, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pyu: iniyan nanko, ini mo toni Imay.
english: I don't have one either. This is Imay's.

pyu: no kemazo mo karowa pavelas kaninko? kadadika ko palawli' kanino.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pyu: lrayoan, lrayoan kowayo lra i Imay.
english: Thank you and thank Imay for me.

pyu: pareveliyas ko kananni na zowa'etiv na valray.
english: I want to return these two books.

pyu: ai, maranger o ziya za eman?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

pyu: kiyavelas ko ziya za telo 'etiv a valray.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pyu: marowa lra. amanan na malalop pakalrang no telo wariyan mo palawli'o lra.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

pyu: 'azi o ziya palawli' za ko aivas.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

pyu: ko palawli'aw lra a adaman zi.
kemazo zi malremes ko aivas awa?
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Uratr?
I don't know. I will go and ask her.

pyu: ko pavelasay o ziya kanako aivas.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

pyu: Imay, ini na kayto to ipavelas i Uratr kanino?
english: Imay, did Uratr lend you this coat?

pyu: melri, to trinima'an ni nani veray kaninko.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

pyu: maresan to kayto ni Kacaw kanino.
english: Kacaw's coat is the same as yours.

pyu: to kayto mo maw na 'oze'ozem, 'azi maresan to pinivalrayan.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pyu: Imay, kivelas o kani Uyang za paiso?
english: Imay, did you borrow money from Uyang?

pyu: ai, pavelaliyas ko kanintaw kema ko mo, malalop ko lra mada za paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

pyu: no kemazo mo no aidan palawli' o?
english: Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

pyu: ai, ko rengayanay lra kani Uyang nanno ikakowa.
english: Okay, I will tell Uyang for you.

pyu: no penetrir ta kana totos mo, ta petriray kana penangangese', na tikoray no penetrir ta mo, ta petriray kana venetatevet, ta kowaniyaw penetrir mo penaowa.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pyu: kemania kowayo, pamelri ko penetrir! aziya lra eman 'azi ko karaasa.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pyu: no kemazo mo kono panadamaw demaway kanini na zowaya na petrir.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pyu: ai! salaw 'inava! no koazo mo kararowa ko lra karasa.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pyu: tatelrawan lra na tralonan i 'oma zi, owa i soro elak za ringaw, kayta i 'oma.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pyu: olra i ngidiran kana tripe', no mosavak o i soro nana'o o.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pyu: kilrivak, amanan na mopanana. 'idangan na ringaw.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pyu: olra i iyan izo nano ipetrir?
nako petrir olra ipetrir kanizo na kawi i maka loso.
english: My trap is under that tree.

pyu: olra ko pinodongan, mazalram ko za olra i iyan ko petrir.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pyu: soronong ini, ta powanay i ngidiran i zinanoman kivolraw.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pyu: i kazi kaniniyam iniyan za soronong, mi pangasingasipay no kivolraw mi.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pyu: 'azi ko ziya pangasip kivolraw, no masalr mo panadamaw ko mo?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pyu: ai! no masalr mo salrangana ta mokowa pangasipa.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pyu: no kemazo konowa panadamaw demaway za soronong.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pyu: mahowaho nano pangasip, alra mo karasa za volraw! pakonamon kezengo.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pyu: no haremay lra, na sodang ma'iva'iv zazo. kowa kezengaw na pangasip, zi owa kaziyoa polralrangay ko melak za savang.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pyu: izo na volraw kezengo pokowania kaninko. kowa polralrangay o kemezeng.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pyu: kasa 'inava! harem sazo ta kinarasa, matemoy lra na kara'is.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pyu: anlra dikadikaya ta moroma' ta lrawalrawa'ay papiya.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

pyu: amanan lra kivangavang, konamon owa kananno kakayanan.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pyu: liyosan lrowatr harem, katalaolepan no 'emanan, salrangana ta mokowa kivangavanga!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

pyu: liyosan telo no 'emanan, no 'emanan no aloso kadaw kayta malimaliya!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pyu: kasede'an no 'emanan, salralrangan ko kani nani mokowa i kiyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pyu: ori aota' ko, aowa ko i tavononan mota'a.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko tiyalr, aowa ko i tavonan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: karowa ko mokowa morasa zako lima?
english: May I go wash my hands?

pyu: ori talaolep ta lra, owa lra no haremay.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pyu: sinsi, kasa nana ko trangoro', no piya kara'alri powalawang ko.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

pyu: sinsi, no masalr liyosan sa powalawang ko, aowa ko kina'owa kana ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pyu: nana to tiyalr, olra i tavonan.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana to tokeraw, powalawang harem kana wari.
english: Teacher, Masaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pyu: ko ngadan mo maw i Uyang Pakaroko, moketrep lra ko 'ami harem.
english: My name is Uyang Pakaruku, and I'm 10 years old.

pyu: ko ngadan mo i Uyang Pakaroko.
to alrak o na iyan na mawan?
english: What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?

pyu: ai, iniyam saroma'enan Pinoyomayan mi papiya.
english: Yes, my whole family is Pinuyumayan.

pyu: melri, a Pinoyomayan i malri zi, a payrang i nani.
english: No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pyu: to alrak ko ni Masaw Mavaliw.
iziyoa mo maw i temama? pidaya lra to 'ami?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pyu: i iziyo mo maw i temama? pidaya lra to 'ami?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pyu: melri, i intaw mo maw na dawdawanan i kaniyam zekalr, makawalon lra to 'ami.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pyu: moketrep misama' za walowalowa lra to 'ami ni valri na ma'inay.
to 'ami ni vao mo 'ma'izang zazo kanino?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

pyu: marama'izang kaninko za lrowatr 'ami i valri na ma'inay.
sakelawangan zi zowa pasa ko ikaaatras.
sawariyan ko lra 'azi mena'o kanino, alra mo atras o lra?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pyu: ai, saleman misama' za makatelon hamayan ko atrasan.
ai, makatelon koking ko ika'alalozon harem.
aowa ko i pankongse maya'a kana sinsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

pyu: i intaw olra i pakolalimayan, no haremay mo aawa kima'ariya kana pakolalima.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pyu: olra i iyan i Sonay? no haremay mo aowa kima'ariya kana pavavekasan.
english: Where is Sunay? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pyu: olra i litang intaw, kay ko vavinayaw.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

pyu: kay ko ziya tremima'a za kara'a'alrien, no haremay mo kay ko lra aya'aw o.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.
Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pyu: aya' za zoma za trao, awa ko maya' kani sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pyu: harem kana wari i Masaw aowa kima'a'ariya kana mitowaketok temepok kana mali?
english: Is Masaw competing in croquet today?

pyu: 'azi, awa kimarepakowaya kana monekon kana mareatras.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

pyu: no pa'ari'ari no azo mo ori kowarelrang o kima'ari'ari?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pyu: ai, awa ko kima'a'ariya kana pavavekas.
no pa'ari'ari no azo mo kowarelrang o kima'ari?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pyu: awa ko kima'ariya kana mitowaketok tremepok kana mali.
no pa'ari'ari no azo mo ori kakoda ta?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

pyu: ori parepakowa ta makakezeng kana lralrakitr.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

pyu: kana pa'ari'ari no azo kana wari mo ori naniwan ta za akanen?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

pyu: wa melak o kana sanga, tatena' o za kirevat!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!
Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pyu: iniyan, maw ziya opatratraran, waroma' no 'aremeng lra.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pyu: olra kazi itras kana kazazowa rawangan owa witras aya'o intaw.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pyu: maw i Masaw, sawariyan ta lra 'azi mena'o kanino, 'inava o ziya?
english: It's Masaw. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

pyu: 'inava ko, zowa ko maya'a kanino kimazayazayara.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pyu: olra i sawka temosaasiyaw, kayko vavinayaw.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

pyu: mokowa intaw i povoyoyan 'emevanga za voyo.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pyu: sawariyan ta lra 'azi marepana'o, atras o lra.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

pyu: mena'o ko zano izazowa salaw ko semangal.
english: It's so good to see you.

pyu: ini na pangodangodalr mo vaveray kaninmo, powayani kana palralritekan
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pyu: sawriyan o lra 'azi zowa, ko vavinayaw papiya zi salrangalrangana ta mekan.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pyu: kaeman kemazo mavangavang, 'emao ko ziya kana alasepa mo arowa. kayta i kalisowasowan mazayazayara.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

pyu: lrayowan zano sinadalowan, averok ko lra.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pyu: inia na voyo maw ziya kiyatrowak, adayo moroma' tawatawaro lra mekan.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pyu: inta zazowa kemoreta ta no 'emanan no aloso kadaw mo?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pyu: ai, ori paretratrevong ta i iyan?
maretrevonga ta i kongkowan mo? kisaasing ta kana iga.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pyu: no kemazo mo kay ta i palakowan, piyakavang ko kana ta kavang na kinawatranan mokowa.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pyu: no mi'apotr na sakora kaniyam zekalr mo salaw volay. ngarayo no mi'apotr no azo mo alamo lra aya'o ko!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pyu: no kemazo mo ngangara ta no kaseveran lra, piwari lra zazo.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

pyu: no kemazo mo alamo lra no kavarasa'an!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pyu: kiomalra ko kanino mazo zi mopasalr o zowa i zekalr kazowa?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

pyu: kana sare'az ko kana ko zekalr, zi pavolaliyas ko i zekalr zako ikasaayho.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pyu: sayho o semilretrav, maw i eman na panadam kanino?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

pyu: maw i molri na vavayan, i intaw mo maw na marasayhoyho semilretrav kaniyam zekalr na trao.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pyu: na semilralretrav mo niniyam kakowayanan na kinawatranan, maranger ko tremongotrongolr kananiyam kakowayanan na kinawatranan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pyu: ini na tinowakotra kana dawa mo tatena' imaran.
tatena' o kana sayho. no tremowakotra ta mo sawariyan?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pyu: 'azi, arowa saliyosan marowa. ta powanay i lidingan demoro na lriketran no madero na lriketran no lritek lra mo ta powayay kana pikak ta triwtriwraw, zi ta powanay lra i oraoratran.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

pyu: kani kaninko mo olra kamangolr zi lokiw, ninko isalem peniya yi!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

pyu: tremima'a ko kanini na zazowaya pidaya paiso?
marepokasa peniya mo zowa leman misama' za makalrowatr paiso.

english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pyu: 'azi, no ko dolowaw mo kasasipon ko.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pyu: ai, no kemazo mo tremima'a ko za saya na 'oze'ozem na kavang.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

pyu: tratrima' ko kanini na tazaw maw ini na daderowan.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

pyu: ta pokasayaw mo zowa kozolr paiso, i ini mo ninko linalimayan demaway, zi kararowa o sawariyan mieman.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pyu: ko pakazalramay ko aliali'an zowa tremima'a, kararowa o ziyan kemadolo?
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

pyu: halra! ko dolowaw no saleman mo ko lehetray zi makawalon lra.
english: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

pyu: alamo na'o! na kavang na talopong olra peniya.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pyu: kiomalra ko ziya na kavang mo pidaya paiso?
saya na kavang mo telo leman misama' za makalrowatr paiso, no tatelowa mo sakozolr paiso.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pyu: tratrima' ko za saya marowa, alra verayay ko kana vekal.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pyu: 'inavayan, maranger ko tremima' za sinaemay zi na 'alom na pinowayan za longan.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

pyu: moniwan lra na sinaemay. olra ziya na pinowayan za tana'a na siniyan na odongko. tratrima' o?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

pyu: halr! alra verayay ko za saya, no masalr mo tremima'a ko lra za madero.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

pyu: ai, kowa avakaw kana avakan, kemani mo makalrowatr paiso.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pyu: 'inavayan mapiya. harem kana wari panadam na sinsi za kemodakoda ta temarapinoyomayan kana aekanan.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say \\\puyuma\\\"."

pyu: malrazam o za aeman kema na sinsi?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

pyu: sinsi, 'azi ko malrazam. karowa o masalr ziya merengay?
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

pyu: 'azi ko kinger, karowa o kema'izang merengay?

pyu: ai, parevelaliyas ko kanintaw harem kema ko mo, malalop ko morong za paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

pyu: no kemazo mo, parevelaliyas o no aidan?
english: Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

pyu: ai, powalranga ko lra kanino pakalrazam kani Asaw.
english: Okay, I will tell Asaw for you.

pyu: na 'avotar mo, ta petriray kana totak, na tikoras mo, ta petriray kana sawail, pamao no kemani.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pyu: kemani awlra, pamelri ko. mao na kemazo zi 'azi ko karasa.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pyu: konowa panadamaw lra za kemodakoda ta demaway kanini na zowaya petrir.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pyu: ai mo! ka'invayan awa! no kemazo mo, karaasa ko lra na kaidaidan.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pyu: naven lra na tralon i 'oma, owa i powalomayan elak za kawkaw, kay ta i 'oma.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pyu: olra i ngidiran kana ponon, nana'o o no mosavak o i powalomayan.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pyu: taranapaw no maelak o, amanan mavoli', idangan na kawkaw.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pyu: olra i makaloso kaniziyo na kawi nanko petrir.
english: My trap is under that tree.

pyu: olra ko pinozong i kani a, malrazam ko za olra i iyan nanko petrir.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pyu: a voevo ini a, niyam retra'anay i zinanoman 'emevang za volraw.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pyu: oniyan za voevo naniyam zekalr, mipangasip mi 'emevang za volraw.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pyu: 'azi ko ziya atalram mipangasip, panadamaw ko lra no masalr?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pyu: ai mo! marelranga ta lra mokowa pangasipa no masalr.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pyu: no kemazo mo, konowa panadamaw demaway za voevo.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pyu: matriyakatrok lra nano pangasip, kamao na olra a volraw mopangasip. pakonamon kezengo.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pyu: no haremay lra, moiyoiyoz na sodang, kazo ko i kani kemezeng kana pangasip, owa i kaziyo elakanay ko za savang.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pyu: kezengo na volraw pokowani kaninko. kono powalrangay kemezeng.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pyu: ka'inavayan awa. sazo ta 'inevang harem kana wari, matemoy lra na kara'is.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pyu: kadikaya ta moroma', ta po'atraray nanta wadiyan.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pyu: a Liyosan Lima harem, a Kasede'an no 'emanan, kay ta mozangiya!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!

pyu: ai mo! kay ta i zinanoman.
english: Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

pyu: a Liyosan Telo no 'emanan, kay ta mamaliya no piya kare'alri no 'emanan!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pyu: a Kasede'an no 'emanan, salrangan ko kani inani aowa i kiyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pyu: maranger ko mota', aowa ko i tavoniyan.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko tiyalr, aowa ko i tavoniyan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: karowa ko mokowa morasa ko lima?
english: May I go wash my hands?

pyu: ori powalodos ta lra, owa lra no haremay.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko trangoro', kiyami ko semede' no piya kare'alri.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

pyu: sinsi, kiyami ko za sasede'an no masalr kana liyosan sa, aowa ko pana'owa kana ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pyu: nana to tiyalr, olra i tavoniyan i intaw.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana to tokeraw i Kasang, semede' harem.
english: Teacher, Kasang has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pyu: i Monay Sawawan ko, a polo' ko 'ami harem.
english: My name is Munay Sawawan, and I'm 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Pinuyumayan.
Are all your family members indigenous?

pyu: amelri, a Pinoyomayan i amalri, a Payrang i inani.
english: No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pyu: a alrak ko ni Wonzay Sawawan.
i temama i iziyo? pidaya to 'ami lra?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pyu: amelri, a dawdawan i intaw kana naniyam zekalr, walo polo' to 'ami lra.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.
Is your brother much older than you?

pyu: a sa leman pat polo' hamayan ko.
sawariyan 'azi ta maretrevong maratihasar o lra, ai?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pyu: ai, a sa leman telo polo' hamayan ko lra.
ai, telo polo' kongcin ko lra harem.
aowa ko i kavalrayan miya'a kani sinsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

pyu: olra kana lralrangoyan, 'a'ari'ari za lrangoy no haremay i intaw.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pyu: olra i iyan i Sonay? 'a'ari'ari za melihis i intaw no haremay.
english: Where is Sunay? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pyu: olra i pawazowazokan i intaw, kay ko vinayaw.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

pyu: kay ko ziya tremima'a za kare'alriyan, miya' ko lra kanno no haremay.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

pyu: salrangan ta mokowa merasa za tavo!
english: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pyu: owa iya'a za zoma na trao, aowa ko miya'a kani sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pyu: 'a'ari'ari za coēciyo harem kana wari i Monay?
english: Is Munay competing in croquet today?
No, he's competing in high jump.

pyu: 'a'ari'ari o no azo kana wari no 'a'ari'ariyan?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pyu: kakoda ta no azo kana wari no 'a'ari'ariyan?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.
Will we sell food at the sports day?

pyu: moelak o za pokangaway, tena' o kana kerevat!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

pyu: olra, olra alrope' i kiya'ezengan i intaw.
english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pyu: oniyan, mao ziya mopatraran a haremay. raroma' lra no karaov.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pyu: olra i pokazowa tazar i intaw. owa iya'o kantaw.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pyu: i Monay a! sawariyan lra 'azi ko mena'o kanno. 'inava o?
english: It's Munay. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?
I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pyu: olra i sawka maringring za kolang i intaw. kay ko vinayaw.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

pyu: mokowa i intaw i powaterokokan 'emevanga za terokok.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pyu: sawariyan ta lra 'azi maretrevong, maratihasar o lra.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

pyu: salaw mi semangal mena'o kanno za zowa o.
english: It's so good to see you.

pyu: a re'a i ini na vaveray kanmo. asezo i lralritekan.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pyu: kemani sawariyan 'azi o zowa. ko vinayaw mapiya alamo mokasa ta mekana.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pyu: amanan venangavang lra. 'a'awo ko kana korisepa. kay ta i pakayanan marezayazayara.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

pyu: lrayowan za no demaolr. vavorok ko lra.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pyu: mapiya tremowak ko kanini na terokok. orongi moroma' mekan.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pyu: paretrevong ta no 'emanan no piyakare'alri, ai?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pyu: paretrevong ta i takesiyan, ai? sasirep semasasing mi.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pyu: kay ta palakowan kemazo. pikirowan ko mokowa.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pyu: movakavakar na sakora i naniyam zekalr zi salaw volay. no movakar na sakora mo, alamo lra.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pyu: ngangara ta no kaseveran lra. kapowari lra.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

pyu: kemazo mo, alamo lra no 'Amiyan lra.
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pyu: kiomalr ko ziya, man veliyas o moroma' i zekalr?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

pyu: man 'azi o mowai patakesi i tokay?
english: Why not teach in the city?

pyu: 'alra na sare'ez ko kanangko zekalr, zi mianger ko pavales kanangko zekalr.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pyu: i imolri na vavayan. marasayhoiho temenon i intaw i kaniyam zekalr.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pyu: a temenon mo, nanta kakowayanan. maranger ko patrongotrongolr za nanta kakowayanan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pyu: pamelri tavo' i ini na temowakotra kana dawa.
sayho o awa! kasawariyan ta temowakotra kanini?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pyu: amanan, karowa a saya liyosan. ta ta'oraw ziya na ziketran zi na veras zi, powayay za pikak pokasayaw tremiyor. marowa ta avakanay kana dalilr lra.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

pyu: olra a kamangolr zi a kenaw i kaninko. ningko sinaleman peniya!
english: I have chili and spring onion, both grown by myself!

pyu: manoeman paiso no tremima' ta kanini na zowaya.
a zowa leman lima polo' paiso peniya.
sahar ko kanini na kiping, manoeman paiso?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

pyu: pazangal lra, 'azi marowa poloso za saema?
english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pyu: 'azi marowa, kasipon ko no ko polosowaw.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pyu: ai, no kemazo mo, verayay ko za saya a kiping na 'oze'ozem.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

pyu: aelak ko kanini na kamotr zi na sioy.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

pyu: a zowa kozolr paiso peniya. dinawayan kanangko lima i ini, kasawariyan zi 'azi kakowatreng.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pyu: ko palrazamaw ko 'ali'an mo, karowa poloso ziya za saema?
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

pyu: ai mo, ko lehetranay kanno za zowa polo' pasēnto.
english: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

pyu: alamo mena'owa! menaniwan mi za kiping zi za talopong.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pyu: na kiping a saya mo, telo leman lima polo' paiso, a telowa mo sa kozolr.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pyu: tremima' ko za saya, verayay ko kana vekal.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pyu: 'inavayan. maranger ko tremima' za kinaveras zi za 'alom na milramomo.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

pyu: oniyan lra na madero. olra ziya na 'avay na mitana'. tratrima' o?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

pyu: ai, verayay ko za saya. tremima' ko za madero no masalr lra.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

pyu: ai, ko avakanay kanno na 'avay za lovok.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pyu: inabayan! garem i palaladam ko kanmo dra kemoda ta temarapoyoma marengay kana akanan.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Puyuma.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

pyu: sinsi, adri ko malradram. karowa yo masalr marengay?
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

pyu: adri ko kilrengaw. karowa yo kematrina driya?
english: I can't hear you, can you speak louder?

pyu: naowi driya kadri! korenangi ko emaip pariyasalr.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.

pyu: sinsi, abalo ko kemaso dra tratrori.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

pyu: sinsi, abalo ko kemaso dra iyasaos.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

pyu: kibolas driya kan to iyasaos kana risarisan i saninin.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

pyu: pabolasi ko driya dra iyasaos. maw?
ta palrowanay temakesi kadrini. marepanaowa ta driya an masalr liyosan.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

pyu: to walrak ko kan Maywan. i Sikaw ko ngalad.
english: I am the son of Maywan, my name is Sikaw.

pyu: to temakakesi ko kan Senayan. i Semalaw ko ngalad.
english: I am a student of Senayan, and my name is Semalaw.

pyu: i manay to ngalad kan temama?
i Malray to ngalad kan namalri.
i baelri na mainayan taytaw. i Komeng to ngalad.
english: He's my brother, his name is Kumeng.

pyu: i Akonay taytaw. amao i molri na babayan.
nanko anay taytaw. i Limoy to ngalad.
english: She's a friend of mine, her name is Limuy.

pyu: moketrep misama dra drowaya to ami garem.
monoma to ami kan temama garem?
makalrowatr to ami kan namalri garem.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

pyu: miyadrowa i baelri. misasa ko wadi.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

pyu: oniyan ko dra eba dra mainayan.

english: How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

pyu: kiyakaron dra manay i temoo na mainayan?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?
Yes, we are all very tall.

pyu: temakesi lra no wadi na babayan?
english: Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak Nam Wang Puy Nam?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
Do you live with your parents?

pyu: aiwa! marenang ko kanko maidrangan kikadro.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
Do you live with your grandparents?

pyu: adri! adri ko marenang kanadro kikadro.
english: No, I didn't live with them.

pyu: marenang ko kan namalri, nanalri kay baelri na mainayan kikadro.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.
Our tribe is in [Hualien]. *[Hualien] is freely interchangeable with other places.

pyu: owaroma yo kan asowa i drekalr?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

pyu: an semasede dra kadenonan i, moroma ko dar.
english: I will go back in the summer.

pyu: mopatraran lra na kadaw. salaw bias na wari.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

pyu: adri lritek aw adri bias garem. salaw inaba.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

pyu: kemoda na wari garem kana raoban?
oniyan dra kotrem i langitr. mopatraran lra na trior.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

pyu: madranga a garemay na odalr. kemadaw i, mopatraran na riwanes.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

pyu: lritek na wari, pikirowan dra sadro.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

pyu: kapakireb na odalr an garemay. adri kababalo kemaso dra kalipang.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

pyu: dremerong a garemay. kaaodalr an garemay mako.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

pyu: maodalr a garemay. madanga lra na odalr garem.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

pyu: kamawan dra inodalran lra. daleken na dalan.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

pyu: maaodalr i patraran. adri ko kemaso dra kalipang.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

pyu: matrina na bali, besebesay ko aw batring ko.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

pyu: matrina na kadaw. korekakadaw ko aw malopaw ko.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

pyu: koyko i adri ko kemaso. kayta tremimaa.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

pyu: aiwa! tratrima ko driya dra iyasaos.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

pyu: an kemadro i, ta okasayay mekan ko tabo i!
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

pyu: aekan yo dra manay an karealriyan?
english: What do you want to eat for lunch?

pyu: aekan ko i takesian kana pakasaseber na akanan.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

pyu: kemaso ko dra tabo garem. mokasaya ta mekan an karealriyan maw!
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

pyu: alakan ko driya dra trapol dra aitrolan maw?
english: Can you get me a rag, please?

pyu: semasaselrap ko. alakan ko kayo i Alaw.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Alaw to carry it for you.

pyu: miyakitral na papadraran. owa driya itroli.
english: The table is dirty, go clean it.

pyu: aiwa! kayko malaka dra trapolr dra aitrol.
english: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

pyu: miyakitral idriyo na lataw. owa itroli driya.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

pyu: garemay lra. adri ko driya peniya semelrap kadrini.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

pyu: an moroma yo kemay i takesian i, kakoda yo dra manay?
english: What do you do after school?

pyu: parenang ko kanko alian moka semenaya.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

pyu: an moroma kemay i takesian taytaw i, kakoda taytaw dra manay?
oniyan taytaw! daw maya yo kantaw?
english: She's not here, what can I do for you?

pyu: momo, i Pidor ko. tratrowalri driya na alreban.
english: Grandfather, I am Pidru, please open the door.

pyu: Senayan, i Pidor ko! drowa ko mayaa kano malinaya.
english: Senayan, I'm Pidur and I've come to play with you.

pyu: aiwa! masopeng ko kano. alamo! sadro ta padradrayaran.
english: Yeah! I've missed you. Come on! We have so much to talk about!

pyu: katengadraw driya! trekel driya dra kolisepa!
english: Please sit down and have some tea.

pyu: iowa dra demalreolreo mo kolisepa iy!
aiwa! kadalreolreo an menao ta kandri na kalimodan!
english: Wow! These fruits seem to be very sweet.

pyu: peniya lra maresiyok dra kakerabian i ina. alamo mekana ta!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

pyu: aiwa! semabesaba ko driya dra lima.
english: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

pyu: kabetreker mekan. amelri yo a sidromayan mako.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

pyu: sadro lra ko inekanan. betreker ko lra.
english: I ate a lot, I'm full.

pyu: owaborek ko lra. an miwari ko i, drowaya ko driya menaowa kano.
english: I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

pyu: an miwari yo i, alamo driya owadrangi maw!
english: Come back to play again sometime!

pyu: aiwa! an miwari yo alamo owadrangi kaniyam.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

pyu: inabayan! papilrang ko kanmo moka kirepanaowa dra maaidrangan i drekalr an oninan.
english: Hello everyone, today I'm taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

pyu: aiwa! tarapoyoma mi kimadrayar kana maaidrangan.
english: Okay! We're going to speak Southern King Puyuma to the seniors.
Grandpa, we've come to see you.

pyu: iowa! saigo mo temarapoyoma i! salaw inaba i!
english: Wow! You guys speak Southern King Puyuma! That's awesome!

pyu: inabayan! an oninan i, papilrang ko kanmo moka kikarona i dawadawa.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

pyu: alamo kadrini otorik. adri kababalo kemaso dra sinadaday.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

pyu: sinsi, aiwa! padangaw lra naniyam sinadaday.
english: Yes, sir, we've got our tools.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I'll go and catch the birds.

pyu: inabayan! an oninan i, aoka ta dra to kinadrowan kana garamegaman.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

pyu: iowa dra inaba i! kowadakoda ta moka?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

pyu: otorik kadri peniya! tremimaa ta dra ritos.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

pyu: kadri ngowayan i, a ayaayam. kadri likodran i, a onaonan. karananetayan menao.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

pyu: an kemadrini i, owa yoyo nao dra ayam.
english: If that's the case, then you go and see the birds.

pyu: an saya walowan i, karebeliyas maradroka ta.
english: We'll be back in an hour.

pyu: menao yo dra manay kandri na wari?
menao ko dra sadro dra onan aw dra sadro dra ayam.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

pyu: ngarayo ko driya! rapi ko dapalr.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

pyu: sadro a trao na melralrangoy kadrini.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

pyu: asabak na enay kadriyo. melrangoya ta kadrini.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

pyu: pakakawang dra palidring poisatr kanko i namalri.
kana wawariwari i, kemoda moka i takesian taytaw?
english: How does he usually go to school?

pyu: moisatr kana ciyē-yon moka i takesian taytaw.
english: He took the subway to school.

pyu: kemoda moka tremimaa dra kolang i temomo na babayan?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

pyu: miotobay taytaw moka tremimaa dra kolang.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

pyu: owaisatr ko dra tamina moka i Botrolr.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

pyu: moisatr dra hikoki moka i Botrolr taytaw.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

pyu: moisatr dra manay taytaw moka i Takaw?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

pyu: moisatr kana pakesop na igiw moka i Takaw.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

pyu: a moisatr dra igiw moka i Balangaw taytaw?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

pyu: aiwa! moisatr dra igiw moka i Balangaw taytaw.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

pyu: amelri! moisatr dra hikoki moka i Balangaw taytaw.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

pyu: olraya a owaisatran dra bas kadrini?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

pyu: olraya! mongowayayan ta kemakawang i, nanao yo dra owaisatran dra bas.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

pyu: olraya isowa na maraadalredalrep kadrini na ciyē-yon-can?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

pyu: oniyan dra ciyē-yon-can kadrini. mawmao karowa yo moisatr dra ki-ting-siya.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

pyu: moisatr dra bas karowa monoma walowan raredek i takesian?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

pyu: moketrep misama dra lrowatra trektrek raredek i takesian.
moisatr kana pakesop na igiw karowa monoma walowan raredek i Tay-cong?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

pyu: pakakawang dra palidring moka i U-lay i, kapaetreng?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

pyu: karowa ko moka kirepanaowa kano nay?
karowa ko moka kiyomalra dra manay driyan kano nay?

english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

pyu: piyawari yo an mokidrayayan na kadaw? maranger ko moka kirepanaowa kano. wawai yo nay?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

pyu: piyawari yo an daman? maranger ko kiyomalr kano drato batibatiyan dra Pinoyomayan.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the Peinan legend.

pyu: ko kinilrengawan i, malradram yo drato kakowayanan kana Pinoyomayan kema. maranger ko kipaladam kano driya.
english: I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Peinan people and I would like to ask you a few questions.

pyu: adri sadro nanko kinalradraman. amawna, pakirongetra ko temoban.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

pyu: kiyomalra ko driya! karowa ko semasing pasirep kano ngai nay? likodran i, ta kalralreayan temililr emapetr.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

pyu: kiyomalra ko driya! monoma lra no ami garem?
makaiwa misama dra walowa ko ami lra.
a lralrak dra manay. maidrang ko lra.
kiyomalra ko driya! kemay yo isowa?

english: I'm from the Puyuma (Southern King tribe).

pyu: kiyomalra ko driya! no katagowin i, amao a Pinoyomayan?
english: Is your wife also a Puyuma?

pyu: salaw ko semangal drako iyadrowa kirepanaowa kano garem. babati driya drato lregiyan dra paaalrop maw?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

pyu: aiwa! a lralrak ko driya i, marayas ko moka i drenan paalropa.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

pyu: semangalan! no pinaladaman garem i, salaw inaba.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

pyu: panaan nanko nirengayan. amao to batibatiyan dra temowamowan.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

pyu: ta palrowanay kadrini ta pinadrayaran garem. semangalan drano pinaladaman.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

pyu: owaborek ko lra! an masalr lra i, kilrengawa ta driya dra sadro dra batibatiyan.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what are you looking for?

pyu: tratrima ko dra saya dra takilr.
english: I want to buy a cup.

pyu: tratrima ko dra saya dra kabong.
english: I want to buy a hat.

pyu: tratrima ko dra takilr. menaniwan mo?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

pyu: oniyan! adri mi menaniwan dra poran.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

pyu: tratrima ko dra imar dra drowaya dalilran.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

pyu: monoma tintin no tratrimaan na bitrenon?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

pyu: tratrima ko dra drowaya tenges dra kenaw.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

pyu: mosama lra a telowa tenges kadri. berayanay kano peniya a!
english: There are three left, all for you!

pyu: idri na salipotr na beras i, monoma paiso?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

pyu: mokasa i, makabetraan misama dra saya paiso. pokayane lra kana makabetraan paiso i.
makaiwa misama dra lrowatra paiso kadrini.
tremimaa ko driya dra saima. patelroaw dra saya leman paiso.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

pyu: lrowatra leman misama dra moketrep paiso peniya.
pokayane lra kana lrowatra leman paiso maw?
padrangal lra dradro idrini. karowa kemadolo dra saima driya?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

pyu: adri karowa! madolo lra idrini a!
english: No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

pyu: makatelon paiso idri na walro. olraya driya a manay no aalakan?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

pyu: karowa ko kibolas dra paiso kano?
english: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

pyu: abalo ko kemaso dra paiso. karowa ko kibolas dra paiso kano?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

pyu: adri ko kemaso dra paiso i!
english: I don't have any money either!

pyu: aeman! adaman no kinibolasan na paiso i, adri yo driya parebeliyas kanko.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

pyu: pabolasi ko driya kano didinsiya maw?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

pyu: aiwa! amawna, parebeliyaso kanko an daman.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

pyu: maaodalr lra! adri ko kemaso dra kalipang. pabolasi ko dra kalipang maw?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

pyu: maomao saya ko kalipang. mokasaya ta mikalipan maw!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

pyu: idri na tilin amao no pinabolas kanko a daman. parebeliyasaw kano.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

pyu: an maranger yo driya menao dra droma dra tilin i, rengayo ko.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

pyu: parebelaliyas ko kano dra paiso an asowa?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

pyu: driyama lra! kiangero lra an mipaiso yo.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

pyu: parebelaliyas yo kanko dra paiso an asowa?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

pyu: parebelaliyas yo an asowa kanko tilin?
english: When are you going to return my book?

pyu: ko parebeliyasay yo lra a daman mako?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

pyu: idri na tratrori to pinabolas kano kan Uratr mako?
english: Did Uratr lend you this pen?

pyu: aiwa! ko kinibolas a oninan kantaw.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

pyu: idri na tratrori no kinibolas kan Alaw mako?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Alaw?
No, this is what mom bought.

pyu: oniyan lra dra ateri. owa kibolas kan Senten dra saima dra ateri.
english: We are out of salt, let's go borrow some salt from Senten.

pyu: parebeliyaso ko paiso kayo i Aden.
english: Go tell Aden to give me my money back.
How much does she owe you?

pyu: aoka ko i bakabak semalema dra kolang.
english: I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

pyu: tralotralon aw merarabi ko dra tralon. a powaenayan lra an garemay.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

pyu: alakan ko driya dra kawkaw aw dra pitaw maw?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.

pyu: ko kangkangaw lra na dare a garemay. a powabinian lra an garemay.
english: I've just ploughed the soil, and I'm going to sow the seeds.

pyu: no sinaleman na kolang i, kararowayan lra kiyakolang?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

pyu: na boaw kadrini i, karowa lra kiyaboawan. na kadomo kadriyo i, adri driya karowa kikadomo.
english: The beans here are ready for harvesting, but the corn there is not yet ready.

pyu: iowa dra sadro no kinerotran na bonga.
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

pyu: polrangi ko benekelr i kobaw maw?
english: Can you help me stack the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

pyu: sadro lra a koraw i boebo.
english: The fish traps are already full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?

pyu: ko panaaw dra kotang na koraw.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you hunt with a bow and arrow?

pyu: mipetrir ko dar moka penetrira. an noma i, mikowang ko aw pilrangaw na sowan paalrop.
english: I usually catch my prey with steel clips, but occasionally I'll hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

pyu: to dinapalran dra baboy idrini. driyama amao to kinalrangan dra baboy.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

pyu: kayta melikapa drata petrir. kamawan dra mitiyo lra.
english: Let's go check our iron clips, it looks like we've caught our prey.

pyu: kamawan dra tremaolr drato bali na sowan. kamelamo ta korenangay.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

pyu: a sinanga dra batolrayaw idri na petrir. a papetriran dra kolabaw.
english: This is a clip made of steel and iron, used to catch mice.
What is that thing you put there?

pyu: idri i, amao na petrir na sawawail dra dapalr. a dradrimotran dra ora.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

pyu: semangalan dra to iyaberay dra temowamowan. salaw kalroba ta pinaalropan garem.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

pyu: aiwa! ta kasowaw moroma i drekalr aw marepaninia ta!
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

pyu: an oninan i, palaladam ko kanemo dra kemodakoda ta temarapoyoma marengay kana "garamgaman."
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in puyuma language today.

pyu: an oninan i, palaladam ko kanemo dra kemodakoda ta temarapoyoma marengay kana "kalimodan."
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in puyuma language today.

pyu: nantaw kan manay idri na tratrori?
nantaw kan manay idri na tilin?
nantaw kan manay idri na iyasaos?
sinsi, adri ko kemaso dra tilin.
english: Teacher, I didn't bring my textbook.

pyu: okasa kano risarisan i saninin menao!
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

pyu: talaolep ta lla temakesi. taranapaw i dalan an mowaroma mo.
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

pyu: talaolep ta lla temakesi. marepanaowa ta driya!
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.
Hello everyone, my name is Semalaw.
Hello everyone, my name is Tugi.

pyu: i tinataw ko kan Ising. i Tiwa ko.
to wadi ko kan Ising. i Kimmay ko ngalad.
english: I am Ising's sister. My name is Kimmay.

pyu: nanko sinsi taytaw. i Holon to ngalad.
i baelli na mainayan. i Kisaw to ngalad.
i manay to ngalan kan bao na babayan?
english: What is your elder sister's name?

pyu: i Apeng to ngalan kan baelli na babayan.
english: My elder sister's name is Apeng.

pyu: i manay to ngalan kano wadi na babayan?
english: What is your younger sister's name?

pyu: i Pipis to ngalan kanko wadi na babayan.
english: My younger sister's name is Pipis.

pyu: monoma to ami kan bao na mainayan garem?
english: How old is your elder brother?

pyu: moketrep miasma dra lrowatra to ami garem.
monoma lla to ami kano wadi na mainayan garem?
english: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

pyu: temakesi yo kanemo drekall na takesian?
english: Do you study in your tribe's school?

pyu: aiwa, an kadro mi i takesian temakesi i, kamawan mi dra saromaenan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

pyu: amelli, to alialian kanko wadi na mainayan taytaw.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

pyu: amelli, ko wadi na babayan taytaw.
english: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

pyu: oniyan ko dra wadi dra mainayan. ollaya a miyatelo ko wadi na babayan.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

pyu: aiwa, i baelli na mainayan taytaw.
parollitek na wari garem. treketrekel dra bias dra enay.
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

pyu: parobias na wari garem. treketrekel dra enay.
english: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

pyu: panana na kadaw. adri kaabalo penadang kana patatalaan dra kadaw.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

pyu: adri kakadaw an daman. kakotrem aw kapakakireb a bali.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

pyu: parollitek kandri na wari. pikirowan dra patratreell an owapatraran yo.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How's the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

pyu: kainanaba na wari an adro. adri kaaodall.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

pyu: aiwa, kaaodall na wari an adro.
english: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

pyu: madranga lla na odall. mopatraran lla na kadaw.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

pyu: maodall lla. adri ko kemaso dra kalipang.
english: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

pyu: adri maodall garem. an paelipas dra karealliyan i, kaaodall. kaso lla dra kalipang an owapatraran yo.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

pyu: aiwa, kallallitek na wari an mariami. pikirowan lla dra sadeko.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

pyu: kababias na wari kandri na kadenonan?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

pyu: aiwa, kababias na wari kandri na kadenonan. treketrekel lla dra enay.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

pyu: aiwa, sagar ko an kaseberan. sadeko na wari.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

pyu: adri ko sagar an kapoloan. ollaya a bariwan an kapoloan dar.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

pyu: aiwa, pabolasi ko dra tratrori maw?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

pyu: karealli ko drato patraka dra terekok.
owaowa lla yoyo. an garemay i, kaykoya lla mayaa kano.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

pyu: adri a. kayta driya makotra dra tilin.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

pyu: adri driya. mellallisaw ko dra kaising.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

pyu: daw adri no sabesabi no lima?
english: Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

pyu: an polodos temakesi i, kakakoda yo?
english: What are you going to do after school?

pyu: an polodos temakesi i, kakakoda taytaw?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

pyu: momo, i Araytay kay Lleay mi. trowalli driya na alleban!
english: Grandma, we are Araytay and Lleay, please open the door for us.

pyu: i Boya ko. maaya ko kane Utay.
english: I am Buya, I am here for Utay.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

pyu: paetreng yo lla adri drowa. masopeng ko kano i!
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Lleay, I am here to play with you.

pyu: kamelamo osabak i! paetreng ko lla mengangara kano.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

pyu: nanko sinalem na bonga idrini. tallami a!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

pyu: alamo driya! nanko sinalem na kalimodan idrini. tallami a!
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

pyu: katengadraw driya. nanko sinalem na kadomo idrini. adri pinoka dra powatremel. tallami a!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

pyu: wa! dalleo idri na kadomo i!
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

pyu: adri ko karowa mekan dra asiro. mekana ko dra linggo.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

pyu: kemolitra ko dra kalimodan pakan kano.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

pyu: semangalan! mienay idri na kalimodan i!
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

pyu: mabaka ko dra enay patrekel kano.
english: I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

pyu: wa! salaw ollingoll aw imaran i!
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pyu: kasadroyo mekan! ollaya driya a sadro kadrini.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I'll make myself at home then.

pyu: kasadroyo mekan! ollaya driya a sadro kadrini.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

pyu: sadro lla ko inekanan. adri ko lla pakaekan.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

pyu: ko papilangi mo moka i drenan an oninan.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

pyu: sadro a samekan i drenan kema i nanalli.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

pyu: ko papilangi mo moka i oma an oninan.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

pyu: to papillangi ta kana sinsi moka i kabalawasan.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

pyu: to papillangi ta kana sinsi moka i drenan.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

pyu: aoka ta i kabalawasan an oninan?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

pyu: adri, to papillangi ta kana sinsi moka i drenan.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

pyu: aoka ta i drenan an oninan?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

pyu: adri, aoka ta i oma an oninan.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

pyu: sinsi, aoka ta i kabalawasan menaowa dra manay?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

pyu: sinsi, aoka ta i drenan menaowa dra manay?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

pyu: aoka ta menaowa drata sinaleman na kadomo. taranapaw! ollaya a iyaboreng, a gerger a!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

pyu: sinsi, aoka ta i kabalawasan mellangoya?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pyu: adri, aoka ta menaowa dra tiballball.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

pyu: sinsi, aoka ta i oma semalema dra kolang?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pyu: aoka ta i oma penitawa an oninan.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

pyu: ollaya a tiballball a balriibiiyan kadriyo.
amao ko driya nanao dra baabaaw dra tiballball a oninan.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

pyu: ollaya a aribangllangllawan a balriibiiyan kadriyo.
yē! iowa a! sagar ko dra aribangllangllawan. salaw bolay!
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

pyu: amelli a aribangllangllawan idro. a gerger idro.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.
Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

pyu: aiwa, adri mi aoka i dawill.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

pyu: adri kababekas! patawar kemakawang ane mallado yo!
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?

pyu: moisatr ko dra hikoki moka i Peng-ho.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

pyu: moisatr ko dra sasodang moka i Peng-ho.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

pyu: moisatr dra manay moka i takesian i Agam?
english: How does Agam go to school?

pyu: moisatr dra igiw moka i takesian i Agam.
english: Agam goes to school by train.

pyu: moisatr dra manay moka i kiyokay i Kiring?
english: How does Kiring go to church?

pyu: midinsiya moka i kiyokay i Kiring.
english: Kiring goes to church by bicycle.

pyu: moisatr yo dra ciē-yon moka i takesian?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pyu: adri, moisatr ko dra bas moka i takesian.
english: No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?

pyu: aiwa, midinsiya ko moka i takesian.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pyu: moisatr yo kana pakesop na igiw moka i Takaw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pyu: aiwa, moisatr ko kana pakesop na igiw moka i Takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pyu: moisatr yo dra igiw? adri i, dra hikoki moka i Balangaw?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

pyu: moisatr ko dra hikoki. maraarei dra igiw na hikoki.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pyu: moisatr yo dra bas? adri i, mipalidring yo moka i kiyokay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

pyu: mipalidring ko moka i kiyokay. marakalleayan dra bas an mipalidring ta.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

pyu: adri adallep. miotobay ko moka i sopemarekit.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

pyu: mopatraran ta i siyataw aw kemakawang ta dra llowatra trektrek i, meredek ta lla.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

pyu: kaollallaya no wari an daman? an paelipas dra karealliyan i, kaykoya mayaa kano.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pyu: kiyomalla ko driya, karowa ko lo-in? maranger ko temilill benilin.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

pyu: adri ko bolay. aw adri niriwak i kobaw. aeman a!
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.

pyu: ane kemadro i, semiyasiyasing ko lla.
english: Then I will just take photos.

pyu: karowa ko lla kiyomall kano. semangalan!
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pyu: kiyomala ko driya. a llallak yo driya i, kiyakaron yo dra manay?
english: What do you do when you are young?

pyu: asowa driya i, a kinsas ko. meretra ko lla garam.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pyu: adri, kaadro i tokay ko wallak.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

pyu: benaaw ko dra sowan dra saya. aw dra ayam dra saya. nanko trao i sabak nadro.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pyu: koyko driya. benaaw ko dra ngiyaw dra saya. ollaya ta kiyarepaillangan a garamgaman i, adri ta lla sallengseng.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pyu: maranger ko kiyomall kano drato llegiyan dra paallopan.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pyu: adri sadro ko kinalladraman. ti tobangaw yo kananko kinasaigowan i!
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pyu: nanemo sinadaday dra paallopan i, ollaya to llegiyan?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pyu: naniyam sinadaday dra paallopan i, adri karowa semegiw a babayan.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pyu: karowa korenang moka paallopa a babayan?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

pyu: adri! adri karowa moka paallopa a babayan.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

pyu: Kosiyang, oniyan lla dra eraw kanta. owa driya trima dra eraw!
english: Kusiyang, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

pyu: ollaya driya a sadalillan i sawka. aeman na tremima i!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pyu: sangeot na sadalillan. owa driya trima dra drowaya dalill.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pyu: tratrima ko dra eraw. menaniwan mo dra eraw?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

pyu: ollaya a! tratrima yo dra monoma?
english: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pyu: tratrima ko dra drowaya dalill. aw tratrima ko driya dra salobokan dra beras.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

pyu: ollaya kadrini na beras. kiyaami yo driya dra manay?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pyu: tratrima ko driya dra bitrenon. ollaya?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.

pyu: maranger yo tremima kana kemodakoda na kirowan?
english: What kind of clothes do you like?

pyu: tratrima ko kana lliketri to asell na kirowan.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pyu: ollaya driya a droma to edad?
ollaya driya a bolenan aw a tremangiya.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

pyu: berayi ko dra saya kana tremangiya na kirowan!
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

pyu: Kosiyang, moka yo isowa a garemay? moka yo merenarenadra?
english: Kusiyang, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pyu: adri a! moka ko pollanga kan emo na babayan tremimaa dra kolang.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pyu: a kemadri! piyawari yo an karaob? kowarenang yo kanko moka mekana?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

pyu: adri ko pakaaoka! aoka ko tremimaa dra kirowan.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

pyu: an kemadro i, korenanga ko kano moka i!
english: Then, I will go with you.

pyu: inabayan! kiyomalla ko driya. monoma paiso idri na satenges na kolang?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

pyu: makabetraan paiso na satenges na kolang.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

pyu: makatelon paiso na satintin na bonga.
berayi ko dra drowaya tenges dra kolang aw dra satintin dra bonga.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pyu: Kiyama, abalo ko kemaso dra tratrori. karowa yo pabolas kanko?
english: Kiyama, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pyu: oniyan nanko. nantaw kan Panay idrini.
english: I don't have one either. This is Panay's.

pyu: karowa yo pabolas kanko dra palamo? an garemay i, ti parebeliyasanay lla kano.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pyu: semangalan! semangalan kayo lla i Panay.
english: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

pyu: parebabeliyas ko kandri na drowaya etib na tilin.
english: I want to return these two books.

pyu: aiwa. a manay driya no kiyaamiyan?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

pyu: kiyabolas ko driya kanadri na tolowa etib na tilin.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pyu: inaba lla. an pokatelo wariyan i, adri kaabalo drowa parebeliyasa.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

pyu: adri driya no parebeliyasan kanko na iyasaos.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Kiyama?

pyu: maolid ko i! kayko driya kiyomalla kantaw.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

pyu: ti pabolasay yo driya kananko iyasaos.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

pyu: Panay, to pinabolasan kan Kiyama idri na patratreell kano?
english: Panay, did Kiyama lend you this coat?

pyu: amelli, to trinimaan kan nanalli idrini.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.
Kiyama's coat is the same as yours.

pyu: a odreodrem to patratreelr. adri marisan naniyam edad.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pyu: Panay, kibolas yo dra paiso kan Kiyama?
english: Panay, did you borrow money from Kiyama?

pyu: aiwa. panaan i, parebabeliyas ko kantaw garem kema ko i, abalo ko kemaso dra paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

pyu: an asowa i, no parebabeliyasan lla?
english: Then, when will you return the money?

pyu: an daman i, ko parebabeliyasan kantaw lla.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.

pyu: aiwa. ti rengayaw lla i Kiyama.
english: Okay, I will tell Kiyama for you.
