pyu: na kolabaw i, ta petriray kana petrir na tratreellan dra barasa. na tikoras i, ta petriray kana petrir na sawail. an kemadri i, penaowa.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pyu: aiwa. a kemadrini. pamelli ko i! driyama, adri ko miyatiyo.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pyu: ti paladamaw yo kemodakoda ta demaway kandri na drowaya na petrir.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pyu: wa dra inaba i! an kemadrini i likodran i, piyatiyo ko lla dra rawa.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pyu: asatr lla dradro na tralon i oma. owa alako na kawkaw i kobaw. kayta i oma.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pyu: ollaya kana kamoo i saninin. an mosabak yo i kobaw i, nanao yo.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pyu: taranapaw an demikes yo! adri kababoli! salaw idangan na kawkaw.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pyu: ollaya kana kawi i makadare ko petrir.
english: My trap is under that tree.

pyu: ko podrongay kadrini. aw malladram ko dra ollaya isowa ko petrir.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pyu: a boebo idri. ta retraanay i inayan kiyakoraw.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pyu: kaniyam kadriyo i, oniyan mi dra boebo. mipangasipan mi pangasip dra koraw.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pyu: adri ko driya temallam mipangasipan. an masall lla i, paladamo ko maw?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pyu: aiwa i! an masall lla i, sallangana ta moka pangasipa.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pyu: an masall lla i, ti paladamaw yo demaway dra boebo.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pyu: magingaging no pangasipan. alla motiyo a koraw mako! kamelamoi kemedreng!
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pyu: kadranga driya! magiyangaging na tamina. kadrowa ko kadri kemedreng kana pangasipan. owa kadriyo alakan ko dra tabokoll.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pyu: kedrengo kanko kadri na koraw! ti pollangay yo kemedreng.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pyu: iowa dra inaba i! sadro ta koraw. matemoy ta karisis.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pyu: kamelamowa ta moroma aw pasiyawa ta dra niromaenan.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

pyu: adri kalalinay lra! kamelamo owa katengadraw kano katatengadrawan!
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pyu: karesasama na wari garem kana saliyosan?
liyosan lima kana saliyosan garem, sasede ta an daman, salrangana ta moka malinaya!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.

pyu: karesasama na wari an daman kana saliyosan?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?

pyu: liyosan telo kana saliyosan an daman, an paelipas dra karealriyan an daman i kayta malinaya dra mali!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

pyu: kakakoda yo an daman dra semalowan?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pyu: kasedean dra saliyosan an daman, pararenang mi kan nanalri moka i kiyokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pyu: delalo ko, aoka ko i powatraiyan.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko tiyalr, aoka ko i powatraiyan.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pyu: karowa ko moka semabesaba dra lima?
english: May I go wash my hands?

pyu: adalrep ta lra temalaolep temakesi, owa lra an garemay.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pyu: sinsi, nana ko trangoro, sasede ko an paelipas dra karealriyan.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pyu: aiwa, an owaroma yo i taranapaw i dalan!
english: Okay, take care and go home.

pyu: sinsi, an masalr dra liyosan sa i sasede ko, aoka ko kinaowa dra ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pyu: nana to tiyalr, olraya i powatraiyan.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pyu: sinsi, nana to takolaw kan Konas, semede garem.
english: Teacher, Kunas has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pyu: rengay driya dra i manay kakowa ta kano.
i Uking Tatiyam ko ngalad, moketrep ko ami garem.
english: My name is Uking Tatiyam, and I'm 10 years old.

pyu: a walrak yo kana isowa na maonan?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

pyu: a Inanowayan peniya mo trao i sabak?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Pinuyumayan.

pyu: amelri, a Pinoyomayan i namalri, a Pairang i nanalri.
english: No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pyu: to walrak ko kan Sakay Tatiyam.
i temama idriyo? monoma lra to ami?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pyu: amelri, naniyam maaidrangan i drekalr taytaw, makawalo lra to ami.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pyu: monoma lra to ami kan bao na mainayan?
moketrep misama dra walowa to ami kan baelri na mainayan.
maramaidrang kano dra sadro i bao na mainayan?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

pyu: saleman misama dra makapetelr sekiyan ko ikaasatr.
paetreng ta lra adri marepanao, asatr yo lra?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pyu: aiwa a! saleman miasma dra makatelon sekiyan ko ikaasatr.
aiwa, makatelon kilo ko lra garem.
aoka ko i pan-kong-se mayaa kana sinsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

pyu: olraya kana danaw dra lralrangoyan, aoka korenanga kana marepaokaoka dra melrangoy an garemay.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pyu: olraya isowa i Nawinaw? aoka kana maariari dra kabekas an garemay taytaw.
english: Where is Nawinaw? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pyu: olraya kana owakasayan maradrok, kayko mayaa kantaw.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.

pyu: salrangana ta moka i renarenadran i!
english: Let's go to the playground together.

pyu: kayko driya tremimaa dra karealriyan, an garemay i moka ko lra mayaa kano.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

pyu: marenanga ta moka madrasa kana tabotabo i!
english: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pyu: owa aya dra droma dra trao, aoka ko mayaa kana sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pyu: i Isaw i aoka korenanga kana merepaokaoka dra korokēt an oninan?
english: Is Isawco mpeting in croquet today?

pyu: adri, aoka korenanga kana merepaokaoka dra paselekaw drato ikaasatr.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

pyu: an marepaokaoka dra rarenadran kana wari i kowarenang yo dra marepaokaoka?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pyu: aiwa i! aoka ko korenanga kana maariari dra kabekas.
aoka ko korenanga kana merepaokaoka dra korokēt.
an marepaokaoka dra rarenadran kandro na wari i kakakoda ta?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

pyu: aoka ta korenanga kana merepaokaoka dra makedrekedreng dra towaso.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

pyu: naniwan ta dra aekanan an marepaokaoka dra rarenadran?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

pyu: moalak yo dra asanga! makeser yo i!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!
Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pyu: oniyan, mopatraran a garemay. owaroma an aremeng lra.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pyu: olraya kana pokadrowa tadrar. owa ayao i makasatr.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pyu: i Minoro a! paetreng ko lra adri menao kano. inaba yo driya?
english: It's Minuru. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

pyu: aiwa! inaba ko driya! drowa ko mayaa kano madradrayara.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pyu: olraya i sawka meriyangering dra iropan. kayko rengayaw i namalri.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

pyu: moka i powaterekokan dremimotra dra terekok.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pyu: paetreng ta lra adri menao kano. asatr yo lra.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.
It's so good to see you.

pyu: a baberay kanemo idri na pangodralr. retraan i palralritekan.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pyu: paetreng yo lra adri drowa. mokasaya ta mekan i!
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pyu: adri kabangabang. tremekela ko dra kolisapa. kayta i kalawalawayan madradrayara.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

pyu: semangalan dramo iyalobis. owaborek ko lra.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pyu: a trinowak a garemay idri na terekok. kasoyo moroma! patawari lra mekan.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pyu: an paelipas dra karealriyan an daman i, marepanaowa ta maw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pyu: marepanaowa ta i takesian i? aro lalo-ing ta.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pyu: inaba an moka ta i palakowan. piakirowan ko dra bolretrenganan moka.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pyu: an miapotr na sakora kaniyam drekalr i, salaw bolay! an mobaba lra i, alamo lra kaniyam!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pyu: ngangara ko palro dra kaseberan lra. paetreng lra dradro!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

pyu: an mangayaw i, alamo lra i!
english: Then come during our The hunting festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pyu: kiyomalra ko driya, daw moasalr yo moroma i drekalr?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

pyu: daw adri yo kadro i sinki patakesi?
english: Why not teach in the city?

pyu: masopeng ko i kadrekalran. aw maranger ko pasoba dra drekalr.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pyu: saigo yo temenon. i manay na paladam kano?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

pyu: i molri na babayan na paladam. i molri na babayan i, amao na marasaigoigo temenon kaniyam drekalr.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pyu: naniyam kakowayanan na temenon. maranger ko tremongotrongolr dra kakowayanan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pyu: salaw dalreo an tremekel ta kandri na dinoliyan i!
saigo yo i! paetreng an temoeraw ta dar?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pyu: adri, kararowa dra saliyosan. marowa ta lra emabak dra dalilr tremekel. ta taoraw driya demero na drinereman na driketran. an madero lra ta palritekay na bineraberas. amerasay dra saima dra enay aw paredraolaw dra pikkak. abakaw kana golrigolriyan aw retraanay kana mobekebek.
english: No, it only takes about a week. Steam the soaked glutinous rice and let it cool. Sprinkle a little cold water over the rice to mix it up, then add the koji to the rice, stir it well, and pack it into an urn.

pyu: olraya a kamangolr aw a logiw kadrini. nanko sinalem peniya a!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

pyu: trimaay a temaradrowa i, monoma paiso?
mokasakasa i, drowaya leman miasma dra makalrowatr paiso.
sagar ko kandri na kirowan. monoma paiso?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

pyu: padrangal lra dradro. legetro driya dra saima i?
english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pyu: adri karowa. an ta legetray i, kasasipon ko.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pyu: kowadroyaw lra i! tratrima ko dra odreodrem dra kirowan dra saya.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

pyu: tratrima ko kandri na kamotr aw kandri na bolrawan.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

pyu: mokasakasa i, drowaya kodrolr paiso. amao ko nilimayan demaway nadri. kapaaetreng an pamanay yo.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pyu: ti pakalradramay ko anaanayan drowa tremimaa. karowa kemadolo driya?
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

pyu: aiwa i! ta legetray dra saima.
english: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

pyu: alamo nao a! menaniwan ko dra kirowarowan lra, dra kabokabong lra.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pyu: kiyomalra ko driya, na kirowan i, monoma paiso?
na saya i, tolowa leman miasma dra makalrowatr paiso. an tolowa i, sakodrolr paiso.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pyu: tratrima ko dra saya dra kirowan. berayi ko kana bekalan.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pyu: inabayan! maranger ko tremima dra bineraberas aw na patraka na tinenger dra makaw.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

pyu: oniyan lra na bineraberas. olraya na pinadrelretr dra tana. tratrima yo?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

pyu: aiwa i! berayi ko dra saya. an masalr lra i, drowa ko lra tremimaa dra bineraberas.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

pyu: aiwa, ti abakaw driya dra abakan. kemadri i, makalrowatr paiso.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pyu: pitowa toki mokowa ko i kongkowan.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

pyu: takakesi lra, mosavak na sinsi i takesiyan, marengay na pancang "katikedir! songar!"
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

pyu: no temakakesi mi mo, panadam na sinsi kaniyam kana tinarakasavakan na maiyoiyop na ngai.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.

pyu: mitolos mi kana sinsi miyop, di semenay mi kana maiyoiyop na senay.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

pyu: sado lra nangko kinasayho kananta piningaiyan.
english: I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

pyu: mokowa ko i kongkowan kana wariwari diya, menadanadam ko kananta piningaiyan kana wariwari, rarengay ko pakinger kani nani.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

pyu: i Asing to ngadan ni malri.
i Ikay to ngadan ni nani.
olra ko iva na ma'inay a sasa, i Udalr to ngadan, polo'sa to 'ami harem.
english: I have a brother, his name is Udalr, he is 11 years old.
We study in the same school.

pyu: ingko di i valri na ma'inay mo, sahar mi semenay.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

pyu: sahar ko pakolima, no kasede'an mo, mokasa mi saroma'enan mokowa pakolimaya.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

pyu: sahar ko kirekadalram da vekalan na 'aliyan, karowa mi mokasa semenay di pakolima.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

pyu: ingko di i malri, i nani, i valri na ma'inay di i valri na vavayan.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

pyu: tihasar i malri, kinsas i malri.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

pyu: valivaliw i nani, ising i nani.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

pyu: no kasede'an na deron mo, adi aadi mi moroma' i dekalr.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

pyu: marelrang ko kana valri 'emvang da kakiyas.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

pyu: marelrang ko kani nani mokowa kivangavanga kanini na wari.
english: I went out with my mother today.

pyu: no 'oninan i rokop salaw cangiya, adi aretid di adi vi'as na wari.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

pyu: kemayan mi i dadare' mekan da ampang, mokadaw naniyam dadek, salaw sadeko.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

pyu: piya kare'alri, demangdalang lra na lokop.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

pyu: kiomalr ko kani nani, man dangdalang na lokop?
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

pyu: marengay i nani, lramo papana lra na variw kema.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

pyu: no 'aremeng oniyan da lonev i lokop, mopacalan na vito'en.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

pyu: moraroma' mi i dadalan mo, kianon ko kana vito'en.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

pyu: amana mopana na variw, maranger ko diya mopacalan kivangavanga.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

pyu: adi ma'idang naniyam kongkowan, adi kadowan na temakakesi, marekadalram mi papiya.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

pyu: na lralrak modowadok i lalinayan, mokasa malimali, mokasa madayadayar.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

pyu: na sinsi mokasa kaniyam kivangavang, i kongkowan mao na ma'idang na saroma'enan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

pyu: maidaidap mi kana wariwari, niyam aidapay paka'iceras i takesiyan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

pyu: olra na mokowa micora da lataw, olra na mokowa midappa.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

pyu: madalram mi da midap kana makapoyongan i kongkowan. karekikakaron mi papiya, 'iceras i kongkowan kana wariwari diya.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

pyu: adaman, mokowa ko modadangiya kani molri na ma'inay.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

pyu: sawariyan mi lra adi marepana'o, sare'ed ko kantaw.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

pyu: mena'o i molri kaningko, payas pakan kaningko da taramonah, di pa'ao da ociya kaningko.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

pyu: tavo' to sinaleman na taramonah i molri na ma'inay, di tatena' da imaran.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

pyu: sahar ko kanto ociya ni molri na ma'inay, di imaran no 'emao ta.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

pyu: no kare'alriyan, marelrang ko kani molri na vavayan demero da kare'a'alriyan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

pyu: kasadowan to tinosiyawan ni molri na vavayan, olra a volraw, olra a voyo, olra a siyak di dindin diya.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pyu: piya mi lra kare'alri mo, mokowa mi i sayhe kikolanga.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

pyu: i molri na vavayan melak da sado vorasi, vo'ir di lakiw, veray kaningko, paadayan moroma'.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

pyu: mokowa ko somongara kanado, marengaya da dadowa ko diya mena'owa kanado no kadaidan lra.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

pyu: harem kana wari to pilralrangaw mi na sinsi mokowa i tong-o-yoēn, motolik mi i salikid cimima' da kimpo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

pyu: mosavak mi i tong-o-yoēn mo, marengay na sinsi, i ngangowayan mo, mao na 'aya'ayam, i likodan mo, mao na onaonan, kalrawayo kanmo mena'owa mo papiya.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

pyu: makaod ko da onan, semalra adi ko yana'o da onaonan.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

pyu: mena'o ko da sado a 'ayam, kado i makaics kana kawi moviivii, di mena'o ko da alrope' na 'alreco i makasavak kananto vowang na kawi.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

pyu: i savak kana tong-o-yoēn olra na ma'idang na zo, oma di likolraw, adi ko diya mena'o kanani na haramhaman, salaw ko semangal harem kanangko ina'owan.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

pyu: semasiyasing ko da sado na siyasing, pana'o kana malri di nani.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

pyu: no masalr lra mo, marelranga ko lra kana malri di nani dowa kani mena'owa.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

pyu: kanini na kasede'an, marelran ko kani valri na vavayan mokowa i valangaw modadangiya kani ama na maralrak kani malri.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

pyu: kemay Tayhok moicas mi da kissiya mokowa i Valangaw.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

pyu: meredek mi i Valangaw, i ama na maralrak kani malri midosiya dowa poicasa kaniyam.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

pyu: kanto 'odar ni ama mo, olra a ma'idang na powarikanan, marelrang mi midinsiya mokowa kanido na powarikanan.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

pyu: kado i powarikanan mo, to adayaw mi i ama pakan kana takolris di to poicasaw mi kana oma.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

pyu: no 'aremeng, marelrang mi mokowa mekana i maci.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

pyu: alra sado na dosiya i maci, semalra miotabay mi mokowa kado.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

pyu: yavorok mi mo, mena'o mi lra da kicakaw lra naniyam otobay. moicas mi lra kana bas moroma'.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

pyu: moroma' mi lra i Tayhok harem di, nanto otobay ni ama mo, moacevong lra nay?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

pyu: makiteng ko diya kaado mi i Valangaw, temakakesi ko lra mo, mokowa mi kikadowa i Tayhok, kadokado mi lra i maci.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Valangaw. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

pyu: temakesi ko lra i Daygak mo, temakesi ko kananto cepa na Yoēncomin, madalram ko lra da olra marekamelrimelri ta maowan di ta kakowayanan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

pyu: semalra, kanini na kasede'an na deron mo, ingko di i valri na ma'inay moroma' mi i dekalr kiomaomalr kana dawdawan, maranger ko madalram data kakowayanan inta.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

pyu: molavat lra da makawalon to 'ami ini na dawdawan, aymo, mena'o ta lralrak diya to pinidadekan.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

pyu: kiomalr ko kantaw da sayho marengay da eman ngaiyan? no temarakasavakan salaw 'ilrepat, di sayho diya tamarapayrang, tamaramingkok di temaradipong.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Kasavakan, as well as Hokkien, Chinese and Japanese.

pyu: kiomalr ko lra madalram ko lra, mao na makiteng diya mo, temakesi kana Dipong, di mitoroma'an da payrang, di kananto kiyakaronan marekadalram kana Rotiya, semalra sado lra to kinasayhowan da piningaiyan.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Hokkien, and he knows many Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

pyu: madayadayar mi mo, sado to rinarengay na dawdawan kananto ikadalraman da kakowayanan a pa'a'alropan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

pyu: ara adiya mi karowa madalram penaowa dato rinarengay, aymo, niyam pasirepay kana Soci, no moroma' mi lra marowa mi diya temarakinger.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

pyu: makiteng ko diya adi ko kamadalraman data kakowayanan. poremasamad ko kana mao ko na Yoēncomin.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

pyu: marekasado lra nangko kinadalraman mo, marekasado lra ko kinapakomao data kirekamelriyan a pinoyomayan, di mao na pakamacas data anger awlra!
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a pinuyumayan is unique and something to be proud of.

pyu: kanini na wari no aloso kadaw, oraroma' lra i wadi na ma'inay.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

pyu: marelrang ko kani molri na vavayan mokowa i iciba cimima'a da voyo, padolo mi da keraraviyan pangara kani wadi na ma'inay.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

pyu: makalrang mi kana menaniwan da kolakolang, kasadowan na menaniwan kana ma'ama'at diya na kolang.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

pyu: cimima' mi da takongkong, tavolaylay di ningzing.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

pyu: na menaniwan kana vowa' i ngidiran na tawki marengay, "nangko re'a di lopas salaw tavo', kadika cima' saeman" kema.
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

pyu: cimima' mi da re'a di lopas.
makalrang mi kana menaniwan da tiwngan, marengay na tawki "cacima' mo da eman? olra a ma'idang di semver na voyo harem, sasaya mo, telo leman. " kema.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

pyu: padangal dado kema i molri na vavayan, kiomalr kana tawki karowa diya kemadolo? kema.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

pyu: aymo, madolo lra kema na tawki, adi mowai lemehec.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

pyu: to 'odar na tawki marengay, kadika cima' kanangko volraw, nangko volraw ma'idang di madolo kema.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

pyu: likodan lra cimima' mi lra da voyo di volraw, moroma' mi demero mi da matemoy a to na siyaw.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

pyu: mangala mi sawariyan, 'aremeng lra na wari.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

pyu: padingwa pokowani marengay i wadi pakonamon lra da adi karowa semede' i hitayan kema. no masalr lra na kasede'an mo, karowa ko lra moroma' kema.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

pyu: sakowani lra na dinerowan di owa sa'olo papiya mokasaya ta mekan no kemado. kema i molri na vavayan.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

pyu: sema'ol mi da wadadiyan, mokasa mi mekan kanani na imaran na keraraviyan.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

pyu: olra ko lralrang temakesi i Capang, marayas malalop miinada da eman diya.
english: I have a classmate named Capang, he often forgets to bring things.

pyu: no takakesi ta mo, kivelas kana lralrang da impic, aicer, melri mo, mao na vavalrayan.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

pyu: parasan, parepowan, paretelon, to pavelasay papiya kanintaw.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

pyu: aymo, kowaceng nanto kakowayanan, marayas kivelas da eman diya di, ma'olid paveliyas.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

pyu: likodan lra adi lra maranger pavelas da eman diya kanintaw.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

pyu: olra a saya wari, mokowa mi kivangavanga papiya.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

pyu: kado i dadalan, maranger moca'iya i Capang, malalop diya miinada da ciligami.
english: On the way, Capang wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

pyu: kivavelas kana lralrang da ciligami mo, tomovang papiya kantaw, adi ko miinada to kowayaw.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

pyu: macangis to helran, 'ilremes marengay, man adi mo mowai pavelas kaningko da ciligami papiya?
english: Capang burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

pyu: to tovangaw na lralrang, alra adi o mowai minada, pawnong no kivelas o diya mo, adi o pavaveliyas.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

pyu: ado kana 'emanan mokowa i kongkowan, semavalr meredek lra i Capang i kongkowan. to paveliyasaw kana lralrang kananto kinivelas diya na eman diya.
english: The next day at school, Capang arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

pyu: somongar kana lralrang i Capang, di marengay da yaada ko lra kanangko eman diya no masalr lra kema. di somongar diya kana lralrang da kinadaman diya na mowai pavelas kanintaw da eman diya.
english: Capang apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

pyu: mao na pararawa i dekalr ni malri.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

pyu: makiteng ko diya mo, i malri di i ama na maralrak kani malri, no 'aremeng mokakowa i calon, miinada da tadaw di kowang.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

pyu: no 'oninan lra mo, to adayaw nanto rawa poroma'.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

pyu: no eman mao na vavoy, no eman mao na rava, no eman mirawa da too'.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

pyu: to karelrawalrawa'ay i salikid kana dekalr, po'acar kana dinkalranan.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

pyu: marayas ko makiwalray kani malri, maranger ko korelrang mokowa pa'alropa.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

pyu: no ma'idang ko lra toy pilralrangaw ko lra mokowa kema i malri.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

pyu: na ma'inayan i dekalr sayho penecir da rawa, sayho demaway da potiro'an di cine'ece'an da varasa' na pecir.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

pyu: sayho demaway i malri kana potiro'an na pecir, marengay i malri mo, ini mao na 'a'evangen kana too', ta tarena'oway to dinapalran na rawa, na pecir mo ta ca'anay kananto kakalrangan na dalan kema.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

pyu: kana ko marangeran pakonamon korelrang kana ma'idangan mokowa pa'alropa, kana wariwari diya menadanadam ko demaway kana pecir. adi sawariyan nangko pecir tatena' pateka lra rawa.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

pyu: mena'o lra i malri mo, marengay kaningko, no kadaidan lra kamao o na tatena' na pararawa kema.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

pyu: ma'idang ko lra harem, ko padekaw nangko kadalis di valro', marelrang ko kani malri mokowa pa'alropa.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

pyu: moroma' mi i dekalr mo, naniyam rawa niyam po'acaranay kana dinkalranan.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

pyu: marengay i malri, sasongar ta kananto ipovati da temowamowan, to iveray kanta da rawa karowa ta diya lremawa'.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

pyu: piwari ko lra mokowa i kongkowan a semavalr.
english: I was late for school this morning.

pyu: mokowa ko i kongkowan mo, malalop ko miinada dako 'aliyoc.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

pyu: adi ko miinada da eman diya.
english: I didn't bring anything with me.

pyu: temakakesi mi mo, marelrang ko kanangko lralrang mokasa mena'o da valray.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

pyu: semaseking mi mo, to pavolasay ko da impic di aicor nangko lralrang.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

pyu: i Amsing ko 'aliyan, alrak a Pinoyomayan.
english: My good friend's name is Amsing, and he is also an Pinuyumayan child.

pyu: mokasa mi temakesi kana dekalr i Kasavakan.
english: We study together in the Kasavakan tribe.

pyu: malayas mi mokasa kingkinger dato vinavati na dawdawan da vativatiyan, sayhowan mi lra kinger da tinaraKasavakan na vativatiyan.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Kasavakan proficiently.

pyu: aloso ko di valivaliw ko, i Amsing mo, tihasar di marekedang.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Amsing is short and thin.

pyu: i Amsing mo, salaw dalikedik di sidalo da cao, sahar na cao diya kantaw.
english: Amsing is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

pyu: ondokay harem kana wari i kongkowan, kasadowan to i parepakowa i kongkowan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

pyu: olra na makedekedeng kana cali, na cemapi'i kana mali, pavekas, malikasaw, di papana'an.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

pyu: ado pavekas ko mo, koretapelra' ko, modara' pakirev ko todo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

pyu: aymo, marahan ko diya, adi ko madiyadi mongaway pavekas.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

pyu: meredek ko lra i raredekan mo, semangal na cao mapiya.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

pyu: ara adiya ko moelak kana sanga mo, salaw ko semangal, alra polodos ko lra kana ma'ari'ari.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

pyu: marelrang ko kani malri mokowa modadangiya kani temama Awi a adaman.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

pyu: mopanana to kowi ni temama Awi.
tomolralre'ay kana sa'ov mo, mo'adolay di motani lra kemay sawsa'ov.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

pyu: miinada da tiwngan a hong di poran i malri vaveray kani tamama Awi.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

pyu: kado mi kananto vinseng madayadayar, kasadowan to vinavati pakinger kaniyam da vativatiyan.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

pyu: movavorok mi mo, marengay i temama Awi da tihasar o lra di vangsar o lra kema kaningko.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

pyu: tomovang ko da " lrayowan! ama, no 'inava lra nano kowi mo, kadika lra kaniyam modadangiya mo! " kema ko.
english: I said, When your foot gets better

pyu: kana 2022'ami, na sého paladok da kayhiyan kana to bibonsiyo na Yoéncomin karowa potokasa povalray da kangadanan.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

pyu: kiomalr ko kana vangsaran i dekalr i Lahay Rovolreng, mao na pa'eceng lra kiami kana sého da "potokasa da kangadanan" kananta bibonsiyo intaw.
english: I interviewed Lahay Ruvulreng, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

pyu: marekoret mi kanini na kasede'an yawa ko kantaw kiomalra.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

pyu: kiomaomalr ko mo, to omalray ko kananto kangadanan na ipakalrangan di to adayaw ko pana'o kananto saroma'ean di kananto dekalr.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

pyu: kiomalr ko kanintaw man no asalraw nano ngadan, adi 'inava na maloman na povalray diyamaw?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

pyu: marengay kaningko, alra na tinararotiya na valray mo, adi marowa penatedelr povalray kananto ngadan, di olra na doma na cao "Lasinsen" kema mavina kanintaw, semalra malayas ki'apa'apa. kema.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \La Xian Sheng

pyu: marengay i Lahay Rovolreng "na vinalrayan kananta valray na Yoéncomin mo, tatena' mao nanta kangadanan. nangko ngadan pinocepa lra kananiyam maowan, kananiyam pa'atayan, kananiyam inocaowan, 'inava no kadowan na cao to acovongaw nanto kangadanan. kema.
english: Lahay Ruvulreng said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

pyu: adaman marelrang ko kani molri na vavayan mokowa i iciba meniwana, i molri na vavayan miinada da sado to sinaleman na kolakolang meniwan, di demero diya da paakan kana okiyakesang.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

pyu: sahar papiya na cao kanto naniwanan, na kamangolr di na lrosi kadowan na cemacima', kadowan na dowa patalrama kananto tinosiyaw ni molri na vavayan.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and Cane palm, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

pyu: nanto dinero na pinowayan kana molingalingaw na kinavelas pokasa kana imaran, olra diya na tiwngan a vavoy tinosiyaw kana lramomo, to liwlran pokasa kana pasirep pokowani da okiyakesang, kadowan na dadowa motolik kananiyam naniwanan.
english: The Lima Bean and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

pyu: no demadero i molri na vavayan, kado ko i ngidilan tematowap kicacevok ko kana okiyakesang. tamoni ko marengay da "nahni na kolakolang mao naniyam sinaleman, adi mi pakiwalay pocemel. pakonamon kadika cimima'" kemako.
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

pyu: naniyam emandiya adi repidan piya mi lra meniwan, marengay i molri na vavayan "amao na olra ino na polraalrang" kema kaningko.
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

pyu: ini na semasahar, kipanadam ko lra dato sinaleman di to kadalraman da akanen na Yéncomin, di pinatalram ko lra dato olepan na menaniwan i naniwanan.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

pyu: mena'o ko lra kani molri na vavayan kanto misaharan kana akanen a kinaawac pokasa asavak ko semangalan.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

pyu: harem kana wari pitowa toki mo medek ko i kongkowan.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

pyu: powateha mi lra temakesi zi, mosavak na sinsi i takakesiyan, na niyam kemakezeng na sasevangan marengay, "katikeriz! songal!" kema marengay.
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

pyu: temakakesi mi lra, na sinsi pananadam kananta piningaiyan na aiyopan.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.

pyu: mitoros mi kana sinsi miyop, semenay mi kana senay na aiyopan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

pyu: kana wariwari ziya mokakowa ko i kongkowan, kana wariwari ziya mo menadanadam ko kananta piningaiyan, rarengay ko pakinger kani ina.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

pyu: to ngadan ni malri mo maw i Kaliya.
to ngadan ni nani mo maw i Lapi.
olra i valri na ma'inay a sasa, to ngadan maw i Uking, i intaw harem mo moketrep misama' za saya to 'ami.
english: I have a brother, his name is Uking, he is 11 years old.

pyu: salrangan mi temakesi kana saya kongkowan.
english: We study in the same school.

pyu: inko za i valri sahar mi semenay.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

pyu: sahar ko pakolimalima, no katalaolepan i kongkowan mo, salrangan mi saroma'enan mokowa pakolimaya.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

pyu: sahar ko manadam kana vekal na ali'an, arowa mi salrangan semenay zi mokowa pakolimaya.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

pyu: inko kana malri, i nani, i valri na ma'inay zi i valri na vavayan salrangalrangan mi kazo.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

pyu: atras i malri, zi kinsas i malri.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

pyu: varivariw i nani, zi ising intaw.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

pyu: no katalaolepan i kongkowan no deron mo moroma' mi i zekalr.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

pyu: inko zi nanko maradawan salrangan mi mokowa kikakiyasa.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
I like our family very much.

pyu: harem kana wari salrangan ko kani nani mokowa kivangavanga.
english: I went out with my mother today.

pyu: no 'oninan na wari mo na rokop mo temangiya, na wari mo 'azi aretid zi 'azi vias, zi valiyan na vali.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

pyu: kazo mi kana talonan i itras maekan mi za pang, na senan na kadaw to kadaway niyam zazek, salaw ta sadeko.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

pyu: aloso na kadaw na rokop mo zemoni' lra.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

pyu: ko kiomalray i nani, kemazo zi zangzarang na rokop.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

pyu: marengay i nani mo, alra mo raredek lra a variw.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

pyu: a 'aremeng mo i rokop iniyan za ronev, mopana lra na vito'en.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

pyu: a moraroma' mi i dadalan mo, tremepa ko kana vito'en marengay zako anger
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

pyu: 'aziya mopana na variw, zi maranger ko ziya mopatraran mokowa kivangavanga.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

pyu: niyam kongkowan 'azi ma'izang, 'azi kazowan na temakakesi, marekazalrazalram mi papiya.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

pyu: na temakakesi ziya na lralrak mowazok i lalinayan, salrangan mi malimali, salrangan mi mazayazayar za niyam anger.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

pyu: na sinsi mo salrangan kaniniyam kivangavang, na kongkowan mo kamawan kana ma'izang na saroma'enan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

pyu: kana wariwari ziya mo mi idapay, inta papiya ta tolre'ayaw midap takakesiyan i savak.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

pyu: olra na zoma maitrol kana lataw, na zoma mo maidap.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

pyu: mi idapay i kongkowan i iyan ziya na kapoyopoyongan, inta mo ta lrawa'aw na kiyakaronan zi mokasaya ta kikaron, mena'o ta kongkowan kana wariwari ziya mo motelre'ay zi volay.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

pyu: adaman kana wari, mokowa ko i zekalr mozazangiya kani molri na ma'inay.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

pyu: sawariyan mi lra 'azi marpana'o zi sare'ez ko kanintaw.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

pyu: i molri mena'o kaninko mo, to pakanay ko za taramonah, zi to pa'away ko za alasepa.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

pyu: to isalem ni molri na ma'inay na taramonah mo salaw tavo', tatena' lra imaran.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

pyu: sahar ko 'emawo kana to alasepa ni molri na ma'inay, mawo 'inava no 'emawo ta.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

pyu: a kara'alriyan azo mo, salrangan ko kani molri na vavayan demoro za kara'alriyen.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

pyu: salaw sazo to tinosasiyaw niyam kare'a'alriyen ni molri na vavayan, olra volraw, olra voyo, olra siyak zi olra ziya dindin.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pyu: piya mi kara'alri mo, mokowa mi i padorina'an kikolanga.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

pyu: i molri na vavayan melak za sazo a vorasi, vo'ir zi lokiyo veray kaninko to paada kaninko moroma'.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

pyu: averok ko lra zi marengay ko kanazo, zazowa ko ziyan mena'owa kaninmo ko kowayaw marengay.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

pyu: harem kana wari na sinsi to adayaw mi mokowa mena'owa kana vinavaaw na haramehaman, kazo mi i solrasolray motorik trematrima' mi za kippo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

pyu: mosavak mi kana vinavaaw kana haramehaman mo, marengay na sinsi, "kazi ngangowayan mo maw na 'ayam na marekamelrimelri to mawan, i likakozan maw na onan na marekamelrimelri to mawan, owa inmo na'ona'o."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

pyu: makaoz ko za onan zi 'azi ko awa mena'owa kana onan na marekamelrimelri.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

pyu: mena'o ko za sazo za 'ayam, kazo i itras kana kawi moviivii, zi mena'o ko za lre'o alrope' kana vangvang i savak kana kawi.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

pyu: i kaziyo kana vavaawan kana haramehaman olra zo, eva zi na likolraw, kemay aziyo ziya 'azi ko ziya mena'o kemania na haramehaman, harem kana wari mena'o ko lra mo, salaw ko semangal.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

pyu: sazo ko sinasing ko pana'oway kana malri za i nani.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

pyu: no masalr mo salralrangan ko lra kana malri za i nani zowa.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

pyu: kanini na talaolepan mo, salrangan ko kani valri na vavayan mokowa mi i Valangaw mozazangiya kani ama na maralrak kani malri.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

pyu: kemay Taihok mi moitras mi za kissiya mokowa i Valangaw.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

pyu: medek mi i Valangaw mo i ama na maralrak kani malri mipalizing zowa i siyataw melaka kaniyam.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

pyu: kazo mi kana porarikanan na hong mo, to adayaw mi i ama pakana kana takolris zi moitras za eva.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

pyu: a aremeng mo salrangan mi mokowa i tokay mekana.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

pyu: i tokay mo sazo a dosiya, zi maw na miotobay mi mokowa kazo.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

pyu: ori kirowaaday mi lra mo, mena'o mi za oniyan naniyam otobay, moitras mi lra kana bas kirowaday kazo.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

pyu: harem mo moroma' mi lra i Taihok, meta lra to atrovongay to otobay ni ama awa?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

pyu: temakesi ko lra i tasyoē mo, temakesi ko parasan zato kakowayanan na Yēncomin, maw na mazalram ko lra kana Taiwan Yēncomin olra marekamelrimelri to kakowayanan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

pyu: maw izo na kanini na 'ami na katalaolepan na deron mo, salrangan ko za i valri na ma'inay moroma' i zekalr kiomaomalr kana dawdawan, maranger ko mazalram kanta mawan nanata kakowayanan.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

pyu: ina dawadawan makawalon lra to 'ami, maw mo no mena'o ta mo kamawan za makanemen ziya to 'ami.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

pyu: ko kiomalray intaw za kararowa o marengay za papidaya za piningaiyan, no marengay kana ngai na Pinoyomayan mo salaw dalos, sayho marengay kana tinarpaayrang, ngai na Amis zi maw na ngai na Dipong.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Pinuyumayan, as well as Hokkien, Pangcah and Japanese.

pyu: kiomalr ko kanintaw mo mazalram ko lra za intaw mo kinamakitengan menadanadam lra kana tinardadipong na ngai, i toroma'antaw mo maw na Amis zi, kanato kiniyakaronan mo kazowan na Payrang to sinadam, maw izo na sayho marengay za sakowaniyani a piningaiyan.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Pangcah, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

pyu: a azo a kiyaomaomalr mi mo, izo na dawdawan mo marengay lra za sazo kanini na watralonan na kinawatranan nata kazaalraman.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

pyu: kara 'azi mi marowa mazalram kinger peniya kana to ngai, maw mo mi sasingaw pasirep kana inadaada na dingwa, karowa ta ziya pakomawmaw kinger.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

pyu: lralrak ko ziya mo 'azi ko mazalram kananta mawan to kakowayanan, tremepa ko kaninko maira ko zako ikayēncomin.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

pyu: kana makasazo lra ko kinazalram mo, maw na mazalram ko lra maw ko na Pinoyomayan, maw na kirekamelri na mawan, arowa ta poitraitras kaninta na Pinoyomayan.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Pinuyumayan is unique and something to be proud of.

pyu: no aremameremeng averok lra i wadilri na ma'inay.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

pyu: salrangan ko kani molri na vavayan mokowa i iciba tremima'a, padolo mi za keraravien kani wadilri na ma'inay.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

pyu: lemavat mi kana menaniwan kana kolang, sazo na ma'ama'at maw ziya kiyakolang.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

pyu: tremima' mi za takongkong, tavorayray zi maw na ninzing.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

pyu: izo na i ngidiran na menaniwan kana inaekan na vowa' izo na tawki marengay, "tavo' nako pangodangodalr zi maw nako lopas. alra trima' za papidaya!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

pyu: tremima' mi za pangodangodalr zi lopas.
makalrang mi kana maniwan kana 'alom mo, izo na tawki mo marengay, "tratrima' mo za eman? harem na voyo ma'izang zi semever, saya mo telo leman paiso."
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

pyu: i molri na vavayan mo pazangal zazo kema, kiomalr kana tawki arowa o kadadolo kanato trima'.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

pyu: maw mo na tawki marengay madolo lra inia, 'azi ta lra kararowa lemehetr.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

pyu: izo nato 'odar na tawki mo marengay, alamo trima' kanako volraw, nako volraw ma'izang zi madolo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

pyu: likozan lra mo tremima' mi za voyo zi tremima' mi za volraw, moroma' mi zi temosasiyaw mi lra za saya to a siyaw.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

pyu: sawariyan mi mengara tivos 'aremeng lra na wari.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

pyu: podingwa moroma' i wadilri na ma'inay marengay mo, na hitay monamon lra 'azi talaaolep kanini na talaolepan kema zi, no masalr lra kana katalaolepan mo arowa ko lra moroma'.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

pyu: i molri na vavayan marengay temosasiyaw ta za sakowani sazo zi, ta rengayaw papiya salrangana ta mekan!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

pyu: mi dawlraw mi wadadiyan zi ali'an, salrangalrangan mi keravi semiyaw kanini na sazo na tinosasiyaw.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

pyu: olra ko lralrang temakesi i Hagi, marayas malalop mada za eman ziya.
english: I have a classmate named Hagi, he often forgets to bring things.

pyu: no temakakesi mi mo, mokowa kivelasa kana to lralrang za impic, aivas zi maw na vavalrayan.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

pyu: no parasan, no repowan, no patelon mo ta pavelasay ziya.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

pyu: maw mo olra to kakowayanan a kowatreng, marayas kivelas zi 'azi palaawli'.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

pyu: likozan lra mo ata lra mowai pavelas kanintaw.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

pyu: olra saya wari, salrangalrangan mi mokowa kivangavanga.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

pyu: kazo mi ziya i dadalan mo, i Hagi mo maranger mokowa i tavonan, maw mo malalop mada za 'a'ilo.
english: On the way, Hagi wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

pyu: kivolas za 'a'ilo kanato lralrang, maw mo nanto lralrang papiya mo temovang kanintaw marengay, 'azi ko mada wa karkowakowa.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

pyu: i Hagi mo matrangis zato aledowan. 'ilremes zi mararengay, mazo inmo papiya 'azi mo mowai pavelas za 'a'ilo kaninko!
english: Hagi burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

pyu: nanto lralrang marengay kanintaw, maw izo na 'azi o mowai mada zi, no kivelas o mo 'azi o palaawli'!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

pyu: a 'emanamanan mokowa mi lra i kongkowan mo, i Hagi mo semavalr kazo lra i kongkowan. i Hagi mo nanto kinivelas ziya kananto lralrang na eman ziya mo to palawli'aw peniya kananto lralrang.
english: The next day at school, Hagi arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

pyu: i Hagi semongal kananto lralrang zato pinamelriyan, zi marengay, aada ko lra za eman ziya zi lrayoan kemaya ko kananko lralrang aziyo ziya mo no kivelas ko mo wai mo pavelas kaninko.
english: Hagi apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

pyu: i kaniyam zekalr i malri mo maw na mowatralon.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

pyu: a lralrak ko ziya mo, i malri zi i malri na maralrak mopatratraran no 'aremeng, miinada za tazaw zi kowang.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

pyu: no 'idenan lra mo, nazo mo miinada kananto rawa moroma'.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

pyu: no eman mo vavoy, no eman mo nawan zi olra no eman mo dapas.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

pyu: kazo lra i salikaz mo to parelrawalrawa'aw nanto rawa, to po'atar kana zinekalranan.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

pyu: no watralon i malri mo makiwalray ko, maranger ko korelrang.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

pyu: marengay i malri mo, no ma'izang o lra mo ko adayaw o lra kema i malri.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

pyu: na ma'inayan i zekalr mokakowa i tralon pentrira sayho demaway kana petrir na venetatevet zi maw na penangangese' na petrir.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

pyu: i malri sayho demaway kana venetatevet na petrir i ama marengay, inia mo maw na papetrir kana dapas, ta tarena'oway nanto dinapalran na haramehaman, na petrir mo ta powanay kana wakalr na haramehaman.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

pyu: zako marangeran salrangan kana ma'izangan mokowa motralona, kana wariwari ziya mo menadanadam ko demaway za petrir, 'azi sawariyan mo, nako dinaway na petreir mo, arowa lra 'emevang za rawa.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

pyu: mena'o i malri mo, marengay kaninko i ino mo no awatr mo maw o na pararawa.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

pyu: harem kana ma'izang ko lra mo, ko ta'asanay nako kazalis zi valro', korelrang ko kani malri salrangan mokowa motralona.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

pyu: medek ko i zekalr mo nanko rawa ko 'atraray na zinekalranan.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

pyu: marengay i malri sasongar ta kana temowamowan to povateay ta za sazo za rawa.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

pyu: a semavalr piwari ko lra mokowa i kongkowan.
english: I was late for school this morning.

pyu: a mokowa ko i kongkowan mo, malalop ko mada kananko lravatr.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

pyu: temakakesi ta lra mo, salrangan ko kana lralrang mena'o za valray.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

pyu: a pataatalram ta kana pataatalraman ta mo, to pavolasay ko na lralrang za tratroli zi maw na aivas.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

pyu: marengay na sinsi kaninko, "no masalr mo savasavalr marahan, amanan lra piwari!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

pyu: ninko ka'ali'an mo i Masaw to ngadan, intaw mo mawo to alrak za Pinoyomayan.
english: My good friend's name is Masaw, and he is also an Pinuyuma child.

pyu: salrangan mi kazo kana zekalr i Katratripolr temakesi
english: We study together in the Katratripulr tribe.

pyu: marayas mi salrangan kingekinger kana dawdawanan mararengay kana omaomalren, iniyam mo sayho mi marengay kana ngai na Pinoyomayan.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Pinuyumayan proficiently.

pyu: inko mo atras ko zi semever ko, i Masaw mo aloso zi varivariw
english: I am tall and overweight, while Masaw is short and thin.

pyu: i Masaw salaw dalikedik sahar a trao papiya kanintaw.
english: Masaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

pyu: harem kana wari i kongkowan mo maw na ma'ari'ari marepakowakowa na wari. sazo na pa'ari'ariyan na parepakowakowayan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

pyu: olra na makakezeng kana lralrakitr, temapi'i kana mali, na pavavekas, maw na malikakasaw, na penapana'.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

pyu: inko mo kowarelrang ko kana pavavekas na pa'ari'ariyan.
english: I participated in the running competition.

pyu: a pavavekas ko mo kotapelra' ko zi modara' kemalrawalrawa ko volan.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

pyu: maw mo marahan ko zi pavekas ko parekipiya.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

pyu: medek ko kana raredekan salaw semangal na trao papiya kaninko.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

pyu: kara 'azi ko melak za sanga mo maw mo semangal ko, kana parekipiya ko kanini na pa'ari'ariyan.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

pyu: a adaman salrangan ko kani malri mokowa mi mozazangiya kani ama na maralrak kani malri.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

pyu: i ama na maralrak kani malri mopanana to kowi.
intaw momalr kaniniyam, na sa'ov mo motravelang.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

pyu: intaw a temolralre'ay kana sa'ov mo, motani kemay sa'osa'ov.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

pyu: i malri mada za 'alom za hong zi poran veray kani ama na maralrak kanintaw.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

pyu: inko zi maw i ama na maralrak kani malri kazo mi kanato kiya'ezengan i savak mokowa ko kimazayazayara, to lrawa'ay ko kananto kinazalram na sazo na omaomalren.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

pyu: a kirewaaday mi pakangaway mo, poliho kaninko i ama za atras o lra, zi vangesar o lra kema.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

pyu: azo a zowa kozolr misama' za makavetra'an zi zowa 'ami, na sēho pakayki na mibonsiyo karowa ta povalray kananta ngadan na Yēncomin.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

pyu: mokowa ko kiomalra kanizo na i zekalr na vangsaran i Acong Rovaniyaw na sawariyan lra kiami kana sēho nata mibonsiyo ta pongadanay kananta ngadan na Yēncomin.
english: I interviewed Acung Ruvaniyaw, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

pyu: inko za intaw kemoret mi kanini na katalaolepan awa ko kantaw kiomaomalra.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

pyu: a kiyaomaomalr ko kantaw mo, to pakazalramay ko zato inoramiyan to ngadan, zi to pakanadamaw ko kananto rinoma'enan zi maw nanto zekalr.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

pyu: ko kiomalray intaw mazo nano anger maranger venalis zata ngadan, izo na maloman na povavalrayan mo kowatreng ziya maw?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

pyu: marengay intaw kaninko, no ta tareminkokaw venavalray mo 'azi arowa penaowa paredek kanato paowayan to ngadan, na zoma na trao no venavina kanintaw mo "izo na ma'inay" kema maw izo na movasok a sazo a kalikeliked a ngai.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \That guy

pyu: i Acong Rovaniyaw marengay, "na vinavalrayan kana to piningaiyan na Yēncomin na ngadan mo, maw na ninta kangadanan. nako ngadan arowa pavoli kanata mawan, niniyam iniyamenan, niniyam ikatratrao mianger ta kananta mawan marekakazowan to aya'aw parevoliyas to ngadan."
english: Acung Ruvaniyaw said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

pyu: inko za i molri na vavayan mokowa mi kana wazokan meniwan powayar, i molri na vavayan mada za sazo zato isalem intaw na kolang mokowa, zi demaway kananto imaran na inaekan na Yēncomin veray kanta papiya.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

pyu: na trao papiya sahar kanato pinowaayaran ni molri na vavayan to powaayaran, kazowan na trao na tremima' kana kamangolr zi kiyo, kazowan na zowa patalrama kanato tinosasiyaw.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

pyu: to tinosasiyaw na pa'at maw na to ina'avay kinaveras salaw imaran, olra ziya izo na dinero pinowayan za longan nato 'alom na vavoy. nato liyolran mokezeng a kazowan na trao, na trao papiya zowa kana niniyam pinowaayaran mowayara.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

pyu: no demadero i molri na vavayan mo, kazo ko i ngidiran demadaolr kana trao. kazo ko i saninin kematamoni 'emoy'oy, "na kolang mo niniyam isalem 'azi pinowayan za patremel pakonamon alamo trima'!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

pyu: naniyam inaniwan na eman ziya mo dika moniwan, marengay i molri na vavayan mo, "kana olra o na polraalrang. "
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

pyu: kanini na wayway, monadam ko lra kana to isasalem maw na inaekan na kazazalraman, zi miinlrangan ko lra kanini na powaayaren meniwan nato olepan.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

pyu: mena'o ko lra kani imo na vavayan nato ikasahar kana kinawatranan na akanen, salaw ko kemaatras semangal zako anger.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

pyu: meredek ko i takesiyan a pitowa toki harem kana wari.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

pyu: kemiyarakaz lra temakesi, mosavak na sinsi kana talrevaw, kema na pancang, "katikezir! songal!"
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

pyu: a temakesi mi mo, to panadamaw mi kana sinsi za aiyopan. kananta piningaiyan.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.

pyu: itoros mi kana sinsi miyop, zi semenay mi kana senay na aiyopan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

pyu: kana wariwari mokowa ko i takesiyan, kana wariwari menadanadam ko kanata piningaiyan, rarengay ko pakinger kani inani.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

pyu: i Asing to ngadan ni amalri
i Sonay to ngadan ni inani.
olra i ivalri, i Singkay nanto ngadan, moketrep misama' za saya nanto 'ami harem.
english: I have a brother, his name is Singkay, he is 11 years old.

pyu: mokasa mi temakesi kana maresan na takesiyan.
english: We study in the same school.

pyu: sahar mi semenay iniyam i ivalri na ma'inayan.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

pyu: sahar ko melrangolrangoya no katalaolepan, marelrang mi saroma'enan mokowa melrangolrangoya.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

pyu: sahar ko malrazam za vekal za 'ali'an, karowa mi mokasa semenasenay zi melrangolrangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

pyu: i inko, i amalri, i inani, i ivalri na ma'inayan zi i ivalri na vavayan mokasa mi kazo.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

pyu: tihasar i amalri, a kinsas i intaw.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

pyu: varivariw i inani, a ising i intaw.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

pyu: kana katalaolepan no deron moromaroma' mi i zekalr.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

pyu: mokasa mi mokowa kikakiyasa iniyam na ivalri.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
I like our family very much.

pyu: marelrang mi iniyam i inani mokowa mozangiya harem kana wari.
english: I went out with my mother today.

pyu: tremangiyangiya na lingatr a 'oninan, 'azi vi'as zi 'azi lritek na wari, say na vali mo, valiyan.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

pyu: kemayan mi kana tralotralon mekan za pang, to 'oninay mi kana 'onin, salaw sadeko.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

pyu: a piya kare'alri, demoni' na lingatr.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

pyu: kiomalr ko kani inani, kemoda zi demoni' na lingatr?
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

pyu: kema i inani, kamawan za zazowa a variw.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

pyu: oniyan za kotrekotrem na lingatr, mopatraran lra na vito'en.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

pyu: kiyami ko kana vito'en i dalan a mowaroma' mi.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

pyu: kiyalrimayan za 'azi zowa na variw, maranger ko ziya mokowa mozangiya.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

pyu: olra nanko takesiyan i ngidiran i kaniyam, kana wariwari ziya kemakawang ko mokowa i takesiyan, zi kemakawang moroma'.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

pyu: 'azi ma'izang naniyam takesiyan, kaitayan na temakakesi, marekalrazam mi mapiya.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

pyu: na temakakesi ziya, mareparazok i renarenazan, mokasa malimali, mazayazayar.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

pyu: maidap mi kana wariwari ziya, niyam idapay temolre'ay na talrevaw.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

pyu: olra na trao mokowa mitrola za lataw, olra na maidap za dare'.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

pyu: niyam idapay ziya i poyopoyong kana takesiyan, marepowalraalrang mi mapiya, mokirongetr na takesiyan kana wariwari.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

pyu: moroma' ko i zekalr mokowa mozangiya kani imo na ma'inayan a daman.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

pyu: sawariyan mi lra 'azi marepana'o, salaw ko sare'er kanintaw.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

pyu: mena'o i imo kaninko, to payasaw ko paekan za taramonah, zi to pa'aoway za korisepa.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

pyu: salaw tavo' to sinalem na taramonah ni imo, imaran.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

pyu: sahar ko 'emao to korisepa ni imo, 'inava no 'emao ta.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

pyu: kare'alriyan lra, mokasa mi iniyam i imo na vavayan demero za kare'a'alriyan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

pyu: demero za sazo za kare'a'alriyan i imo olra a volraw, a terokok, a siyak zi a semoli.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pyu: piya kare'alri, mokowa mi i sayheng kikolanga.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

pyu: melak za sazo za vorasi, za vo'ir zi za rogiyo, orongo moroma' kema veray kaninko.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

pyu: kay ko lra kema ko zi zowa lra mozangiya no masalr lra ko kowayaw na imolri.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

pyu: to pilralrangaw mi kana sinsi mokowa i tongwoyoan harem, motorik mi i solray tremima' za kippo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

pyu: mosavak mi i tongwoyoan mo, merengay na sinsi: "i ngawayan mo a 'aya'ayam, i likozan mo, a onaonan. owa na'o inmo mapiya.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

pyu: makaod ko za onan, semeneng 'azi ko nana'o za onaonan.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

pyu: mena'o ko za sazo za 'ayam, kazo valriiviiyan kana kawi, mena'o ko ziya za 'alretro kazo kana kawi to vowang alrope'.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

pyu: olra a zo, a eva zi a likolraw, 'azi ko ziya mena'o kanani na haramhaman, salaw ko semangal harem.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

pyu: sazo ko sinasing harem, pana'o kani ama zi kani ina.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

pyu: no masalr kowarelrang ko kani ama zi kani ina mokasa zowa.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

pyu: kanini na kasede'an, marelrang mi iniyam i ivalri mokowa mozangiya kani amalri na maralrak.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

pyu: kemay mi i Tayhok moitras za kisiya mokowa i Valangaw.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

pyu: meredek lra i Valangaw, i amalri na maralrak na mipalizing zowa kitrevonga kaniyam.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

pyu: kazo mi kana powarikanan, to pilralrangaw mi ni amalri na maralrak temavor za takolris zi moitras za eva.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

pyu: a karaov, marelrang mi mokowa i tokay keraviya.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

pyu: sazo a palizing i tokay, semeneng miotobay mi mokowa i kazo.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

pyu: a mowaroma' mi, to trakawaw naniyam otobay zi moitras mi za bas moverok.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

pyu: harem, moroma' mi lra i Tayhok, 'azi mi malrazam za to atrevongay lra nanto otobay?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

pyu: a lralrak mi ziya kaazo mi i Molivelivek, a temakesi mi lra moasalr mi mokowa kazowa i Tawyoan, kazo mi i tokay movaaw.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Mulivelivek. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

pyu: temakesi ko lra kana daygak, mokowa ko menadanadama za mikireeman kana kakowayanan kana Yoancomin, malrazam ko lra kana Yoancomin i Taiwan olra to kakowayanan a marekamelrimelri.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

pyu: semeneng, mokasa ko kani ivalri na ma'inayan mokowa kiyomalra kana dawdawan i zekalr. maranger mi malrazam za naniyam kokowayanan.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

pyu: walo polo' lra to 'ami na dawdawan, mawmo, maresan maralralrak ziya no mena'o ta.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

pyu: kiyomalr ko kanintaw za sayho o za emaeman ngai. dalos no temarapinoyomayan i intaw. sayho temarabonon, temarapayrang, zi temaradipong.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in pinuyumayan, as well as Bunun, Hokkien and Japanese.

pyu: ko kiyomalray i intaw mo, malrazam ko lra za a lralrak ziya i intaw mo menanadam za ngai za Dipong. a Bonon to 'azin, malrazam i intaw za sazo a Payrang i kiyakaronan zi sayho merengay za kemani sazo za ngai.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

pyu: mazayazayar mi mo, merengay na dawdawan za sazo a kinadaman za volrtrengan za pa'alropan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

pyu: ara 'azi patolro'ay mi malrazam naniyam kiningeran zi, olra naniyam soci na semasing. marowa mi ziya kingkinger.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

pyu: 'azi ko kamalrazam zanta kakowayanan a lralrak ko ziya. maira ko saema kaninta Yoēncomin.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

pyu: no kamalrazaman ko sazo lra mo, marakatatena' a pinoyomayan ko, a kinipilimi'an ko, zi a trao za mamatras.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a pinuyumayan is unique and something to be proud of.

pyu: kanini na kararaovan, waroma' lra i wadilri na ma'inayan.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

pyu: mokasa ko kani imolri na vavayan mokowa i iciba tremima'a za terokok. paadang mi demoro za imaran za kararaviyan veray kani wadilri na ma'inayan.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
