pyu: melavat mi kana menaniwan kana kolang mo, sazo na kolakolang na vokalan ziya.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

pyu: tremima' mi za takongkong, za tanovan, zi za ninzing.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

pyu: kema izo na tawki i ngidiran kana menaniwan kana inaekan na vowa' "tavo' nanko re'a zi na lopas. trima' za saema mo."
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

pyu: tremima' mi za re'a zi za lopas.
melavat mi kana menaniwan kana 'alom mo, merengay na tawki, "tratrima' o za eman? semver zi ma'izang na terokok harem. saya mo, telowa leman."
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

pyu: kapazangalan kema i imolri na vavayan. to kiyomalray na tawki, "karowa madolo saema?"
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

pyu: mawmo kema na tawki madolo lra. 'azi ta marakadolo lra.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

pyu: kema na tawki na 'odar, alamo trima'i ninko volraw. ma'izang zi semver ninko volraw.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

pyu: talalikozan lra mo, tremima' mi lra za terokok zi za volraw. moroma' mi demero lra za saeto za iropan.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

pyu: padingwa moroma' i wadilri na ma'inayan zi merengay maherareher 'azi marowa semede' na hitay. palro masalr kana sasede'an mo. karowa ko lra moroma'.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

pyu: sazo ko dinerowan lra kema i imolri na vavayan, vinayo mapiya mokasaya ta mekan.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

pyu: demaolr mi za wadadiyanan, mokasa ta mekana za karaviyan za merevawan.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

pyu: olra ko sanadaman a sasa, mingadan kani Kolas kema. marayas malaalalop morong za emaeman.
english: I have a classmate named Kulas, he often forgets to bring things.

pyu: no temakesi ta mo, kivolas i initaw za impis, za aitrol, za vavalrayan kana sanadaman.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

pyu: no parasan, no parepowan, no paretelon mo, taw pavolasay za emaeman na nintaw.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

pyu: mawmo, olra to kakowayanan na kowatreng, marayas 'azi pavavoliyas to kinavolasan.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

pyu: talikozakozan lra mo, 'azi lra mowai pavolas a trao za emaeman kanintaw.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

pyu: kana saya wari mo, mokasakasa ta mapiya mokowa mozangiya.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

pyu: maranger mokowa motralona i Kolas kana kalidalanan, mawmo malalop morong za aitrolan.
english: On the way, Kulas wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

pyu: kivolas i intaw za aitrolan kana sanadaman, mawmo tremovang a trao kanintaw za 'azi ko morong i inko.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

pyu: mahelr zi matrangis i Kolas. 'ilremes zi merengay, "kemoda zi 'azi mowai a trao pavolas za aitrolan kaninko."
english: Kulas burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

pyu: merengay na sanadaman kanintaw, halrana 'azi mowai o morong ziyanay, zi 'azi o pavaveliyas na emaeman na pavolas kanino.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

pyu: a dadaman, meredek i Kolas i takesiyan semavalr, to paveliyasanay lra ni Kolas za emaeman kana kinivolasan na sanadaman.
english: The next day at school, Kulas arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

pyu: irayan kema i Kolas kanantaw sanadaman, zi no kaidaidan mo, 'azika'a'azi ko morong za emaeman lra. lrayowan kema ko kanimo za mowai pavolas za emaeman kaninko.
english: Kulas apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

pyu: a ma'alrop i amalri i zekalr.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

pyu: a lralrak ko ziya mo, mitazaw zi mikowang mowapatraran no 'aremeng i amalri zi i amalri na maralralrak.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

pyu: no eman mo a vavoy, no eman mo a nawan, no eman mo a 'anavang.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

pyu: to sasepadanay zi pa'a'atraranay na rawa kana zinekalranan i owasavakan kana zekalr.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

pyu: marayas ko sasakiyaw i amalri, maranger ko korelrang kani amalri mokowa 'emalropa.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

pyu: no ma'izang ko lra mo, to pilralrangaw ko lra kema ni amalri.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

pyu: sayho mipetrir penetrir za rawa na ma'inayan i zekalr. sayho demaway za sawail zi za totak nazo.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

pyu: sayho demaway za sawail i amalri. merengay i amalri, "papapetrir za 'anavang i ini. taran'oi to dinapalran na rawa. papowa ta za petrir kananto wakalr."
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

pyu: moramawan karowa dika mokasa kana ma'izangan mokowa 'emalropa, menadanadam ko demaway za petrir kana wawariwari. kadika tatena' mirawa ko petrir kema ko.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

pyu: mena'o i amalri mo, zi merengay kaninko, no kaidaidan mo, 'azika'a'azi o a motoma'alrop za kerevatan.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

pyu: ma'izang ko lra harem, ko parekaw ko kadalis zi valro', zi korelrang ko kani amalri mokowa penetrira.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

pyu: niyam pa'a'atraranay naniyam rawa kana zinekalrnan no moroma' mi i zekalr.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

pyu: merengay i amalri, sasongal ta kana temowamowan zato ipolo'em, to parevawaw ta za rawa za sasazo.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

pyu: powari ko mokowa i takesiyan a 'emanamanan.
english: I was late for school this morning.

pyu: a mokowa i takesiyan mo, malalop ko morong za lravatr.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

pyu: a temakesi mi mo, kipokasa ko za ko lralrang mena'o za valray.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

pyu: a kipatalram mi mo, tako pavolasay za impis zi aitrol za ko lralrang.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

pyu: marengay i sinsi kaninko no masalr mo dikadika marahan
nanko 'ali'an i sinkay to ngadan. alrak za pinoyomayan i intaw.
english: My good friend's name is sinkay, and he is also an pinuyumayan child.
We study together in the Likavung tribe.

pyu: marayas mi mokasa kingkinger to vinavatiyan na dawdawan na vativatiyan, sayho mi temarapinoyomayan mapiya.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the pinuyumayan proficiently.

pyu: tihasar zi semever ko, aloso zi varivariw i singkay.
english: I am tall and overweight, while singkay is short and thin.

pyu: salaw mivaawan i singkay, zi sahar mi mapiya kantaw.
english: singkay is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

pyu: 'a'ari'ariyan i takesiyan harem kana wari, maanay za sazo na marepakowakowa i takesiyan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

pyu: olra a makakezeng za tali, tremapi'i / 'eresor za mali, pavekas, mowarak zi papana 'an.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

pyu: a pavekas ko mo, koretapelra' ko, ko tozo modara' / modamok za sazo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

pyu: mawmo marahan ko, zi patrotro mongawayan pavekas.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

pyu: meredek ko kana raredekan mo semangal na trao mapiya.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

pyu: ara 'azi ko moelak za sanga, mawmo salaw ko semangal, 'alra na piya ko lra kana mare'ari'ari.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

pyu: marelrang mi iniyam i amalri mokowa mozangiya kani ama na maralrak a daman.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

pyu: mavoli' to kowi ni ama na maralrak.
a temolre'ay kana sa'ov i intaw mo, motani kemay kana sa'ov.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

pyu: miinorong za 'alom na hong zi za poran i amalri veray kani ama na maralrak.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

pyu: i inko zi i ama na maralrak mazayazayar mi i kiya'ezengan, marengay za sazo za vativatiyan i intaw.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

pyu: a owaverok ko mo, tihasar o lra, zi marekavangsar o lra kema kaninko i ama na maralrak.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

pyu: marengay ko, "no 'inava lra to kowi ni ama na maralrak mo, alamo ziya i kaniyam mozangiya."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

pyu: kazo kana 2022 'ami, pakaygi na sého kana karowa posavak za to ngadan na 'atayan i mibonsiyo na Yécomin.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

pyu: kiomaomalr ko lra kani Avarang mawna vangesaran i zekalr na sawariyan kiyami pakirev kana sého za "posavakaw za to ngadan na 'atayan." i mibonsiyo.
english: I interviewed Avarang, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

pyu: kazo kana kiomaomalran mo, pakalrazam kaninko zato pinarevowa' to ngadan, zi kirekalrazam ko to niroma'enan, zi nanto zekalr.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

pyu: kiomalr ko kantaw kemoda zi marokerang patrotro kana powavalis za ngadan, a awatr ziya na ipovalray 'azi 'inava ziya maw?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

pyu: marengay kaninko i intaw, 'alrana pimanayaw za valray na minkok 'azi karowa patolre'ay paredek za to ngadan, no venavina a trao kantaw mo "izo i... eman" kema, zi mawna kemazo mopana lra a kalikeliked na sime'an na ngai.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \izu i... eman

pyu: marengay i Avarang, "na vinavalray kananto valray na Yéncomin na ngadan mo maw tatena' nanta ngadan. nanko ngadan paroveli kananta 'inalrayan, nanta niroma'enan, nanta kinayanan, kiyalriman kana kazowan ta mawan atrevong to ngadan i intaw."
english: Avarang said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

pyu: a daman marelrang mi iniyam i molri na vavayan mokowa kana kazowan na trao powayar meniwana, i molri na vavayan mo miinorong za sazo za to sinalem na kolang, zi demaway ziya kana imaran na akanan na Yéncomin veray kana mapiyapiya.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

pyu: sahar mapiya to powaayaran meniwan ni i molri na vavayan, kazowan na trao na tremima' to kamangolr zi la'ola'osan, zi kazowan na trao na temalram to inevel na iropan.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

pyu: salaw imaran to dinero na pa'at zi tinaveras, olra ziya na 'alom za vavoy to pokasayaw za tana' demero, kazowan na lavang na mokezeng kananto ngolringolran, zowa motorika mapiya kana powaayaran meniwan i kaniyam.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

pyu: no demero za eman i molri na vavayan mo, kazo ko i saninin demadaolr kana lavang, kematamoni ko 'emoy'oy i ngaydiran, "taw sinalem na lolang peniya, 'azi pinowatremel, kadika alamo tremima'a mo!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

pyu: dika mi piya meniwan naniyam emaeman, "'alrana mao i ino na powalrang." kema i molri na vavayan.
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

pyu: ini na kahowahowan mo, kipanadam ko lra kanizo na tematelriw ziya i dare' kana Yécomin zi kalrazaman za akanan, pawnong atalram lra to olepan za powayar meniwan.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

pyu: mena'o lra kani i molri na vavayan to kinasahasahar na akanan na trongolran, paremamatras ko zi salaw ko semangal.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

pyu: a pito walowan i, moka ko i takesian a oninan.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

pyu: owangesall mi lla temakesi. mosabak i takakesian na sinsi. "karetigir driya! semongala ta!" kema na kemakedreng dra risarisan.
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

pyu: a temakakesi mi i, to paladamaw mi kana sinsi temarapoyoma dra aaipan.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Pinuyumayan language of numbers.

pyu: korenang mi kana sinsi maip. semenay mi kana senay na aaipan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

pyu: sadro ko niladaladaman na ngai na tinarapoyoma.
english: I have learned many Pinuyumayan languages.

pyu: moka ko i takesian aw meladaladam ko temarapoyoma kana wawariwari. rarengay ko pakillengaw kan ina.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Pinuyumayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

pyu: i Asing to ngalad kan namalli.
i Igan to ngalad kan nanalli.
misasa i baelli na mainayan. i Konas to ngalad. moketrep miasma dra saya to ami garem.
english: I have a brother, his name is Kunas, he is 11 years old.
We study in the same school.

pyu: sagar mi semenay kay baelli na mainayan.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

pyu: sagar ko mellangoy. an kasedean i, saromaenan mi moka mellangoya.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

pyu: sagar ko kirekalladram dra ngidrangidrayan. karowa mi sallangan semenay aw mellangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

pyu: i namalli, i nananlli, i baelli na mainayan, i baelli na babayan aw koyko i, mokasa mi kikadro.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

pyu: asatr i namalli, a kinsas i namalli.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

pyu: idriidriwan i nanalli. a ising i nanalli.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

pyu: an kasedean dra kadenonan i takesian i, moroma mi i drekall.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

pyu: korenang ko kana baelli moka kitabillaellaa.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

pyu: sagar ko kaniyam trao i sabak.
english: I like our family very much.

pyu: marenang ko kan nanalli moka mowadrangiya a oninan.
english: I went out with my mother today.

pyu: tremangiya na langitr a oninaninan. adri llitek aw adri bias na wari. salaw ayaw na bali.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

pyu: kadro mi kana tralowalon mekan dra mēn-paw. an to kadaway mi i, salaw mi sadeko.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

pyu: paelipas dra karealliyan i, midraradrarang na kotrem i langitr.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

pyu: ko kiyomallay i nanalli dra, "daw midraradrarang na kotrem i langitr?"
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

pyu: aremeng lla i, oniyan dra kotrem i langitr. mopatraran lla na trior.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

pyu: a mowaroma mi i dalan i, kianon ko kana trior.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

pyu: adri padradrowai na bariwan. maranger ko driya moka mowadrangiya!
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

pyu: adri matrina naniyam takesian. aw adri kadrowan na temakakesi. marekaladam mi peniya.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

pyu: na temakakesi piniya i, maradrok dar i renarenadran. mokasakasa malinay dra mali aw madradrayar.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

pyu: na sinsi driya i, korekasa kaniyam malinay. kamawan dra saromaenan na takesian.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

pyu: sasellap mi kana wawariwari. naniyam sasellapi pakasalesal i takakesian.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

pyu: ollaya a miyasama a trao moka emitrola kana lataw. ollaya a miyasama a trao moka semellapa.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

pyu: moka mi driya semellapa kana repoyopoyongan i takesian. karepanini mi dra kiyakaronan aw mokasakasa mi kikaron. salaw semalesal i takesian kana wawariwari.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

pyu: moka ko i drekall kirepanaowa kan molli na mainayan a daman.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

pyu: paetreng mi lla adri marepanao. masopeng ko kantaw.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

pyu: menao i molli na mainayan kanko i, to pakanay ko dra taramonag aw to patrekelay ko dra kolisepa.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

pyu: dalleo to sinalem na taramonag kan molli na mainayan. salaw imaran i!
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

pyu: sagar ko kanto kolisepa kan molli na mainayan. imaran i!
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

pyu: a karealliyan i, karaabel mi dra karealliyan kan molli na babayan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

pyu: marekamenimeni to inabelan na karealliyan kan molli na babayan. ollaya a koraw, a terekok, a siyak. aw ollaya driya a tamorarang.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pyu: peniya mi karealli i, moka mi i bakabak kikolanga.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

pyu: mabak dra sadro dra bonga, dra boir aw dra logiw. to pakakasowan kanko moroma.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

pyu: "owaborek ko lla. an masall i, dradrowa ko driya kirepanaowa kanemo." ko kayaw na molli.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

pyu: to pillangaw mi kana sinsi moka kana nanaowan dra garamgaman a oninan. kadro mi i salikidr motorik tremima dra ritos.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

pyu: mosapak mi i sabak kana nanaowan dra garamgaman i, "i ngangowayn i, a ayaayam. i likodran i, a onaonan. moymo na moka menaowa." kema na sinsi.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

pyu: minedang ko dra onan. driyama, adri ko moka menaowa dra onaonan.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

pyu: menao ko dra sadro dra ayaayam. balriibiiyan kana kawi i isatr. menao ko driya dra lleo. allope drato bowang kana kawi.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

pyu: kana nanaowan dra garamgaman i, ollaya a zo, a ba aw a lilollaw. adri ko driya menao kanadri na garamgaman. menao ko lla garem i, panaan ko dra semangal i!
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

pyu: sadro ko siniyasingan. a pananao kan namalli kay nanalli.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

pyu: an masall i, kowarenang ko driya kan namalli kay nanalli drowa.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

pyu: kandri na kasedean i, marenang mi kan baelli na babayan moka i Balangaw kirepanaowa kan namalli na maranank.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

pyu: kemay mi i Taipe moisatr dra igiw moka i Balangaw.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

pyu: meresek mi i Balabgaw i, mipalidring drowa i siyataw kitrebonga kaniyam i namalli na maranak.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

pyu: a kadro mi kana powarikanan dra gong i, to pillangaw mi kan namalli na maranak moka pakana dra siri aw korepadreka dra ba.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

pyu: a aremeng lla i, moka mi i sinki mekana.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

pyu: sadro a palidring i sinki. driyama, miotobay mi moka kadro.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

pyu: a mowaborek mi i, mokalladram mi lla dra to tratrawaw dra trao na otobay. aw moisatr mi lla dra bas moroma.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

pyu: moroma mi lla i Taipe garem. moatrebongay lla nay to otobay kan namalli na maranak?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

pyu: a temakesi ko lla kana ta-siyē i, moka ko temakesia drato kakowayana dra Yoēn-co-min. malladram ko lla kana Yoēn-co-min-co i Taiwan i, marekamenimeni aw dalaman to kakowayanan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

pyu: driyama, a kasedean dra kadenonan kandri na ami. koyko aw i baelli na mainayan i, moroma mi i drekall kiyomaomall dra maidrangan. maranger mi malladram drata kakowayanan.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

pyu: makawalo lla to ami kana maidrang. amawna, kamawan driya dra alabalabat an menao ta.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

pyu: ko kiyomallay na maidrang dra, "a manamanay no kinasaigowan na ngaiyan?" salaw dalos an temarapoyoma. saigo driya temarapairang, temaraamis aw temaradripong.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in puyuma, as well as Hokkien, Pangcah and Japanese.

pyu: peniya ko kiyomall i, mokalladram ko lla. a makiteng driya na maidrang i, meladaladam temaradripong. aw a Amis to katagowin. to llang kikaron i, a Pairairang. driyama, sadro to kisaigowan na ngaiyan.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Pangcah, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

pyu: a madradrayar mi kana maidrang i, benabati dra sadro dra kallalladrman kana bolletrenganan drato kakowayanan dra paallopan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

pyu: alla, adri mi marowa paseket mokalladram drato nirarengay i, ollaya naniyam lo-ing kana so-ci. karowa mi driya masamasall paseket killengallengaw.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

pyu: a makiteng ko driya i, adri ko malladram drata kakowayanan. salaw ko migela rarengay dra "a Yoēn-co-min ko." kema.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

pyu: marekasadro ko kinalladraman i, pananaan ko lla a Piniyomayan kema ko kemiyanger. a salaw kirekamelli aw a paaillingan lla dra trao.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Piniyumayan is unique and something to be proud of.

pyu: an karaoraob i, owaroma ko wadi na mainayan.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

pyu: marenang mi kan emo na babayan moka i iciba tremimaa dra terekok. aro aabel dra imaran dra kakerabian pangara kanko wadi na mainayan.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

pyu: melibat mi kana menaniwan dra kolang. sadro a mangangedean a kolakolang kana menaniwan dra kolang.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

pyu: tremima mi dra takongkong, dra tanoban aw dra ninzin.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

pyu: na menaniwan dra kalimodan i saninin na lawpan i, "dallreo ko pangodrall aw ko lopas. trima dra samaya i!" kema.
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

pyu: tremima mi dra pangodrall aw dra lopas.
melibat mi kana menaniwan dra patraka. "tratrima yo dra manay? olalanean na terekok garem. tolowa leman na saya." kema na lawpan.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

pyu: padrangal lla dradro kema i emo na babayan. "karowa yo melegetr drato trima?" kema kiyomall kana lawpan.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

pyu: amawna, "madolo lla. adri ko karowa melegetr." kema na lawpan.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

pyu: na lawpan i saninin i, "alamo trima kananko koraw. matrina aw madolo ko koraw." kema.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

pyu: likodran i, tremima mi dra terekok aw dra koraw. moroma mi i, abelaw a sadro a iropan.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

pyu: paetreng mi mengangara. aw aremeng lla na wari.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

pyu: padingwa ko wadi na mainayan dra, "padokedok pakalladram dra adri karowa semede na hitay. an masall kana kasedean i, owaroma ko lla." kema
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

pyu: "sakowadrowadro ko inabel na iropan. daollo ta trao aw mokasaya ta mekan i!" kema i emo na babayan.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

pyu: naiyam daollaw a niromaenan drowa i orma. mokasakasa mi kerabi dra kalloba dra aekanan.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

pyu: ollaya ko risarisan a misasa. i Langotr to ngalad. marayas abalo kemaso dra manay driya dar.
english: I have a classmate named Langutr, he often forgets to bring things.

pyu: an temakakesi ta dar i, kibolas kana risarisan dra tratrori, dra iyasaos. adri i, dra tatilillan.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

pyu: pariyasall, parepowan, paretelon. to pabolasay dra trao peniya.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

pyu: amawna, adri inaba to kakowayanan. an kibolas dra manay driya i, marayas dar adri parebabeliyas.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

pyu: likodran lla i, adri maranger pabolas dra manay driya a trao kantaw.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

pyu: ollaya a saya wari. sallangallangan mi paniya moka mowadrangiya.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

pyu: a kadro mi driya i dalan i, maranger moka i powatriyan i Langotr. amawna, abalo kemaso kana kadopo na aitrol.
english: On the way, Langutr wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

pyu: kibolas dra risarisan kana kadopo na aitrol i, to tobangaw dra trao peniya dra, "adri ko kemaso i!"
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

pyu: to aledoan kan Langotr i, matrangis. salaw illemes aw, "daw adri mo mowai pabolas kanko kana kadopo na aitrol kema?
english: Langutr burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

pyu: to babatiaw dra risarisan. amao yoyo na adri kemakaso. aw an kibolas yo dra manay driya i, adri yo parebabeliyas!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

pyu: dra dadaman i, semaball moka i takasian i Langotr. to kinibolasan na manay driya i, to parebeliyasanay kana risarisan.
english: The next day at school, Langutr arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

pyu: semongal kana risarisan i Langotr aw, "igelayan! likodran i, koykoya na kemaso dra manay driya." "adro a kiyabolas ko kanemo i, mo pabolasay ko dra manay driya. semangalan kemaya ko driya kanemo." kema.
english: Langutr apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

pyu: a paaallop i namalli kadri drekall.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

pyu: a makiteng ko driya. i namalli kay namalli na maranak i, mopatraran an aremeng dar. kemaso dra tadraw aw dra kowang.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

pyu: an idenan i, mikinasowan drato pinaallopan na rawa moroma.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

pyu: an noma i, a baboy; an noma i, a nawan. an asowa dar i, a anabang.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

pyu: an meredek kana salikidr i drekall nadro i, to parepaniniaw na rawa lla. aw to paninianay dra drinekallanan.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

pyu: marayas ko beningabinga kan namalli dra kowarenangan moka paallopa.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

pyu: "an matrina yo lla i, ti pillangaw yo lla moka." kema i namalli.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

pyu: na mainayan i drekall i, mipetrir moka penetrira. saigo demaway kana petrir na sawail aw kana petrir na treellaw dra barasa nadro.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

pyu: saigo demaway kana petrir na sawail i namalli. a papetriran dra anabang kema. ta paseketay menaonao to dinapallan kana rarawa. aw ta tekeranay kanto dalan kana rarawa na petrir.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

pyu: ko marangeran korenang dra maidrang moka paallopa i, meladaladamm ko demaway dra petrir kana wawariwari aw palamo ko saigo. marowa lla mitiyo dra rawa ko petrir.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

pyu: menao i namalli kemadri aw, "likodran i, kaamao yoyo na salaw makeser na miyaallop." kema kanko.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

pyu: matrina ko lla garem. ko alayanay ko bakenan aw ko papana. korenang ko kan namalli moka paallopa.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

pyu: moroma mi i drekall i, naniyam sepadanay dra drinekallanan na rawa.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

pyu: "sasongal ta dra temowamowan drato iyaalaw aw to iyaberay. marowa ta mitiyo dra sadro dra rawa." kema i namalli.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

pyu: powari ko moka i takesian a semalowan.
english: I was late for school this morning.

pyu: a maoka ko i takesian i, abalo ko kemaso dra kabang.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

pyu: a mongesalr mi temakesi i, mokasa ko kanko risarisan menao dra tilin.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

pyu: a palralrimaw mi i, to pabolasay ko dra tratrori aw dra iyasaos kanko risarisan.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

pyu: "sabasabalr maragan! adri lra kapowaari!" kema na sinsi kanko.
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

pyu: i Maywan to ngalad kan ngidralri. to walrak dra Pinoyomayan.
english: My good friend's name is Maywan, and he is also an Pinuyuma child.

pyu: mokasa mi temakesi kana drekalr i Poyoma.
english: We study together in the Puyuma tribe.

pyu: marayas mi mokasa kilrangaw dra maaidrangan benabati dra batibatiyan. sayaigoan mi temarapoyoma.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Puyuma proficiently.

pyu: asatr ko aw olane ko. adare aw idriidriwan i Maywan.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Maywan is short and thin.

pyu: salikesik i Maywan. sagar a trao peniya kantaw.
english: Maywan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

pyu: marepaokaoka dra rarenadran i takesian an oninan. sadro a marepaokaoka i takesian.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

pyu: olraya a makedrekedreng dra towaso, a semalrepad dra mali, a moarak aw a penapana.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

pyu: a kababekas ko i, malrado ko aw modadamok dra sadro ko songal.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

pyu: maretigir ko aw patrotro ko kabekas.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

pyu: palro ko kana papalrowan i, maysemangalan a trao peniya.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

pyu: adri ko moalak dra asanga. amawna, salaw ko semangal! ko pasekadraw ko kinorenangan na marepaokaoka.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

pyu: a daman i, marenang mi kan namalri moka kirepanaowa kan namalri na maranak.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

pyu: korepanana to dapalr kan namalri na maranak.
a semaseket i, motani kemay i saosaob taytaw.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

pyu: kemaso drato patraka dra gong aw dra poran i namalri. to berayay i namalri na maranak.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

pyu: kadro mi i kiyaedrengan madradrayar kan namalri na maranak. benabati dra sadro dra batibatiyan.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

pyu: a mowaborek mi i, "asatr yo lra aw bangesar yo lra!" kema semakal kanko i namalri na maranak.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

pyu: kana 2022 amiyan i, madrayadrayar na ceng-vo drato pakomaowan dra trao. karowa lra potililr drato ngalad na tinarainanowayan kema.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

pyu: moka ko kiyomalra dra bangesaran i drekalr. i Insing Babotrolr i, paetreng lra to kiniamiyan kana ceng-vo dra tatililran drato ngalad na tinarainanowayan kana pakomaowan dra trao.
english: I interviewed Insing Babutrulr, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

pyu: marekakoret mi kandri na kasedean dra saliyosan. aoka ko kantaw marekiomaomalra.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

pyu: a marekiomaomalr mi i, to babatiaw ko dra kemay isowa aw to paowayan kanto ngalad. to pilrangaw ko driya moka marekaladama kanto trao i sabak aw kanto drekalr.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

pyu: "daw merokedrang yo dra aasalran kano ngalad? adri inaba to itatililr kana pakangowayan amaw?" kema ko kiyomalr kantaw.
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

pyu: "an temaralotiya i, adri marowa penatedrelr pongalad kanko ngalad. olraya driya a trao pongalad kanko dra {In-ciēn-seng}. aw modaway a sadro a kasaerowan." kema kanko.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \In Xian Sheng

pyu: "na tinarainanowayan temililr na ngalad i, pananaan lra dra naniyam ngalad. tatapes dra naniyam maonan, dra naniyam niromaenan aw dra naniyam pakomaowan dra trao. marowaya marekakadrowan na atrebong drato kangaladan a niromaenan." kema i Insing Babotrolr.
english: Insing Babutrulr said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

pyu: a daman i, marenang mi kan molri na babayan moka i iciba kana naniwanan meniwana. kemaso dra sadro drato sinaleman na kolakolang i molri na babayan. aw semanga driya drato aekanan dra Inanowayan a sasepadan dra trao.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

pyu: sagar a trao peniya drato naniwanan kan molri na babayan. kadrowan a trao tremima dra kamangolr aw dra tipatipayan. aw kadrowan a trao drowa temalrama drato inabel na iropan.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and Slender Amaranth, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

pyu: to sinangaan na binariyaw aw na bineraberas kan molri na babayan i, salaw imaran. olraya driya na terekok na niringering drato tralon kana kisiw. to arelr kana aekanan i, kemedrekedreng dra kadrowan dra labang drowa motorika kaniyam naniwanan.
english: The Bamboo leaf migao and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

pyu: an demadero dra aekanan i molri na babayan i, kadro ko i saninin kiyatrebong dra labang. merokedrang ko patrirebeng dra, "na kolakolang i, naniyam sinaleman peniya. adri pinoka dra powatremel. alamo! kamelamo trima a!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

pyu: garemaremay i, niwananay lra peniya na manay driya. "amao no pinolrangan a!" kema i molri na babayan kanko.
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

pyu: idri na lremak na meniwan i, mokalradram ko lra drato semaseberan dra Inanowayan aw dra kasaigowan drato aekanan dra Inanowayan. aw mitinalraman ko lra drato olepan kana naniwanan meniwan.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

pyu: menao ko kan molri na babayan drato lobisan kana aekanan na bolretrenganan. salaw ko semangal aw marowa ko pailring dra trao.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

at the foot of the mountain

pyu: i valri na vavayan/ i vao na vavayan
i valri na ma'inay/ i vao na ma'inay

english: the thing stuck between the teeth

at the foot of the mountain
take a stroll; take a walk
come in, come out, get out
peeling the bark of a tree
close your eyes; help someone to sleep
make water drain; make urine drain

it should be; it will be
